job overview:   the analyst, marketing analytics is responsible for analysis, measurement, and reporting for macy’s paid digital media channels – display, paid social, online audio and online video. this individual will provide analysis and insights to optimize performance of the media tactics. they will measure a/b test results and recommend move forward approach to media teams. the analyst will work collaboratively with media teams, marketing systems team, and macy’s media agency. perform other duties as assigned.   essential functions:  lead the application of insights to influence marketing strategies that drive measurable growth in digital media programs – display, social, retargeting, online audio, online video. aid in design, measurement, evaluation, and recommendations of a/b testing with the goal of optimizing roi and maximizing omnichannel sales for media channels. broaden scope of kpis for media channels. drive optimization based on customer centric metrics. standardize and automate ongoing reporting using tableau. work with marketing systems team to ensure data is passed correctly to enable analysis. includes defining tagging, qa of data, defining data requirements for new vendors, etc. create sales plans and benchmarks for media channels to aid in measuring success of the programs. identify business trends and shifts, and recommend data-driven responses and recommendations to the marketing organization. ultilize macy’s analytics toolset (hadoop, tableau, web analytics tools, media agency tools, etc.) to analyze and report on business results. regular, dependable attendance & punctuality.   qualifications:   education/experience: ba/bs degree in a quantitative field (mathematics, statistics, business, economics or other quantitative field preferred). 2+ years of experience using data to develop business insights and recommendations. experience analyzing performance of paid marketing programs (cpm and cpc). experience writing complex sql queries. familiarity with one or more of the following analytics tools: tableau, sas, r, ibm digital analytics, google analytics. proficient in microsoft word, excel and powerpoint.   communication skills: excellent interpersonal skills with ability to build relationships and effectively collaborate with partners across all levels of the company. strong communications skills (written/verbal) and presentation skills. mathematical skills:  basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and analytical skills.   reasoning ability:  must be able to work independently with minimal supervision and make sound decisions.   physical demands:  this position involves regular walking, standing, sitting for extended periods of time, hearing, and talking. may occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, or crouching. may involve close vision, color vision, depth perception, focus adjustment, and viewing computer monitor for extended periods of time. involves manual dexterity for using keyboard, mouse, and other office equipment. may involve moving or lifting items under 10 pounds.   other skills:  time management skills and ability to handle multiple projects with competing priorities. strong organizational skills and attention to detail. ability to build relationships and effectively manage internal customers demonstrated analytical and quantitative skills – skilled at analyzing and deriving meaningful insights out of complex data and translating that into actionable strategies.   work hours:  ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.   company profile:   as the fastest growing part of macy's inc. business, macys.com is achieving record sales and broadening our workforce. macys.com offers the entrepreneurial culture of a web business with the stability and support of the best brand in retailing. creativity and ingenuity partner with business acumen and tech savvy to build a unique business poised for substantial growth. if you're interested in being a part of that growth and want to know what it's really like to work at macys.com, get an inside look at http://ecommerce.macysjobs.com/   our employees have long-term opportunities and are encouraged to utilize their supervisors and human resources for cross-functional movement to further their careers. at macys.com we are committed to giving back to the community by partnering with local charitable organizations. by skillfully combining the power of digital technology and omnichannel integration with the best in retailing, macys.com is reaching new heights.   this job overview is not all inclusive. in addition, macy’s, inc. reserves the right to amend this job overview at any time. macy’s is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment. macy’s, inc. – including macy’s and bloomingdale’s – will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal convictions in a manner consistent with sfpc art. 49 and la mc ch.xviii art. 9.

who we are  founded in 2013, madison-reed is a prestige beauty brand empowering women with the ultimate hair-color hack. rather than settling for a suboptimal hair color "box" product or an expensive and time consuming salon visit - they provide her with a hair color experience she never thought possible: salon-gorgeous multi-tonal hair color with shine and softness, a no-smell low chemical ingredient profile, gold standard customer service with certified licensed colorists on call, cutting-edge diagnostic color matching technology, delivered to her door/on her schedule at a revolutionary price.  in addition to their at-home hair color product, madison reed recently announced the expansion of its new concept: madison reed color bars, that are expanding nationally to 20 stores by 2019. these color bars are designed for women who either need a little more hands-on assistance before doing their hair color at home, or for women who will always want assistance. color bars are the "un-salon" where clients can get salon-quality hair color at a fraction of the time and expense of a traditional salon, using our same great hair color formulations.  madison reed at-home hair color kits and color bars combined represents a two-pronged attack on the $15bn (us only) hair color market and a welcome innovation for millions of women who didn't think a better way was possible.  the above is what madison reed does, but what is more profound is their why. the company's proposition is an expression of a deep-founded belief of its founder, amy errett, who believes a confident woman is a beautiful woman and that women should confidently demand more because they deserve more, not just in hair color, but in their lives. she believes this so deeply that she named the company after her daughter, madison reed. consistent with "confident is the new beautiful", the company recently announced zero retouching in all advertising photography.  madison-reed is headquartered in san francisco and is backed by leading investors: norwest partners, true ventures, comcast ventures and maveron. the company is growing 70% year-over-year and is positioned for continued growth.  recent articles: madison reed just raised another $25million to open hair color bars across the u.s. ( https://techcrunch.com/2017/10/19/madison-reed-just-raised-another-25-million-to-open-hair-color-bars-across-the-u-s/ )  with dye jobs for just $45, hair color startup madison reed takes on $15 billion market ( https://www.forbes.com/sites/clareoconnor/2016/12/15/with-dye-jobs-for-just-45-hair-color-startup-madison-reed-takes-on-15-billion-market/ ) (forbes)  these ingenious at-home hair-color brands are disrupting the salon scam ( https://www.wsj.com/articles/these-ingenious-at-home-hair-color-brands-are-disrupting-the-salon-scam-1525273730 ) (wall street journal)  beauty brands glossier, curology, beautycounter, and madison reed make 2018 direct brands worth watching list ( https://www.cosmeticsdesign.com/article/2018/02/13/beauty-brands-glossier-curology-beautycounter-and-madison-reed-make-2018-direct-brands-worth-watching-list ) (cosmetics design)  the latest product to hit your doorstep? hair dye. ( http://fortune.com/2015/08/20/madison-reed-hair-dye/ ) (fortune)  the warby parker of hair color, madison reed, scores new funding and a cmo ( https://techcrunch.com/2017/02/09/the-warby-parker-of-hair-color-madison-reed-scores-new-funding-and-a-cmo/ ) (tech crunch)  madison reed commits to using "raw" photography ( https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/madison-reed-commits-to-using-raw-photography-300604325.html ) (pr newswire)  this beauty startup raised $25 million to defy the retail apocalypse and open stores across america ( https://www.businessinsider.in/this-beauty-startup-raised-25-million-to-defy-the-retail-apocalypse-and-open-stores-across-america/articleshow/61210182.cms ) (business insider)  madison reed bridges the brick-and-mortar divide ( https://www.pymnts.com/news/retail/2017/madison-reed-branches-into-brick-and-mortar-hair-dye-salons/ ) (pymnts.com)  who you are  you have a passion for performance marketing and are able to manage, analyze, and execute paid social ad campaigns. you are analytical, methodical and thoughtful, with the ability to articulate strategy and performance to executives and creatives alike, in a clear and concise manner. if you're ready to dive in, disrupt a huge category, do meaningful work, and make lasting connections, then this may be the right role for you!  what you'll do   plan, build, and execute paid social ad buys across facebook, instagram and pinterest provide data-driven and thoughtful analysis of strategy and performance to management and other cross functional partners advise creative team on creative best practices, insights and trends that will drive continued innovation in our best-in-class creative program partner with the digital experience team to analyze and optimize ads and down funnel conversion performance work with analytics team to tie deeper customer insights to social acquired customers and use that to inform future customer acquisition  skills we're excited about   2-4 years of experience running performance media on facebook, google, display or other channels. strong statistical understanding and highly analytical approach experience in working with large datasets and performing quantitative analysis ability to clearly and concisely communicate results and insights to management and creative teams well organized, meticulous about the details, and able to juggle multiple priorities a self-starter and proactive, positive thinker

marketing efforts, including developing and maintaining methods to track the health of marketing campaigns and paid/organically acquired users throughout their lifetime (ltv, cac, retention, and churn). the position is responsible for working closely with the marketing team, proactively informing them of opportunistic trends in consumer behavior as well as suggesting channel strategies to improve overall metrics. requirements own all marketing-centric consumer key performance indicators, including daily and weekly reporting to management and team members conduct daily analysis of profitability trends across marketing channels develop and maintain models for ltv, cac, retention and churn manage and improve attribution and tracking systems limit channel cannibalization develop sound experiments to test the overall viability of marketing strategies qualifications and skills 1-2+ years of experience in acquisition and general marketing analysis, preferably in the mobile space experience with analysis and data mining techniques in python, r, or equivalent language experience calculating / modelling ltv and cac awesome sql skills bachelor's degree in a quantitative field or relevant work experience experience with heap, adjust, looker, mixpanel, dbt, or redshift a plus benefits unlimited paid time off 100% medical coverage a stocked fridge & catered lunches twice weekly discounts on wine purchases we also learn about and explore the wonderful world of wine together on a regular basis through tastings and events. a passion for and interest in wine is helpful, but not required. about vivino trusted by millions to discover and buy the right wine every time vivino empowers people everywhere to enjoy wine to the fullest.  vivino is the world's largest online wine marketplace and most downloaded wine app, powered by a community of millions. vivino’s unique wine shopping experience uses community data to suggest personalized wine recommendations, making wine discovery fun, accessible, and effortless for wine drinkers of every level. the vivino app is available for download on android and apple devices. we are a fast paced, growing team with offices in san francisco, california and copenhagen, denmark. we also have teams around the world in: the uk, netherlands, italy, spain, germany, france, ireland and hong kong. our team is passionate about our core purpose - to empower people everywhere to enjoy wine to the fullest. we do that every day by building technology and leveraging data that puts the power back in the hands of the consumer. we do not see wine as a commodity, but as an offering of a cultural experience that was once out of reach for many but is now open to everyone. vivino’s five core values are:  always strive for better work applicable federal, state, or local law.

are you passionate about data and excited by how information enables sound decisions? b-stock is seeking a marketing analyst to join marketing team. reporting to the vp of marketing, this role will help the larger marketing organization make data-driven decisions across all activities.essential job duties and responsibilitiesadvise business partners with regards to patterns and relationships in the data to guide strategy and measure outcomeswork cross-functionally with the marketing and sales teams in analyzing a multitude of segments and uncovering actionable insightsuse data from multiple sources (marketo, salesforce, google analytics, etc.) to identify emerging markets, forecast marketing/sales trends and highlight opportunities for new initiativesrun statistical analysis and create predictive modelsassist with development of an internal analytics platformdesign, implement and measure experiments to determine the impact of new approaches developed within the marketing teamreport and understand business performance; identify ideas for improvementminimum qualifications, job skills, abilities2+ years of practical work or academic experience in analyticsbachelor’s degree in computer science/mathematics/statistics/data science or equivalent experience preferredproven expertise with data processing, statistical and analytical skillsability to develop and support automation, visualize, analyze, and communicate reporting to managementfocused, flexible, and a quick learnerwork well across different groups within an organizationjob type: full-timeeducation:bachelor's (preferred)

go-to-market analyst to participate and lead awareness and revenue generation programs for oracle cloud. with the industry’s most complete portfolio of integrated paas cloud offerings, we’re continuing to expanding our team with individuals who can help define and build programs that highlight oracle’s value and differentiation to target audiences across the globe. the individual will help drive outstanding results working closely with stakeholders across product marketing, corporate marketing, business development, and sales.  as a member of the platform as a service product marketing team, you will combine research, customer case studies, segmentation, positioning, and messaging to develop sales enablement tactics to fuel revenue growth. additionally, you will utilize your knowledge of digital marketing and social media to build awareness and engage our current and prospective customers. and, you will accurately measure, report, and share progress to develop best practices that can be leveraged across the team and across product lines.  what you’ll be responsible for: developing and manage integrated campaigns to support cloud revenue objectives. identifying sales enablement needs, monitor market trends, and competitive landscape. initiating and fostering relationships across sales team and regions. communicating differentiated functionality, unique advantages, and benefits into product marketing messages and sales enablement assets. delivering sales education content, including all aspects of a typical sales cycle from conversation initiation to customer nurture to customer presentation and close. collaborating with corporate marketing activities, including google keyword and digital marketing (website, seo, and 3rd party programs such as advertising or events). measuring and reporting campaign results and providing input on channel, content, and account-based marketing effectiveness.   key qualifications:  an expert with 3+ years of product marketing, demand gen, sales, or business development experience, ideally with cloud products designed for mid-market to enterprise businesses. the ability to work collaboratively across sales and marketing teams to ensure we create the right messaging, to the right audience, through the right promotional vehicles to exceed business objectives. strong quantitative and qualitative analytical and reporting abilities. self-motivated with ability to prioritize tasks and work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with high attention to detail. bachelor’s degree in business, marketing or related field (master’s degree is a plus)  recruiter contact: erin smith - erin.d.smith@oracle.com position location: oracle hq, redwood shores, california. this is not a virtual or remote role. travel requirement: <25% of time  as part of oracle’s employment process candidates will be required to complete a pre-employment screening process, prior to an offer being made. this will involve identity and employment verification, salary verification, professional references, education verification and professional qualifications and memberships (if applicable).   oracle supports workforce diversity and is an equal employment opportunity employer.   detailed description and job requirements  development and implementation of business plans, marketing strategy, and forecasts for a product/service or vertical market.  as a product analyst you will participate in every stage of the product life cycle to ensure product meets the needs of users. drive the implementation of programs in support of the marketing strategy, business plans, and forecasts for assigned product lines. maintains current status of customer specifications for existing and future products. identify, evaluate, and recommend marketing opportunities in support of product line objectives. drive product functionality delivering high quality product documentation. lead products through scheduled release assisting others to manage commitments and resources. measure and report progress and review deliverables.  job duties are varied and complex utilizing independent judgment. may have project lead role. demonstrated product/project management experience. excellent written and verbal communication. demonstrated product/project management experience. thrives in fast paced environment team player. experience using or implementing oracle, sap, or peoplesoft applications. 5 years related experience and ba/bs degree in marketing or technical major preferred.  oracle is an equal employment opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and protected veterans status or any other characteristic protected by law.

opentable's consumer marketing team is looking to hire a seasoned analyst with a knack for extracting insights from raw data, and a desire to craft how opentable drives diner growth and invests in marketing channels and campaigns. to be successful you are self-directed; have a background in analysis; are comfortable working with large datasets; have the ability to break down complex problems to their basic elements. this is a highly visible role so confidence and clarity in communicating to all audiences is critical.   your key responsibilities use quantitative and qualitative analysis to inform and influence business and marketing decisions partner with channel experts to establish and guide strategy and critical metrics by channel, evaluate marketing targets, inform marketing investment (level and placement), and find opportunities for growth conduct analyses not limited to cross-channel marketing, e.g. a/b or multivariate testing, marketing attribution; and/or customer analytics, e.g. lifetime value modeling, behavioral segmentation own and lead projects or work streams as relates to larger marketing and crm strategy, including identification of key issues, development of hypotheses, analysis, conclusions, and presentation of findings work with our data analytics team to define key data requirements and build robust reporting to answer key customer, marketing, and business strategy questions be the analytic authority for internal and external data sources and systems, standardize and reconcile data from disparate sources build and foster relationships with key business partners, helping them to structure solutions to data and business questions communicate findings and recommendations across departments and to executive leadership. requirements: 4 or more years of experience as a business or data analyst you have advanced data visualization and sql skills prior experience with internet marketing software packages a plus (e.g. google analytics, optimizely, mixpanel, etc.) you are experienced with business intelligence solutions, such as microstrategy or tableau strong business insight as well as high proficiency in analytical modeling skills, working understanding of statistics and statistical methods strong intellectual curiosity with the ability to think critically and strategically. you are able to structure a problem, hypothesize solutions, and dig into the data to figure things out excellent presentation skills; must be able to synthesize, articulate and effectively present complex data/analyses verbally or in written form in a variety of presentation settings (one-on-one, small and large groups, with peers, and senior management) project management skills; identify the business question, define project scope and timing, and manage partnership and communication with key stakeholders ba/bs degree in business, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline about our team:   we love introducing diners and restaurateurs to opentable and helping them get the most out of our service. we believe marketing is as much science as it is art. we are passionate about measuring results, and we see every campaign as an opportunity to learn. if you love producing programs that move the needle and have a real passion for dining out and helping restaurateurs succeed, we might have the role for you.   as an employee of opentable, you will be part of a global network that includes opentable and kayak's portfolio of metasearch brands including momondo, cheapflights, swoodoo, checkfelix and mundi. many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each other's strengths and insights. together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.   we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

with one big idea. since then, we've grown to over 1,500 employees, sold over 60mm devices, and built a health and fitness community across the globe. in fact, the fitbit community has taken enough steps to walk from the sun to pluto! offering award-winning products, a top-rated mobile app and an easy-to-use online dashboard, fitbit provides personalized experiences that help our users reach their goals. with a reenergized focus on innovative devices, interactive experiences, and enterprise health we are transforming the way consumers and businesses see health & fitness.   from your first steps as a fitbitter, you will be at the forefront of developing new products. our culture combines the spirit of startup with the perks of being public. we offer a competitive benefits package and amazing perks like unlimited snacks, friday happy hours, onsite workout classes, and a strong focus on a healthy work-life balance. as part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to grow your career, contribute your ideas to life-changing products and services, andabove allhave fun doing it.   fitbit's hq campus is located in the heart of san francisco with office locations in boston, san diego and around the world. think you've found your fit?   about the role:   the crm marketing analyst will be responsible for executing and reporting on customer and prospect facing marketing communications. the candidate will help define the company's audience targeting strategy, testing methodology, and measurement of marketing effectiveness. additionally, the candidate will assist in the development of tools, processes, and frameworks to further best practices and deliver operational efficiencies. the ideal candidate will have experience running crm marketing campaigns (ex. email) and programs. audience segmentation, targeting and campaign deployment, developing test and learn plans should come naturally to the. these concepts should be understood both at the individual campaign level as well as extended longitudinal marketing efforts.   the candidate should be data-driven and have a technical aptitude to partner with business and technology teams and will assist in optimizing business processes and managing campaign operations to maximize efficiencies and incorporate new technology and new data. the candidate will be detail-oriented and organized, capable of handling multiple projects at once, able to take direction, capable of dealing with ambiguity, and comfortable working with teams, vendors, and management.   responsibilities: providing campaign response metrics and post-performance insights to internal and external business partners, including senior management monitors conversion and response metrics by data source, demographic, geographic and behavioral information. assist in optimizing business execution processes as necessary work with technology and production teams to troubleshoot and resolve any data/campaign issues partner with other crm team members to optimize campaign execution approach to campaigns. set segments and filters for email campaigns in crm tools and qa business rules with team members to ensure accuracy of targeted content delivery. conducts continuous testing, analyzing and optimizing target criteria, content, forms, etc. to improve kpis (ex. increase open, click, lead, and conversion rates) develops a list hygiene program to reduce bounce rates, inactive subscribers and increase the overall email population. managing subscriber data, import and segmentation using a combination of email service provider tools (preferably exacttarget) and database queries. develop robust campaign documentation, including customer specific work instructions. about you: at least 3 years of experience in crm glassdoor is seeking an experienced marketing analytics manager to join our marketing operations team. the marketing analytics manager will be responsible for building marketing analytics infrastructure, processes, and dashboards that will inform decisions across the b2b marketing organization.  you will report to the director, marketing operations & analytics and work closely with marketing program managers to measure the efficacy of marketing initiatives, enable testing and optimization, and improve roi.  responsibilities:  work as a partner and consultant to the marketing team to develop analytical tools and dashboards to communicate effectiveness of marketing initiatives, and enable adoption of dashboards with training. partner with the marketing programs team during planning cycles to formulate revenue-positive demand generation plans. report on marketing funnel performance (engaged leads, mql, sql, won deals) proactively monitor performance of marketing initiatives, identifying low and high roi programs to inform potential areas for investment/divestment. optimize revenue generation by enabling testing and cro initiatives. partner with the centralized data engineering team to build an analytics infrastructure that supports marketing data needs (e.g. building new data sources / data aggregates) work closely with the marketing programs team, business ops, and sales ops to create yearly and quarterly marketing forecasts & team goals. support annual, quarterly, and weekly marketing pipeline forecasting. perform ad hoc analysis to investigate issues as they arise.  requirements   5+ years experience in marketing and analytics roles high proficiency in excel is a must experience in tableau, databases/sql/sas, and business intelligence tools a must experience in marketo or salesforce is a plus. ability to learn new systems and tools quickly a must. bachelor's degree or equivalent experience  why glassdoor?   work with purpose – join us in creating transparency for job seekers everywhere glassdoor gives back! glassdoor is a pledge 1% member; all employees receive 3 paid volunteer days per year 100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage; 80% dependent coverage long term incentive plan 401(k) plan with a company match to prepare for your future sunny & peaceful mill valley offices located right on the water walking, running and biking trails steps away from the office onsite gym and fitness classes free catered lunch; new menu daily paid holidays and flexible paid time off your choice between mac or pc dog-friendly office (with dog-free zones if you are so inclined) free parking  glassdoor is committed to equal treatment and opportunity in all aspects of recruitment, selection, and employment without regard to gender, race, religion, national origin, ethnicity, disability, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, veteran or military status, or any other category protected under the law. glassdoor is an equal opportunity employer; committed to a community of inclusion, and an environment free from discrimination, harassment, and retaliation.

bold is an established and fast-growing technology company that transforms work lives. since 2005, bold has delivered award-winning career services that have a meaningful and positive impact on job seekers and employers. bold's robust product line includes a professional resume and cover letter writing services, scientifically validated career tests, and employer tools that help companies hire, onboard, and communicate with their staff.  department summary: this role is in our analytics team. this team supports product, marketing, and finance teams in presenting product performance metrics and providing key recommendations to promote growth.  position summary: as our product data analyst, you will provide data and recommendations to the business for product performance and growth. you will be working with product, marketing, and finance teams on ad-hoc analyses and providing strategic support to the executive team. you will also be responsible for developing standardized metrics and reporting for the organization that keep us informed, and are the fingers on the pulse of our business. through your insightful work and attention to detail, you will be the go-to person for information about performance and product development insights.  the ideal candidate for this role will be highly motivated and will use not only their technical skills but their analytical and strategic direction to quickly make an impact!  required requirements:  conduct in-depth analysis to find opportunities for product development and enhancement. provide recommendations to improve performance and kpis via monitoring dashboards, scorecards, and ad hoc analysis. work closely with business stakeholders to extract meaningful insights using a variety of data sources – relational databases, front-end analytics tools, clickstream data, etc. present performance/engagement insights and recommendations to executive leadership via visualizations and concise messaging. collaborate with bi and engineering groups to advance data infrastructure, governance, and capabilities. track and analyze website performance, click stream, and user paths to provide data for decision-making. surface and analyze data to help us build more robust customer segmentation. help create customer engagement reporting using our event stream.  required qualifications:  2 years as an individual contributor performing quantitative analysis, preferably for an internet or technology company. ability to write and execute complex sql queries to extract data from a variety of internal sources. experience implementing and using google analytics, mixpanel or other front-end analytical platforms to analyze product performance and engagement. strong analytical and problem-solving skills. self-starter with a desire to learn and the ability to rapidly understand the business and its drivers. high proficiency with excel including pivoting capabilities and analysis modules. ability to handle conflicting priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.  desired qualifications:  experience writing and optimizing complex sql queries. knowledge of programming languages (python/r preferred). proficiency with bi platforms such as tableau. proficiency with web analytics tools – google analytics, mixpanel, etc.  about bold: bold is a fast-paced, innovative company full of smart, committed people who are passionate about our products and love helping people find the career of their dreams. we balance work and fun while continuing to build a successful, fast-growing company that is changing the way people get jobs.  our vision is to revolutionize the online career world by creating transformational products that help people find the careers they love and reach their full potential.  bold is an equal opportunity employer. all persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, status in the u.s. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.  qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for the position in accordance with san francisco's fair chance ordinance.

at uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. we take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  we welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. if you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. the product strategy team plays a pivotal role in the tech (product + engineering) organization by partnering with leadership on deliverables related to strategy, planning, collaboration, accountability, and more. the team consists of representatives from product management, analytics, and operations. analytics is a critical part of the team, as a data-driven approach is absolutely necessary for the group to effectively prioritize tasks. additionally, many of the initiatives heavily involve metrics, such as goal setting and accountability, so analytics is a strong pillar within the group as it relates to execution of the highest-impact projects across tech.  what you'll do: co-lead the creation of company-wide and department goals by leveraging kpis and okrs champion a metrics-driven culture within the tech organization to foster accountability and rigorous decision-making generate ideas for exploratory analysis to shape future projects and provide recommendations for actions perform variance analyses against critical benchmarks to identify the root cause behind trends own various strategic initiatives and ensure we are closely following the mutually agreed upon timelines, proposing actionable next steps to move projects forward dissect complex projects into discrete, prioritized tasks that appropriately reflect the high-level objectives of the organization/company establish organizational measurement cadence to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics in scalable ways collaborate with cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, marketing, finance, and strategy present findings to senior management to drive business decisions what you'll need: 3-5 years of experience in a quantitative analysis role ba/bs/ms in math, economics, statistics, engineering, computer science, or other quantitative field (advanced degrees are a plus) (1) excellent sql skills and (2) experience in or a willingness to learn at least one scripting language (python or r preferred) advanced knowledge of experimentation and statistical methods are a plus ability to deliver on tight timelines and move quickly while maintaining attention to detail appetite to work closely with cross-functional teams to execute on decisions comfort with ambiguity and the ability to work in a self-guided manner executive presence to regularly interface with leadership superb communication and organization skills familiarity working with or on product teams is a plus perks: employees are given uber credits every month the rare opportunity to change the way the world moves. we're not just another social web app, we're moving real people and assets and reinventing transportation and logistics globally. smart, engaged co-workers benefits: 401(k) plan, gym reimbursement, nine paid company holidays. full medical/dental/vision package to fit your needs. unlimited vacation policy; take time when you need it. be sure to check out the uber engineering blog to learn more about the tech team.  uber is an equal opportunity employer and enthusiastically encourages people from a wide variety of backgrounds and experiences to apply. uber does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), gender, national origin, citizenship, age, mental or physical disability, veteran status, marital status, sexual orientation or any other basis prohibited by law.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ the world's first customer platform helping internet businesses accelerate growth ️ ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  intercom builds a suite of messaging-first products that all modern internet businesses can use to accelerate growth across the customer lifecycle, from acquisition, to engagement, and support. today more than 25,000 businesses, including new relic, sotheby's, and shopify, use intercom to connect with a billion unique people worldwide.  intercom is a deeply creative company with the confidence to believe it can fundamentally change the future of internet business. our people are incredibly ambitious, yet humble. warm, accepting, and positive. whether you build, market, sell or support product, we want you to make your mark with us.  --------------------------------- what's the opportunity? ---------------------------------  if you get really excited about asking the right questions, exploring patterns in data and surfacing actionable insights that drive strategic decisions, join our analytics & data science team in san francisco as a senior product analyst. this role will enable you to drive key data projects that directly impact our customers and millions of end users who communicate via our messaging platform daily.  our sf office is driving some of our most strategically important products, including our messenger ( https://www.intercom.com/blog/new-business-messenger/ ) and our first use experiences. you will be joining as the founding member of the product analytics team in san francisco and become a trusted partner across r&d. you'll lead by example, influence our team and culture and you'll help shape what a great analytics & data science organization looks like!  ------------------------------- what will i be doing? -------------------------------   you'll deeply partner with product managers and product engineers to develop and answer critical questions and help drive the strategic direction of the product you'll collaborate with a global team of analysts, data scientists and data engineers to democratize data across intercom and to foster a culture of measurement, metrics and experimentation you'll gain an in-depth understanding of the product and the flow of data through the product. you'll measure the success of our product iterations and product launches. you'll conduct exploratory analyses to surface core patterns of product usage through impactful analytics projects you'll help build and influence our product roadmap. you'll develop hypotheses, design and conduct controlled experiments and make concrete product recommendations based on experiment outcomes you'll share your findings and recommendations across the company and champion the use of data to drive product directions you'll lead strategic projects at the team, product and company level, building strong partnerships throughout the company  -------------------------------- what skills do i need? --------------------------------   4+ years experience in a quantitative analysis role, specifically working closely with product teams (e.g. data analyst, product analyst, data scientist) ba/bs or ms degree preferably in quantitative discipline (e.g., applied math, econ, statistics, eng, cs) excellent sql skills and experience with a scientific computing language (such as r or python) good knowledge of statistics. experience running a/b and multivariate tests. proven track record of initiating and delivering actionable analysis and insights that drives tangible impact with minimal supervision excellent communication skills (technical and non-technical) experience with bi/visualization tools like tableau, superset and looker nice to haves: building predictive / ml models, building data pipelines and / or developing frameworks for sharing skills/knowledge across data teams : )  ------------------ benefits ------------------  we are a well-treated bunch, with awesome benefits! if there's something important to you that's not on this list, talk to us! : )   competitive salary and meaningful equity catered lunch every weekday, plus a variety of snack foods and a fully stocked kitchen fully funded comprehensive medical, dental, and vision coverage open vacation policy and 10 corporate holidays paid parental leave program commuter benefits + 401k plan in-office bicycle storage macbooks are our standard, but we're happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done fun events for intercomrades, friends, and family! proof of eligibility to work in the united states is required.  intercom values diversity and is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity. intercom will not discriminate against an applicant or employee on the basis of race, color, religion, creed, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, age, physical or mental disability, veteran or military status, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, or any other legally recognized protected basis under federal, state, or local law.

job description  position summary the role of product analyst in the identity and risk products group will help manage emerging digital risk products, develop enhancements to these products, and develop new offerings in the risk and authentication space. the product analyst will assess global market trends, evaluate potential product opportunities, develop product proposals, and recommend market entry strategies. he/she will contribute to the product vision and delivery, including managing functional requirements, feature prioritization, and product operations. he/she will also partner with internal groups to evaluate and articulate the value/business proposition of new products and will also train and be highly consultative to visa’s client facing teams and regional product leads on the best way for clients to take advantage of new products. responsibilities: support collaborative development and help with the execution of short-term, intermediate, and long-term strategic business development plans for visa’s new risk and authentication products support product development lifecycle from strategic planning, commercialization, technical development, and ongoing management act as a key liaison between product and technology to develop new solutions and support client implementations help coordinate with marketing and regional product leads on key messaging for new and emerging products identify and build relationships with internal and external partners to successfully manage and deliver high quality products and solutions provide product training to internal teams: sales, marketing, product, customer service, etc. manage product operations, including client contracts, billing, legal approval of materials, and client-facing reporting lead client meetings and participate in executive innovation sessions stay abreast of competitor products, ensure products are differentiated and solve client’s greatest needs while reducing fraud and increasing authorization. key competencies: focus on results – holds self and others accountable for outcomes focus on solutions – connects people and information across the organization to leverage the best of visa’s technologies and expertise influence others - effectively negotiates outcomes that benefit visa and clients communication - strong communication, presentation, and relationship building skills dependability - consistently follows through on commitments to build trust with clients and internal stakeholders balance analysis and action – takes action without excessive consultation or guidance lead change – initiates and facilitates appropriate product enhancements or modifications to drive global product growth inspire others – convey a vision of the future that generates excitement and commitment executive presence – able to command attention and respect of senior executives through a confident and professional manner.  qualifications  bachelor's degree required, advanced degree desirable 2+ years of experience working in product management or management consulting, with experience and knowledge of payment authentication a strong plus excellent interpersonal skills to build connections with internal visa teams and clients ability to transform business ideas into detailed requirements that enable technology teams to deliver new products or product enhancements based on business needs. ability to manage and write product documentation detailing product features and business rules ability to manage projects with multiple work streams, with proven leadership success over a wide variety of functional business problems flexible and creative thinker with the ability to define business tradeoffs, generate outside-the-box solutions and manage uncertainty ability to excel in a large organization by finding solutions that meets the needs of diverse stakeholders strong analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills ability to create and influence strategy  additional information  all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

temporaryjob id: 165123 location name: ca-fsc sf off (0174) address: 525 market st, 32nd floor, san francisco, ca 94105, united states (us) job type: full time position type (regular/temporary): regular job function: digital/e-commerce sephora digital: through original thinking, pioneering action, and disrupting the status quo, our digital team has transformed the beauty retail industry. from social to mobile to site to in-store technology, sephora is a leading digital player that builds innovative client experiences where the clients are always the focus. with a “genius” designation on the l2 digital iq index (five years in a row), we’ll continue to set the pace for the industry…especially with you on our team.  your role at sephora: sephora is looking for an experienced senior manager to run our product analytics & insights team. in this role, you will manage the product analytics and testing team within product management. for product analytics, the senior manager will oversee team members responsible for defining tracking requirements in adobe analytics for our websites, mobile apps and in-store applications – and enable insights and informed decision making across our digital and stores business teams. you will also collaborate closely across the product management team to ensure all roadmap projects are assessed for analytics the right kpis are developed instrumented correctly. you will be a key partner to ensure the product roadmap delivers the intended business results. in addition, you will oversee team members responsible for set up, validation and activation of a/b and multi-variant tests on our digital platforms, utilizing adobe test & target. you will partner with business and engineering stakeholders to define our testing needs, test audience, sequencing and ensure successful implementations as well as on-going management of testing capabilities across all of sephora’s channels and platforms.  overall, you will: own the adobe analytics and test & target platform. ensure the ongoing efficacy of adobe analytics as an accurate, robust source of truth to measure performance and provide insights into our digital channels including website, mobile app and in-store applications manage the team. you will manage team of product analysts and technical specialists in the product management organization, helping grow them in their capabilities and careers. evangelize analytics. as a key leader in the product organization you will look for opportunities to educate and inspire the larger sephora organization on the value of analytics and testing and will ensure we make the most of our tools and processes while adding capabilities when and where we need them. drive decision making. working with stakeholders across our nearly all areas of our business and technology teams, you will understand the key decisions our teams need to make and ensure they are instrumented with the most accurate and comprehensive data to minimize risk and maximize our ability to make the best possible decisions at every level.  we’re excited about you if you have: 5-7+ years in website and a/b testing at in a retail, agency, or similar customer-focused business with increasing levels of responsibility 4+ years’ experience with adobe analytics, test & target, and/or similar tools and technology aimed at measuring and monitoring client interactions and experiences and the health of a business across multiple channels and kpis experience leading a team of analysts with oversight across a broad range of business functions expertise in working with a product management organization with a large cross-functional roadmap for multiple domains and business owners excellent communication skills, especially the ability to translate technical terms in to business-friendly language and to communicate effectively to an executive-level audience  you’ll love working here because: the people. you will be surrounded by some of the most talented, supportive, smart, and kind leaders and teams – people you can be proud to work with. the product. employees enjoy a product discount and receive free product (“gratis”) various times throughout the year. (think your friends and family love you now? just wait until you work at sephora!) the business. it feels good to win – and sephora is a leader in the retail industry, defining experiential retail with a digital focus and creating the most loved beauty community in the world…with the awards and accolades to back it up. the perks. sephora offers comprehensive medical benefits, generous vacation/holiday time off, commuter benefits, and “summer fridays” (half-days every friday between memorial and labor day)…and so much more. the lvmh family. sephora’s parent company, lvmh, is one of the largest luxury groups in the world, providing support to over 70 brands such as louis vuitton, celine, marc jacobs, and dior.  working at sephora’s field support center (fsc) our north american operations are based in the heart of san francisco’s financial district, but you won’t hear us call it a headquarters – it’s the field support center (fsc). at the fsc, we support our stores in providing the best possible experience for every client. dedicated teams cater to our client’s every need by creating covetable assortments, curated content, compelling storytelling, smart strategy, skillful analysis, expert training, and more. it takes a lot of curious and confident individuals, disrupting the status quo and taking chances. the pace is fast, the fun is furious, and the passion is real. we never rest on our laurels. our motto? if it’s not broken, fix it.  sephora is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, military/veteran status, or disability status. sephora is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to applicants with physical and mental disabilities.  sephora will consider for employment all qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with applicable law. #li-sk-1 company overview: sephora has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s paris. sephora was acquired by luxury group moët hennessy louis vuitton (lvmh) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, sephora collection. sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the beauty studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from personal beauty advisors, and exclusive retail technology skincare iq, color iq, and fragrance iq. sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

statistics, computer science, engineering, mathematics, data sciences)  experience in scripting with sql, extracting large sets of data, and design of etl flows  work experience in an serve google's worldwide user base of more than a billion people. product analysts provide quantitative support, market understanding and a strategic perspective to our partners throughout the organization. as a data-loving member of the team, you serve as an analytics expert for your partners, using numbers to help them make better decisions. you will weave stories with meaningful insight from data. you'll make critical recommendations for your fellow googlers in engineering and product management. as a self-starter, you relish tallying up the numbers one minute and communicating your findings to a team leader the next. you can see different angles of a product or business opportunity, and you know how to connect the dots and interact with people in various roles and functions. you analytical thought leaders across the company.  data scientists are changing the world one technological achievement after another.  experimentation is at the core of what you do. in this role, you will work to effectively turn business questions into data analysis, and provide meaningful recommendations on strategy. this is a unique hybrid role that will focus on your knowledge of data infrastructure and your ability to drive insights. google is and always will be an engineering company. we hire people with a broad set of technical skills who are ready to take on some of technology's greatest challenges and make an impact on millions, if not billions, of users. at google, engineers not only revolutionize search, they routinely work on massive scalability and storage dashboards to provide insights at scale, solving for analytical needs.  collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to understand their business needs, formulate and complete end-to-end analysis that includes data gathering, analysis, ongoing scaled deliverables and presentations.  help google to focus on key decisions to improve products and services. at google, we don’t just accept payments product marketing team ensures that the right customers are getting the right message, through the right channels, and represents the customers voice in product strategy discussions and decisions. the ultimate goal is to make sure we are building the right products and to drive growth and engagement with our products. as a payments product marketing analyst: you will: partner with square's marketing, external partnerships, and product teams to identify strategic opportunities to accelerate square's payments growth be the trusted voice of sellers by surfacing quantitative insights that shape product direction and strategy lead a/b test design and implementation for growth and engagement campaigns, and make results-driven recommendations present and communicate analyses to management and other stakeholders in order to drive business decisions provide comprehensive day-to-day analytics support to partner teams, develop tools and resources to empower data access and self-service so your expertise can be leveraged where it is most impactful  qualifications  you have: 5+ years of industry experience using data analytics to produce impactful insights in product, marketing, consulting, or business roles experience driving cross-functional analytics projects from beginning to end: hypothesis formation, data model design, logging, etl, validation, analysis, machine learning, visualization, and presentation ability to initiate and drive projects to completion with minimal guidance ability to clearly communicate complex results to partners in verbal, visual, and written formats willingness to learn new tools and technologies to model and solve unstructured problems experience with large data sets is a plus additional information  at square, our our research & analytics team works on global, cross-functional projects that are at the heart of what we do at slack. as a leader on the product analytics team, you will deliver data and insights that drive decision-making, execution and investments for our product initiatives in a dedicated area of the business. the role will be responsible for both building and leading a high-performing team, and also delivering a crisp data narrative around our customers and product usage. success requires analytical savvy, problem-solving sophistication, a willingness to roll up your sleeves and a dedication to make the highest impact possible. we are looking for someone that can think on their feet and thrives in a dynamic environment. this role will report to our head of product analytics.  what you will be doing ----------------------   set a compelling vision and prioritize work based on business partner objectives and overall goals lead a high-performing, high-throughput team of talented data scientists, while driving professional development goals of the team partner closely with our product leadership team to influence planning and prioritization synthesize business insights and communicate a data narrative around product usage, tying this into the overall slack strategy work with the team to manage the end-to-end process: scope projects, build pipelines and datasets, synthesize results, craft automated dashboards/bots, and communicate an informed recommendation. jump in when needed! contribute high quality work as an individual contributor, in addition to management duties partner closely with researchers, and when appropriate, align roadmaps and collaborate on projects to answer complex questions build partnership and alignment with our data cross-functional partners, including data engineering and business intelligence, to author and develop core data sets and empower operational and exploratory analysis play an active role in building a best-in-class team, with a responsibility to contribute best practices and serve as a role model communicate solutions confidently and effectively across slack  we strive to build a culture that stabilizes our values and have high standards of execution. we require someone who can:   be humble, hardworking and collaborative in order to connect with the team and throughout the business remain focused while working across a wide variety of projects simplify huge data sets, complex problems and extract insights with frameworks and analyses  what you should have --------------------   6+ years of data analytics work experience and 2+ years of management experience a proven track record of using quantitative analysis to impact key decisions ability to build clear and concise presentations, and communicate effectively at every level of the organization experience dealing with unstructured business issues and successfully leading teams to resolve these issues experience writing sql queries and working with large data sets strong project management skills ba/bs degree. graduate degree a plus

include marketing and sales support (such as paid marketing, events, blogs, and lead capture), the logged out portions of hired.com, candidate and employer onboarding support, search engine optimization, and referral programs.  this is a hands-on product manager role, and you will work very closely with your cross-functional product team and marketing leads on all initiatives.  what we salespeople, and marketers towards a unified vision representing the team in communication with cross functional groups, especially with marketing stakeholders ensuring that our product strategy and roadmaps are aligned with corporate and marketing goals  what we look for:  5-7 years of product management within growth-oriented b2c (required) and b2b (preferred) companies a growth product products and/or hr solutions  comp, benefits, & perks:  competitive compensation & equity options open vacation & sick time flexible work hours employer paid health insurance, vision, and dental 401(k) pre-tax commuter benefit gym reimbursement cell phone reimbursement weekly educational classes catered lunch  we believe that when we can bring our whole selves to work on a day-to-day basis we become happier, more comfortable, more confident and more excited to do great things for our company, each other, our product and our users. hired aims to both build an internal team as well as help who you are: we’re looking for a product strategy & operations manager with strong analytical skills, practical business experience, and an ambition to have a significant impact on understanding and growing our business. the right candidate will have a desire to work amongst product, marketing, sales, support, and finance teams to drive the business forward.  you must have an incredibly high level of curiosity, a drive for accuracy, very high attention to detail, and the ability to mask something incredibly complex behind something beautifully simple. this is our product philosophy and must be your approach to analyzing and communicating, and taking part in the evolution of our business. you are comfortable with all kinds of data, and feel comfortable in all stages of data analysis.  what you’ll be doing: you’ll serve as a key business leadership team member across a variety of products, reporting to the director of product strategy & operations. you will lead efforts in an unstructured environment to identify product, customer, partner or market insights and improve decision-making across various stakeholders, including product management, marketing, sales support, success, and senior executives. responsibilities: executive review: serve as key business partner for reporting, and both the short-term & long-term business planning for executive quarterly business reviews (qbr) to c-suite packaging & pricing: be part of the product pricing & packaging team, modeling potential impact of feature/product launches, plan shifts, pricing changes and analyze them after rollout product-to-revenue analysis: work with product data analytics and product managers to tie feature and product adoption and usage to business value (cac, asps, mrr, retention, and job description  the global product organization delivers the holistic product strategy for visa and accelerates the seamless delivery of our products into markets. we are at the core of visa’s overall vision to be the best way to pay and be paid for everyone, everywhere. we are fueled by a diverse team of talented team-members who continuously raise the bar on delivering best-in-class products and services to people all over the world. we are looking for looking for junior product managers with varying levels of experience and background (0-6 years) to join our progressive product management team. this role can base in foster city, ca or ashburn, va. as a product manager at visa, you will be a key member of the team that drives the latest and most innovative ideas from product ideation, to build, to launch, to scaling in the market. you will assist in delivering next generation product offerings to our customers, including innovative payment experiences, cutting edge fraud prevention, capabilities to help banks and merchants meet their consumers’ needs, and local solutions tailored to one or more of the 200 countries we operate in. you must be a self-starter, ready to learn and experiment, and be able to work both independently and as part of a team. a key driver of success will be the ability to focus on the highest leverage activities in the face of rapid change and new information, and the ability to independently drive activities all the way to successful completion. product management will be a focal point in our strategy to delivery world-class products to market, and the analyst role is a key piece of that vision.  responsibilities support the development of the product strategy, go-to-market plans, and product documents (concept document, business case, product backlog) support the development of the product roadmap and backlog to define/support the product goals and strategies become knowledgeable on visa’s products and support the product team in driving the development of product features and functionality, leveraging the strong foundation of existing capabilities where appropriate. understand market trends, competition, and user requirements distill market research to provide perspective to the team and product management leaders to inform insights and decisions collaborate with designers to create design concepts and with engineering to implement and iterate on these concepts collaborate with internal visa teams (e.g., regional teams, product marketing, business development) to define and execute a cohesive strategy related to a specific product or feature  qualifications  ba/bs degree in computer science, electrical engineering, mathematics, statistics, or a related technical field, or equivalent practical experience in conjunction with a less technical ba/bs 1-5 years of related work experience eagerness and self starting approach and an entrepreneurial mindset problem-solving, organizational, analytical, and critical thinking skills excellent written and verbal communication skills experience working in cross-functional collaborative environments knowledge or experience with agile methodology to drive product development and delivery proven ability to take initiative and to build strong and productive relationships  additional information  all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

are you looking to join a team that strives to bring a positive, real-life impact to the lives of millions of people? at zoosk, we have the tremendous and rewarding challenge of facilitating meaningful connections between over 40 million users worldwide and growing. our users span 80 countries worldwide and exchange millions of messages in 25 different languages every single day.  as a senior product manager at zoosk you will work with engineering, ux, and business intelligence teams to define payments/financial business requirements and evaluate new messaging solutions that aligns with our customer needs. you will partner with engineering to implement new messaging solutions and features. this position is also on the front line researching, identifying, and understanding inconsistencies with financial reports and proposing solutions. what you'll do: identify consumer and business needs, define product strategy, and build a messaging roadmap (email, push messaging) that delivers an experience that retains our users by keeping them updated and engaged – deliver the right messages, at the right time, via the right channel own the overall product plan and roadmap. working closely with senior leadership in product and design, engineering, create clear quarterly plans, incorporating input from all stakeholders, that depict how the strategy will achieve the company’s goals define and put in place metrics and systems to track product performance. clearly communicate performance and use data to evaluate and prioritize the roadmap develops the email and push messaging systems that zoosk uses to reach millions of members each day. set an ambitious product vision for how our messages can guide our users to get the most out of their zoosk experience, drive engagement and move users down the funnel from registered users to subscribers be the product evangelist. own all product communication with senior leadership on current insights and emerging trends, as well as championing the vision to the other teams and groups within the company. understand the workflow needs around creating and producing emails and push messaging, and how they impact our team initiatives in the short-term and long-term. identify inefficient process in the current workflows, and identify tools to automate or streamline them work closely with colleagues in, marketing, advertising, design, brand, product and technology to design, develop and launch emails and push messages, as well as make sure that we’re building the tools and systems we need to support a robust portfolio of innovative messaging products help drive forward the culture of innovation in our email and messaging products guide the product from concept to design, specification, implementation, and analysis work closely with multiple engineering teams to build and iterate on the product collect continuous feedback from our users to evolve the product what we're looking for in you: ba/bs in a technical field, cs preferred. mba a plus a minimum of 7+ years product management experience a minimum of 5+ years of experience with email and push notification systems and tools experience leveraging 3rd party messaging solutions to add incremental value to messaging and leveraging sophisticated engagement solutions across devices, channels, and platforms experience with managing tools and technology focused on email whitelisting best practices ability to lead cross-functional product, design and technology teams and can vigilantly prioritize in a rapidly-changing environment ability to analyze user workflows from scratch (with the help of a design team) ability to make trade-offs between qualitative, quantitative, and absent data comfortable with a high degree of autonomy demonstrated ability to understand and discuss technical concepts and manage tradeoffs ability to drive user research to build requirements and weigh tradeoffs in design decisions experience defining projects, driving requirements, writing detailed functional specifications, and coordinating feature team efforts strong analytical and quantitative skills with the ability to use data and metrics to back up assumptions and recommendations. strong written and verbal communication skills. ability to break down a technical problem into clear and direct communication history of teamwork and willingness to roll up one’s sleeves to get the job done strong knowledge of digital product development techniques and agile methodologies zoosk core values: don’t stop caring. be a doer. we’re better together. speak up. we say no to the status quo. if there’s fun to be had, then have it.  while there is a lot to do, we also have a very open and collaborative culture and know how to have a lot of fun; frequent team and company outings, hackathons, happy hour every friday, daily catered lunches, health and wellness benefits, 401k matching, generous maternity/paternity leave policies, and flexible time off are just some of the ways we support our teams.  zoosk is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace committed to building a team culture that celebrates diversity and inclusion.

komodo health is addressing the global burden of disease through the world's most actionable healthcare map. our solutions drive a more transparent, efficient and productive healthcare ecosystem. we value our culture of encouraging growth, collaboration, and constructive debate as well as delivering innovative solutions that "wow" our customers.  our product manager will oversee high impact, high growth saas data products focused on addressing unmet medical needs for patients. the product manager will work closely with engineering and key stakeholders to define, design, prototype, test, build and market features and product lines that accelerate our category leadership in addressing disease burden.  we have offices in san francisco and new york. both locations are available.  this role can accommodate a range of seniority. what you'll do: • develop world-class, enterprise-ready patient centric saas products to help reduce the burden of disease and accelerate the journey towards value based care craft and evaluate future product opportunities with our customers; create and maintain a consistent and measurable roadmap spanning both smaller features and more ambitious, market-shaping betstranslate big picture product strategy into detailed requirements and hypothesis driven proofs of conceptsmap customer needs and workflows to help define technology solutionspartner with designers to create and test intuitively designed productsmaintain a solid and well prioritized backlog that reflects both our customers' needs and our build towards a scalable technology to support most efficiently and quickly support those needstalk to customers often to identify and solution for their unspoken and unmet needs what we're looking for:a passion for improving patient care and addressing unmet medical needs2+ years of product management experience in a high growth b2b technology/software companyexperience with healthcare and/or data products are a plusadept problem solver who can right fit solutions for target segments by tapping into the best of our organizations' capabilities, technologies, processes and cultureexcellent stewardship over competing prioritiesthe ability to discern the difference between what we could do vs what we should do • agile development experienceclinical experience in healthcare delivery a bonus (including nurse, physician, physician assistant, nurse practitioner, social worker, etc.) benefits: competitive salary and equity compensationfull medical, dental, and vision benefits401k plan with employer matchyour choice of equipment set-up (computer, monitor, and accessories)flexible hours and unlimited vacation days policyopportunities to attend industry conferences and eventsawesome team and culturegreat office location in nyc or sf at komodo health, we don't just accept difference we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, and our community. komodo health is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace

experience!  opportunity  ujet is seeking a product manager to drive the direction of our products and services by collaborating with others on the product team, as well as engineering, design and the . the product manager will play an integral role in building the product vision with our customer's needs in mind. the product manager works with other product managers to develop the product roadmap, on ux platform technologies including web mobile and conversational interfaces. partner with the ux design team to enable the application development teams to continuously improve the application use and ensure that proper documentation and training is provided to all engineering teams.  role requirements an understanding of product architecture and technologies in the market strong cloud-based enterprise applications preferred. a track record of working with teams across an organization, who may have different priorities, to achieve business results.  #sapsfsf  what you get from exploration, exercise, and meaningful social interaction.  originally formed at google in 2011, we became an independent company in 2015 with a strong group of investors including nintendo, the pokémon company, and alsop louie partners. our current titles include pioneering global-control game ingress, and record-breaking ar game pokémon go. our third title, harry potter: wizards unite, is currently in development.  niantic is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. we believe that cultivating a workplace where our people are supported and included is essential to creating great products our community will love. our mission emphasizes seeking and hiring diverse voices, including those who are traditionally underrepresented in the technology industry, and we consider this to be one of the most important values we hold close.  we're a hard-working, fun, and exciting group who value intellectual curiosity and a passion for problem-solving! we have growing offices located in san francisco, sunnyvale, bellevue, los angeles, london, tokyo, hamburg, and zurich.
