love and craft their life's work. our mission is to build a world where people work to make a life, not just a living, and our own team members are central to that goal.   we are building software for physical space that uses data and technology at each point in the building process, such that it can make better sourcing decisions, improve its designs, build faster and smarter, and ultimately improve the lives of the people working within its buildings. our dedication to technological innovation has enabled us to grow to more than 400 workspace locations as well as well as support the other business lines including welive (living space), wegrow (education), rise by we (wellness) and powered by we (enterprise). our building kit team’s vision is to power and connect intelligent physical spaces with their virtual representation to empower the people using them and in doing so build an industry wide standard for an operating system in large shared physical spaces. together, as part of the core platform mission, we will build a unified underlying platform to stimulate, accelerate and scale member products and services.   we are looking for a strong product manager to define the vision and roadmap for the queryable buildings platform that builds the depth and breadth of knowledge of our physical world making space efficient and effect for our members through insights and apis. you’re great for this role if you  can clearly articulate the vision and how the work today maps to it. have the ability to influence decision-making across the organization. think in systems and see how the pieces fit together.   what you’ll do  define and lead the execution of the product roadmap for queryable buildings product. own and create comprehensive product specifications. plan and manage product release including feature documentation and pre-release demonstrations. drive innovation through product stories, prioritization, and an iterative roadmaps based on qualitative and quantitative feedback.   who you are  5+ years experience delivering highly successful and innovative products as a product manager. 5+ years experience creating examples through wireframes and mockups. deep technology skills, preferably building platforms as services. familiarity with real time streaming applications. we value initiative, drive, and diversity of thought. we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

job description position: product manager  about universal healthcare universal healthcare has established itself as a leader within the south african healthcare industry. through our evidence-based integrated healthcare services, we aim to facilitate access to healthcare for more individuals.  the vision of universal healthcare is: “to be a top performing, world class healthcare and technology group, respected for excellence by providing access to innovative, evidence-based solutions with a caring approach.”  universal healthcare’s integrated services include health insurance administration, corporate health and employee wellness programs, managed care, occupational health programs, an extensive network of healthcare professionals/providers, and health insurance, including gap coverage, among others.  about the role an exhilarating challenge for a technology expert has become available at universal healthcare, the most innovative healthcare management company headquartered in south africa, which has earned a reputation as being a leading disruptor and champion of service excellence over the last decade.  we are looking for a unique type of product manager, who is ready to take on an adventure by creating the healthcare industry’s most cutting-edge software products. as universal healthcare works at the forefront of an industry characterised by rapidly evolving technologies and has recently embarked on a fresh strategic direction, the successful candidate will be working in an exciting and dynamic environment.  what you will be doing? drive innovation, definition, and deliverables planning (roadmap) and designing new products to deliver against team and company goals.challenge all members of cross-functional teams to think boldly and creatively and then funnel that energy into concrete productions and execution plans,independently write requirements in the form of agile stories that: o directly support primary objectives of the project o are appropriate in size for development during a two-week iteration o include clear and specific acceptance criteria o consider dependencies on other stories and/or projects and initiatives. work with project team to develop and prioritize project backlogs, negotiating appropriate trade-offs between delivering business value and technical considerations.maintain prioritized backlog and champion, develop and communicate release plans to business partners and/or provide materials for product managers to do so.work with the change management team to develop change management deliverables, including plans to communicate new functionality to business units.develop user documentation and training to encourage user adoption.communicate detailed acceptance criteria to technical team. review work of qa team with end users; manage user acceptance process.work closely with business partners to ensure development activities are in alignment with business objectives.proactively recommend business process and performance improvements based on new features/functions delivered in new versions of custom developed and third-party software. what you will need? a computer science degree or equivalent plus hands on software engineering experience.technical understanding must go from the highest abstraction down to the metal.5 years’ experience delivering solutions / products in the healthcare industry.technical depth and principled thinking with bold innovation at your core.you never hesitate to roll-up your sleeves and tackle something hands on, you persevere when others fall away.a ‘driver’ personality – biased towards action, great collaborator and master simplifier – constantly pushing toward clarity and delivery.a true passion for bringing affordable solutions for the global healthcare crisis.a never-ending desire to grow and learn.ability to use critical thinking, rigorous logic and methods to solve difficult problems with effective solutions.must be able to learn quickly when facing new problems, enjoy the challenge of unfamiliar tasks, and be willing to experiment/be highly innovative in finding solutions.ability to negotiate in tough situations with both internal and external groups and be able to win concessions without damaging relationships. perks ground-floor opportunity with a dynamic team to shape the technology and product solutions of the company. you will be joining the team from the start of this new venture.the rare opportunity to change the world and be part of the team that designs, builds and implements technology solutions that bring affordable access to healthcare.international project team in south africa, uk and europe and now in san francisco.opportunity to travel.flexible work schedule - work hard and take time when you need it.stability and long-term employment opportunity.highly competitive salary with performance-based bonus opportunity401(k) planfull medical / dental / vision package to fit your needslife and disability insurancecell phone allowancepublic transport and parking stipendopportunities for trainingpaid time off – 20 days per year

giving them the capital and resources they need. the development of helio, our machine learning platform, allows us to offer scalable, repeatable capital offerings by investing in a “systematic” fashion, which will deliver value to a larger number of companies than ever possible. as our credit & equity business units scale, we are looking for a product manager to define and execute a technology roadmap that helps our business units to scale, strengthens our underlying data platform and offers an excellent experience to entrepreneurs. circleup has been named one of the top 5 most disruptive companies in finance by cnbc, one of the 50 best fintech innovators by kpmg, top 3 most innovative companies within data science by fast company and one of america's most promising companies by forbes. we are backed by top-tier investors including google ventures, union square ventures (backers of etsy/kickstarter), and the ex ceos/presidents of goldman sachs, morgan stanley, thomson reuters, the stanford endowment and capital one. responsibilities: work cross-functionally with stakeholders on our business teams, external service providers, and internal and external development teams to prioritize business needs, translate needs into actionable requirements and lead the development plan define and oversee the data integrations across multiple applications, including salesforce, loan management systems and helio identify opportunities for our business units to grow by better utilizing helio, while developing feedback loops for business application data to integrate with helio and improve its predictive power address inefficiencies in business processes that can be solved with technology provide efficient and professional grade documentation to communicate designs and specifications effectively to engineers, whether internal engineers or contracted developers own the customer experience of entrepreneurs that we work with qualifications: you you get excited to solve problems with data and to bring a data-driven revolution to the private markets you are a proactive self-starter with a bias toward action and the courage to overcome meaningful obstacles you are comfortable working with data products and are proficient in sql you have a bachelor’s degree or higher with a technical discipline, or equivalent experience

about us --------  at cloudflare, we have our eyes set on an ambitious goal: to help build a better internet. today, cloudflare runs one of the world's largest distributed networks that powers more than 10 trillion requests per month, which is nearly 10 percent of all internet requests worldwide. cloudflare protects and accelerates any internet application online without adding hardware, installing software, or changing a line of code.  our customers range from fortune 500 companies and nonprofits to small businesses and budding entrepreneurs. we are working to create a faster, more secure, and more reliable experience for anyone online and given the scale at which we operate, our mission is big. our team is hard at work shaping the future of the internet by solving some of its toughest challenges.  we realize people do not fit into neat boxes. we are looking for curious and empathetic individuals who are committed to developing themselves and learning new skills, and we are ready to help you do that. we cannot complete our mission without building a diverse and inclusive team. we hire the best people based on an evaluation of their potential and support them throughout their time at cloudflare. come join us!  about the department  the product team at cloudflare sits at the intersection of software development, design, and business strategy. we shape high-level product goals but also get our hands dirty. we have ultimate responsibility for understanding our client needs, influencing business strategy, feature specification, and working with engineering to develop our software.  about the role  cloudflare customers range from individual consumers to large, multinational corporations to critical partners. these customers trust us with keeping their internet facing services safe and secure. ensuring the platform that customers use to manage cloudflare services is easy to use, scalable, secure, and performant is integral to the success of our customers and cloudflare. success in this role requires building an understanding of how customers of each type use our platform and working across various teams to uncover solutions that scale across these customer types.  what you'll do  as a member of the growing team of product managers your responsibilities include:   own the product vision for your area. ensure that it aligns with the overall product and company vision. be an expert on the domain, the market, the trends. evangelize the vision constantly so all stakeholders are aligned, have context and understand where we are going. represent the customer. be the champion and voice of customers. build intimate, personal customer relationships. bring the customer's voice into the creation process. manage the roadmap. make tough tactical prioritization decisions while helping the company think long-term. build trust with stakeholders by maintaining an understandable, accurate roadmap. author use cases and prioritize requirements based on specific real-world product applications and extrapolate detailed product requirements for the scenarios. collaborate across teams. we win or lose as a team. product managers play a critical role in creating alignment between engineering teams and stakeholders. a collaborative attitude is essential to the job. measure success. own the measures used to define success for your product. success measures must be defined at the inception of a product and tracked throughout its lifecycle. make measures visible to all stakeholders and interpret them into actionable conclusions and new hypotheses. develop new opportunities. with your finger on the pulse of the market, the customers and the engineering teams, you are uniquely positioned to discover and develop new opportunities.  examples of desirable skills, knowledge and experience  the ideal candidate is entrepreneurial-minded and thrives in a fast-paced and goal-driven environment. you have outstanding communication and collaboration skills and are able to work with a diverse group, get consensus, and drive the product forward. you are execution focused and emphasize getting things done while paying attention to important details. you have several years of experience working with enterprise, saas, or security technologies. you have a passion for building saas products and want to solve the problems of performance, security, and reliability of the internet.   bs/ms in a technology field 3+ years of product management or equivalent experience with demonstrated ability to discover opportunities, and then define and deliver products exceptional communication, presentation, organizational and analytical skills a solid understanding of restful api design & documentation. working knowledge of internet security best practices must be able to define and manage complex process and/or product issues of a broad scope using independent judgment experience balancing execution, agility, and culture at a fast growing business. strong technical abilities. you are intimately familiar with modern software development practices used to build and deploy applications. you've preferably been working full time on a software delivery team. strong customer and stakeholder empathy. you must be not only the voice of the customer, but at various times the voice of marketing, finance, engineering, support and ops. you must be able to channel many points of view.  bonus points   ability to validate early ideas through quantitative and qualitative methods (a/b and multivariate testing, user testing, etc). experience in user experience (ux) design a plus. hands-on experience with command-line tools used for interacting with apis, debugging and testing (e.g. curl, dig, etc.). scripting/programming experience (python, go, etc.) and/or experience with query languages.  what makes cloudflare special?  we're not just a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company. we're a highly ambitious, large-scale technology company with a soul. fundamental to our mission to help build a better internet is protecting the free and open internet.  project galileo ( https://blog.cloudflare.com/protecting-free-expression-online/ ): we equip politically and artistically important organizations and journalists with powerful tools to defend themselves against attacks that would otherwise censor their work, technology already used by cloudflare's enterprise customers--at no cost.  project athenian ( https://www.cloudflare.com/athenian/ ): we created athenian project to ensure that state and local governments have the highest level of protection and reliability for free, so that their constituents have access to election information and voter registration.  path forward partnership ( https://blog.cloudflare.com/tag/path-forward/ ): since 2016, we have partnered with path forward, a nonprofit organization, to create 16-week positions for mid-career professionals who want to get back to the workplace after taking time off to care for a child, parent, or loved one.  1.1.1.1 ( https://1.1.1.1/ ): we released1.1.1.1 ( https://1.1.1.1/ ) to help fix the foundation of the internet by building a faster, more secure and privacy-centric public dns resolver. this is available publicly for everyone to use - it is the first consumer-focused service cloudflare has ever released. here's the deal - we don't store client ip addresses never, ever. we will continue to abide by ourprivacy policy ( https://developers.cloudflare.com/1.1.1.1/commitment-to-privacy/privacy-policy/privacy-policy/ ) and ensure that no user data is sold to advertisers or used to target consumers.  sound like something you'd like to be a part of? we'd love to hear from you!  cloudflare is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we are committed to providing equal employment opportunity for all people and place great value in both diversity and inclusiveness. all qualified applicants will be considered for employment without regard to their, or any other person's, perceived or actual race, color, religion, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, or any other basis protected by law. we are an aa/veterans/disabled employer.  cloudflare provides reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities. please tell us if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job. examples of reasonable accommodations include, but are not limited to, changing the application process, providing documents in an alternate format, using a sign language interpreter, or using specialized equipment. if you require a reasonable accommodation to apply for a job, please contact us via e-mail at hr@cloudflare.com or via mail at 101 townsend st. san francisco, ca 94107.

as a product manager, you will:  learn rapidly and develop your product management instincts and mechanics through exposure across the fleet product, engineering, and design teams. create and manage discrete and comprehensive user stories based on roadmap and epic-level items. own the development of meaningful features and product components that tie to the broader fleet product roadmap. support, analyze, and improve operational processes that accelerate the team, including feature design review and testing, event tracking and analysis, and bug prioritization. participate in daily and weekly meetings with project teams (engineering, design, test, marketing, etc.). create and own discrete data analytics projects related to fleet.  required skills for impact   have up to 2 years of experience in a relevant product role (pm, program management, product marketing, engineering, analytics, etc.). have a bachelor's degree or similar educational background that you leverage in being a great pm (cs, math, business, design, or possibly others). be excited about (and capable of) learning and digesting new information quickly. embrace the role of a pm in doing what is required to unblock and leverage others on the team. have excellent written and verbal communication skills. have a strong foundational knowledge of core technical and/or business strategy concepts (with an eagerness to learn more). demonstrate innate curiosity to learn how a business functions, and can learn new business models. be able to creatively solve problems with limited resources and input. demonstrate strong personal "soft" skills such as empathy, listening, mirroring and communicating in different methods dependent on individual preferences have excellent situational awareness - must be comfortable in dynamic customer environments and able to present our company well.  other details  this role reports into the product organization, and is based in the head office in danville, california (sf bay area). some amount of remote working is acceptable.  we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.  we provide competitive salaries, equity participation, health coverage, dental insurance, unlimited pto, parental leave, and a retirement plan. we're committed to building a team which reflects the diverse customers we will be serving.  about trōv ---------------  trōv is reinventing insurance for the mobile generation by making it simple, flexible and transparent. with the introduction of the world's first on-demand insurance platform for single items, trōv gives people the power to insure just what they want, exactly when they want, entirely from their mobile device. the trōv app also helps people easily organise important information about the things they own and back it up to the cloud, so it's accessible when needed. trōv is headquartered in the san francisco bay area. for more information visit www.trōv.com.  at trōv, we love creating great products and disrupting industries, which we are now doing in the archaic insurance industry. we have an agile and insight driven approach to the work we do, responding quickly to customer and market needs. trōv has a vibrant culture, with two-thirds of the team (primarily engineering) working remotely outside of sf bay area hq, including several cities in the us, canada, uk and australia. the team at trōv works exceptionally hard, but also supports the varying needs of different people via a flexible work structure using the latest collaborative work software.  our company's leadership includes ceo scott walchek (macromedia, c2b, baidu, debtmarket) and chief strategy officer mark dowds (band of coders, brainpark, servicecloud). we have an outstanding distributed team of engineers coming from diverse backgrounds, previously working on large-scale online services for top software companies.for more information, visit trōv.com. for latest funding information www.crunchbase.com/organization/trōv.

brands in america. product managers are an essential part of the thirdlove team, working effectively across all disciplines to build, launch, and iterate on our best-in-class digital products. this $90,000 - $120,000 a yeardo you understand what it takes to transform a vision into a workable process for operational teams? do you possess strong analytical skills and are you looking to work in a creative team environment both strategically and hands on? your role as the product manager at referralexchange you will be leading a deep dive into the workflow of our sales, service and operational teams. the role will have a strategic impact on referralexchange’s growth plans and drives consistent execution of operational processes. the successful candidate is able to identify enhancements to our existing way of working. you will be able to transform a strategic vision into executable plans; help stakeholders refine ideas for process and product improvements and translate those ideas to the developers. you’ll be able to maintain a big-picture perspective to ensure small cycle projects adhere to the grand vision; coordinate projects and enable communication across our 3 northern california office locations. you will join a team of pms and designers who work directly with our cto, vp ops, and other department directors to ensure a steady pipeline of projects meeting the needs of the sales, operations, and data science groups. specifically, this will involve creating the specs for our developers from the needs of the teams, developing milestones, communicating upcoming launches to the sales and ops teams, and ensuring that changes to the product meet our business needs before they are pushed live. the right candidate must be able to simplify complex workflows as well as find efficiencies and optimizations within the systems. what we expect from you 1-2 years of experience in product management mba or related graduate degree is a plus is creative, curious and a team player is motivated to roll up their sleeves and be operationally, tactically and strategically involved effectively communicates cross-functionally. is familiar with crm and bi tools - looker is a plus sql knowledge a plus is relentlessly optimistic and passionate about continuous improvement what we offer a very competitive salary: $90,000 - $120,000 annually depending on experience plus a discretionary bonus 401(k) plan with company matching contributions medical, dental, vision and insurance benefits an open, fun and professional environment where you are not only appreciated but can also see how your work directly contributes to the overall results of the company. great work/life balance, with a 40 hour work week. room to develop your career quickly friday afternoon drinks, regular company-wide events, catered lunches, and a stocked kitchen. about referralexchange referralexchange is a san francisco based tech company that combines cutting-edge algorithmic approaches with a dedication to exceptional customer service. we connect home buyers and sellers with top real estate agents and are the largest real estate referral network in the u.s. we transact over $2.5b in real estate a year through our platform. we are profitable, have an established track record of success spanning more than 12 years, and are growing fast. we are not beholden to any investors, so our decisions on the direction to take the company are our own. we are a group of dynamic professionals and know that our company is growing extremely fast. we got there by taking our work seriously. we stay sane by not taking ourselves too seriously. we are a highly collaborative team. our daily schedule sets aside time for the entire team to meet and discuss projects or issues we are currently working on and soliciting help from the group. showing initiative and solving problems is expected in our company, and we compensate accordingly. if we just described you, please apply today as we move fast.

bleacher report is one of world's biggest sports media sites with over 70 million monthly readers. we are the place fans follow their team across web, our 5-star mobile app and our team newsletters. and we're looking for a product manager who has strong consumer sense, quantitative and qualitative analysis skills and is passionate about sports. this is a highly collaborative role that will gather research/requirements from organizational stakeholders, guide the user experience and visual design process, manage product development with engineering, and ship products to the world with marketing/pr.  you make sure the right thing ships at the right time.  key responsibilities include:  own the day to day product development process for your product, from strategy and concept to shipping. develop product strategy and roadmap based on internal stakeholders and business/sales requirements, consumer trends, and technology landscape. guide the design process with ux/interaction and visual designers evaluate and manage product/technical partnerships with external partners along with sales and bd define the technical requirement and scoping process with engineering validate product/feature and market fit using strong analytical and metrics-driven approach empower marketing and pr to message and grow the product’s userbase. ship. iterate. ship.  requirements:  bachelor’s degree 1-3+ years of product management or similar experience demonstrated history or project portfolio displaying shipped products/features strong project management and organization skills strong technical knowledge and understanding of web/app software principles strong consumer insight and communications skills loves sports  preferred:  experience instrumenting analytics in web and mobile apps  bleacher report is a division of turner. turner and its subsidiaries are equal opportunity employers minorities/females/protected veterans/disabled. turner and its subsidiaries are e-verify users.

opportunity to be involved in the early stages of creating products that use proprietary healthcare data to directly impact outcomes and improve patient care.  responsibilities champion a user-centric approach to product design and definition. provide product leadership and rally development team to ship high quality products. own and prioritize a feature backlog to align with the overall strategic roadmap. create and groom product backlog through interaction with major stakeholders, including data scientists, engineers, designers, and business teams. think critically about technical solutions and engage the engineering team in tough conversations about prioritization and tradeoffs. work closely with ui/ux designers and inspire them to deliver best-in-class experiences across the entire product suite. provide input to the strategic roadmap by getting smart about the market through customer interaction and competitive analysis. evangelize product strategy and roadmap across a range of stakeholders and functional teams in the organization. qualifications bachelor or master degree in science, engineering or in a relevant technical area of study. data science background is preferred. experience with medical software development, agile, and working in multidisciplinary teams in a matrix environment is a plus. at least 3+ years work experience as a product owner or product manager for a technical product/device, preferably in a regulated environment. experience in healthcare products is a plus. experience in clinical trials software development is a plus. a product owner certification is beneficial. to apply please email your resume to: jobs@veranahealth.com

about scoop  scoop brings co-workers and neighbors together to enjoy a smooth carpooling experience—unlocking new opportunities to create friendships, improve their well-being, and make the most of their valuable time.  learn more in forbes: https://www.forbes.com/sites/miguelhelft/2017/11/08/with-36-million-in-financing-scoop-wants-to-make-carpooling-mainstream/  product management @ scoop  after more than 4 million carpooler trips, scoop has grown into the largest carpooling network in the united states. that growth is driven by the continued development and enhancement of our core product offerings, which is split into three groups: carpool, customer, and team.  scoop’s carpooler product is our engine, delivering the meaningful everyday experiences that empower commuters. as we expand and our understanding of carpoolers matures, we continue to invest in new ways to advance our logistics and user experience at every step of the way.  scoop’s go-to-market strategy is rooted in strong partnerships with customers - major enterprises, business parks, and municipalities - that rely on scoop to bring a dramatically improved commuting solution to their employees & commuters. our customer product is emergent and fueled by that go-to-market, with opportunities emerging from the newfound needs and interests of our key stakeholders as they ramp their investments.  and as our team scales, we will continue to invest in the underlying team product and internal tools that enable us to do great work. from sales to scoopcare to platform engineering, we look to accelerate our operations for our internal “users.” in this role, you will: learn rapidly and develop your product management instincts & mechanics through exposure across the scoop carpooler, customer, and team products. partner across the product, engineering, and design (p.e.d.) teams to scope, prioritize, design, and ship great product. own the development of meaningful features and product components that tie to the broader scoop product roadmap. collaborate cross-functionally with product analytics, user insights, and community to evaluate, measure, learn, and implement product strategies. support, analyze, and improve operational processes that accelerate the team, including feature design review, event tracking and analysis, and bug management. develop a point of view and roadmap for how we scale internal dogfooding and qa processes, including strategy, prioritization, and resourcing. you should: have up to 2 years of experience in a relevant product role (pm, program management, product marketing, engineering, analytics, etc.) have a bachelor’s degree or similar educational background that you leverage in being a great pm (cs, math, business, design, or possibly others) be excited about (and capable of) learning and digesting new information quickly embrace the role of a pm in doing what is required to unblock and leverage others on the team have a strong foundational knowledge of core technical and/or business strategy concepts (with an eagerness to learn more) be comfortable leading development and operational efforts across a variety of stakeholders, functions, and seniority levels. have excellent written and verbal communication skills you might also: be even more experienced in a variety of roles prior to pursuing product management like to play with and leverage data, including sql/r/python or similar skills have experience at a growing startup and/or on a small team be a passionate, hungry learner that gets excited about professional growth and being challenged by new opportunities   life @ scoop  founded in 2015 and based in downtown sf, our team mixes technology and elbow grease every day, with one statistic in our crosshairs: 80% of americans drive alone to work. at scoop, we envision a world where commuters feel empowered — starting with a choice to make their commute a meaningful part of their day. we embody that same spirit within our own culture, empowering every team member to make this the most meaningful experience of their career.  walk into scoop and you’ll find a furry, tail-wagging welcoming committee. in many ways these fluffy faces exemplify the energy that flows through our office. they are a reminder that while we’re focused and driven, we shouldn’t take ourselves too seriously. they also help bridge the gap between our homes and our workplace, just like a scoop carpool.  the atmosphere overall is dynamic and unique. it’s influenced by our backgrounds at successful startups, big tech companies, and premier consulting firms — blended and crafted into what feels natural and right for this company. it plays out in our balance of scrappy and strategic, frameworks and fast thinking.  at scoop, we’re all united by our desire to change the way people get to work — and committed to enjoying the journey together along the way.

at getaround, we’re building a global platform to enable a future where all cars are shared. there are more than 1 billion cars in the world, and these cars are parked, on average, more than 95% of the time. with instant and keyless carsharing via our patented hardware and software platform and our industry-leading mobile apps, we’re helping communities around the world share these underutilized resources to reduce their vehicle footprint while increasing mobility solutions.  we are looking for a nimble product manager who can help us grow our user-facing experiences. you will get to work closely with designers and engineers to translate customer insights, business imperatives and technological advances into great experiences that drive engagement on our carsharing platform.  you have a strong technical and analytical background that can think holistically about customer pain points. getaround is growing rapidly and this role is critical to our success. you will be involved in defining and developing new products & features that take us to the next level. what you'll be doing: strategize: craft product roadmaps through interaction with cross-functional teams, data analysis, competitor research and user insights. execute: work with design, engineering, and marketing teams to implement and build new product features that deliver great solutions for our renters and owners. analyze: define and analyze key metrics that will inform decision-making and measure success of product-driven initiatives invent: think widely about carsharing, mobility trends and how to drive greater business value through creative solutions. what you'll need: 3+ years of product management experience at technology-focused company(s). demonstrated success in delivering new products and features from concept to launch. ability to define product strategy, prioritize and articulate the rationale behind your decisions. proven analytical skills and ability to use data to drive decision-making and feature prioritization command a high bar for product experiences and leverage user-centered design principles to guide your decision-making. detail oriented with strong project management skills and able to ask the questions nobody else has asked. knowing how to cut through ambiguity to identify the core priorities a drive to collaborate, learn and“get things done” while balancing multiple projects. strong verbal and written communication skills. strong academic background in an engineering discipline or related field that enables you to understand & easily communicate with a technical team. at getaround, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we believe that no matter your race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, your perspective has value.  come join us in continuing to make getaround a great place to work!

 responsibilities:  lead the ideation, technical development and launch of new features and products and drive product development with a cross-functional team of developers and designers establish a shared vision among product stakeholders by building consensus on priorities and features leading to launch and execution integrate usability studies, and market research/analysis into product build and evangelize a testing and research culture as part of development process effectively use data and metrics to evolve and inform the direction of product development evangelize the nextdoor mission of using technology to build stronger, safer neighborhoods, and effectively release world-class products that grow and improve the nextdoor platform.  requirements:  2+ years product management experience exceptional communication and presentation skills exceptional organizational, analytical and project management skills thorough understanding of the technical architecture of complex and highly scalable web and mobile applications knack for creating simple and delightful user interfaces, with the ability to generate examples through mock-ups and wireframes comfort working across the product development spectrum: ideation, strategy, concept work to pixel-level details and implementation previous experience in the social networking space or developing social products/technologies/platforms is a plus ba/bs in computer science (or another related, technical field) is preferred  benefits:  100% company-paid health insurance premiums (medical, dental, and vision) for you and your dependents paid vacation and company holidays free catered dinners monday through thursday and catered lunch on wednesdays monthly gym stipend one time cell phone & headphone stipend annual learning and development stipend two paid volunteer days off pre-tax commuter benefits fully stocked kitchen with drinks, snacks and candy la marzocco espresso machine with blue bottle coffee health fsa 401k plan

have you ever tried to hire a plumber? how about a house cleaner? if you have, chances are it took you way longer than it should. in the era of instant-everything, it's crazy that you still have to waste an entire afternoon researching, calling and vetting local service professionals whenever you need one. the market for hiring them is huge — $700b in the us alone — but the process is inefficient and largely offline.  thumbtack is transforming this experience end-to-end, building a marketplace that matches millions of people with local pros for almost any project. in making these connections, not only do our customers get more done every day, our pros are able to grow their businesses and make a living doing what they're great at.  ---------------------- about the product team ----------------------  our product team is small but mighty. we partner with engineering, design, analytics and more to craft a marketplace that delivers business to our pros while helping millions of customers get their projects done each year.  -------------- about the role --------------  do you want to work in a highly collaborative environment to reinvent how a large piece of the local economy works? we're looking for a product manager to partner with engineers and designers to develop great solutions for thumbtack's customers and professionals. you'll work on a variety of projects across the product with a diverse set of team members.  ---------------- responsibilities ----------------   partner with engineers and designers to ideate, prioritize and deliver great solutions for our customers and professionals define and analyze key metrics to inform decision-making and measure success conduct user research and lightweight tests to scope and prioritize product initiatives coordinate within your team and among teams at thumbtack to ensure understanding of and alignment around projects wear many hats and be key organizational glue  ------------------------ must-have qualifications ------------------------   3+ years of product management experience building consumer web/mobile products excellent user-centric design and product sense excellent analytical skills to break down and solve complex problems proven ability to collaborate cross-functionally excellent written and oral communication skills excellent business judgement ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment  --------------------------- nice-to-have qualifications ---------------------------   experience working in a marketplace business experience working at a high-growth startup  if you don't think you meet all of the criteria above but still are interested in the job, please apply. nobody checks every box, and we're looking for someone excited to join the team.  ------------- more about us  -------------  thumbtack is a local services marketplace that connects customers who need to get things done with local, skilled professionals who can help. from plumbers and painters to djs and personal trainers, thumbtack helps millions of customers find the right professional for their project in 1,000 unique categories. founded in 2009 and headquartered in san francisco, thumbtack is backed by over $250 million in investment from sequoia capital, capitalg, tiger global management, javelin investment partners and baillie gifford.   see what it's like to work here ( https://www.thumbtack.com/careers/ ) meet the pros who inspire us ( https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=khin2fcdfnm&list=plpz1nptzyds577c1b-vduybwof0crpkmv ) follow us on linkedin ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/thumbtack-inc. ) ( https://www.linkedin.com/company/thumbtack-inc. )  thumbtack embraces diversity. we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and do not discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religion, national origin, citizenship, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

doctor on demand is changing medicine, and you can help. we are looking for an experienced business-focussed data analyst to help establish an analytics center of excellence to help us align resources with patient needs, communicate effectively with customers, and chart the future of this fast growing company.   data is at the heart of doctor on demand. for this role, you will have a chance to work with a variety of financial, application, marketing and medical data to develop tools and processes to improve customer experience and engagement and help doctor on demand continue to transform the medical industry.   key responsibilities include: be the point of contact for your internal clients' data needs: manage communications with your stakeholders, and collaborate with stakeholders in defining priorities, scope and approaches for analytics deliverables. develop a deep understanding of all areas of the business that you support, and provide proactive analytical insights into those areas, driving data-driven innovation. help establish a strategic vision of doctor on demand's analytics team, both in terms of tools and technology, and in terms of techniques, process and engagement maintain a culture of high quality output and exceptional customer service: effectively communicate at all levels, ensure that work gets done well and on time, respond effectively to unexpected obstacles and reallocate resources as necessary. requirements at least 10 years of analytics and bi experience. expert sql skills. experience with a variety of standard bi tools (business objects, looker, tableau, etc.) proven track record of using data to generate insight and drive business results and customer success. strong written and verbal communication skills. experience working in a fast-paced, constantly evolving environment. a successful candidate must be comfortable embracing ambiguity and juggling a portfolio of complex and urgent projects. experience with healthcare industry a plus about doctor on demand   doctor on demand's mission is to improve the world's health through compassionate care and innovation. we believe that health is personal, and means so much more than treating illness. we're proud of the care we've provided over the years and the relationships we've developed with our patients, as evidenced by the 5-star reviews we continually receive. people use our service to gain access to some of the best physicians and licensed therapists in the country, all whenever and wherever is most convenient. it's as simple as opening the doctor on demand app on a smartphone or computer.   through live video visits, our hand-picked, us-trained doctors take patient history, perform an exam, and recommend a treatment plan. prescriptions, if needed, go directly to the pharmacy of choice. while insurance isn't required, tens of millions of americans enjoy covered medical and mental health visits through employer and health plan partnerships. to learn more about the hundreds of medical issues we treat, visit us at doctorondemand.com.

title: business analyst  department: business analytics  status: full-time, exempt  position summary: the business analyst is responsible for execution against project-oriented efforts in the areas of reporting, goal setting, data visualizations, predictive modeling, strategic analysis and refined business processes.  position responsibilities:  understand the overarching business realities, strategies and objectives in a fashion that benefits the execution of established priorities and which helps to deliver meaningful, timely information and recommendations. create easily digestible and customization reports and data visualizations. deliver individual, departmental and organizational revenue goals, grounded in appropriate data and provided in a timely fashion. create a mostly automated environment that provides visibility across a variety of business units to commissions and incentives, as a function of established goals. evaluate variables and use scientific assessment to predict results based on changing inputs. leverage data and analytics to develop new business processes and the alerts and triggers that benefit and streamline those processes identify appropriate opportunities to leverage registered developer license with tdc, such that an appropriate roadmap is laid out and accomplished in the areas of automating business processes and improved customer experience.  knowledge and skills:  bachelor's degree in business analytics, data management or statistics a plus. at least 2 years of experience performing analytic and strategic investigation. demonstrated experience and understanding of data structures. familiarity with snowflake data warehouse, amazon web services, sql-based database systems, and/or other enterprise data warehouse solutions. knowledge and understanding of data visualizations and dashboard best practices. experience working with visualization and business intelligence tools, such as tableau and looker. experience working with sql, access, excel and other resources that aid in analytic work. demonstrated programming capabilities in sql. python, r and/or any other applicable programming languages that can benefit the analytic work and objectives of the business analytics group would be a plus. ability to communicate findings to business users, such that analytic discoveries are digestible and massdrop is seeking a marketing analyst supporting the marketing team. you will deliver insights and recommendations that will directly impact decision makers and marketing campaigns across channels.  you will be highly collaborative and help the team break down and understand key metrics of the business. you should have experience and be familiar with monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing email marketing, social media, a/b marketing tests, conversion rates, retention metrics, ltv data, attribution modeling, and revenue metrics.  in this role, you will help support that everyone in marketing is empowered to make data-driven decisions and to make a positive impact on customer acquisition and retention tactics. in addition, you will be responsible for looking for data trends that provide actionable insights to help the business grow and succeed. the ideal candidate will have proven experience in analyzing e-commerce or community businesses, a track record of data-driven decision making, an aptitude for analytical thinking, and the ability to think strategically.  here is what you will do as part of the team: monitor, analyze and optimize website activity, trends, and rankings. monitor and report on customer acquisition & marketing metrics related to visits, conversions, attribution, ltv, and overall user experience score. partner with the marketing team to help drive customer growth, repeat purchases, and increase brand awareness and engagement. help marketing to analyze and create new campaign across all channels to attract new users/consumers and increase retention. help marketing to design weekly and monthly forecasting dashboards and reports to communicate business trends and opportunities. perform post-campaign analysis for all our online channels to measure effectiveness and return on investment. analyze shopping and buying behavior to inform marketing opportunities and campaigns. pull and deliver daily and weekly spend and performance reporting from all marketing vendor platforms. determine the profitability of all marketing tests and programs, and operational investments through building roi proformas. analytical lead on digital optimization a/b testing across channels. help us develop a dashboard - weekly, monthly and yoy multi-channel reports, containing key business metrics that impact daily business decisions. and here are the skills and experience necessary to be successful: minimum 5-7 years of business intelligence analytics bachelor's degree in business administration with a concentration in: information management, finance, marketing, operations knowledge of statistics, statistical analytical, and data analysis tools including sql. proven experience in building dashboards and implementing new reporting systems knowledge of and experience with reporting query tools and databases, website analytics, including analyzing a/b tests, referring traffic sources, and driving optimization insights and recommendations prior experience helping recommend and helping drive implementation of new reporting databases and dashboards in periscope and tableau.

reporting to drive strategy and measure performance against kpis across the business. you'll be responsible for building out a team of analysts, and will partner with stakeholders across the company expectations and slas on data availability, and own communications around sla performance to the business help evaluate and test new bi tools, both from a technical and end-user perspective drive bi analyst who we are? at basic american foods, we believe that kitchens and dining rooms should be filled with food people love to make and love to eat, and that's precisely why we're helping to create a world full of mealtime victories. we supply essential and innovative food to america and beyond and are in the early stages of transforming our business from a slow-moving, mature business to an exciting and growing mission-driven, strategy led food business. what we need part of our transformation is investing in our systems, including a complete overhaul of our erp which is going live q2 this year! this means we are implementing a new erp from scratch with the latest technologies and starting with clean data! we now need to establish business analytics that are impactful and ensure our growth is scalable and profitable. to do this, we're looking for a bi analyst in walnut creek ca with: a rogue passion for and proven depth in analytics. you breathe analytics this is a well-known path and excites you. you bring ideas on how to present information in a new manner, offer new insights into operations and ultimately affect how we manage the company going forward. demonstrated experience transforming analytics into meaningful insights. you know how to take different financial and business reports and create visual reports, dashboards, and analytics from raw data into easy-to-digest, business insights. a 'roll up my sleeves and get the work done' mindset. we are a small team. this role interacts with our ceo and executive team and, at the same time, is personally validating data and developing the reports that are being utilized. a 'broad jobs are exciting' mentality. our roles are broader than most large organization so this position entails working in and around master data management, data warehousing, etl, and reporting & analytics. you are a self-starter, strong in and technically comfortable around business analytics and master data management while an expert at bi developing, reporting and insights. what you will do: put your fingerprint on our erp implementation. after learning our new erp master data and various data sources, you will working with cross-functional and the executive team, adjust and tweak reporting & analytics to best measure business indicators. you see, we are big enough to have resources to do real enterprise analytics and get things done without the bureaucracy of a large organization. post erp?? once we complete the balance of the erp buildout, there are plenty of meaty data & analytics projects that will enable us to grow our business. what you will bring an endless passion for improving business through analytics complemented by these must have skills: 2 -3 years power bi or equivalent such as leaders to understand their business & analytical needs and translate data to meet these needs additional skills to set you apart: excellent verbal & written communication, analytical and problem-solving skills experience in optimizing microsoft power bi dashboards with a focus on usability, performance, flexibility, testability, and standardization be hands-on with the development of reports, analytics and visualizations development excellent cross-functional team experience as well as executive level communications experience experience working with and seamlessly facilitating communications with a geographically dispersed team we are an equal opportunity employer

lime is a smart-mobility provider that offers cities an array of mobility products including lime-e e-assist bicycles and lime-s electric scooters. lime aims to revolutionize mobility in cities and campuses by empowering residents with cleaner, more efficient, and affordable transportation options that improve urban sustainability.  we are looking for a data analyst to join our engineering team. you will drive strategic insights and detailed analytics decisions related to scaling and optimizing the whole business process. you should have strong analytical skills, excellent time-management capabilities and the ability to work under stress.  what you'll do collaborate with engineering team to identify and implement analytics that drives business efficiency research, analyze large scale operation data to optimize bike-sharing implementation and daily operation about you bachelor or masters degree in math, engineering, economics, statistics, computer science, finance or other quantitative related field 3+ years of industry experience in data analysis excellent sql experience required ability to multi-task, act with a sense of urgency and be flexible in handling changing priorities works well in a dynamic environment good people skills, both verbal and written what we offer opportunity to revolutionize transportation in your hometown with the leader in urban mobility solutions a position that offers a variety of career and resume building experiences with the fastest growing startup of 2018 scale with a rapidly growing organization, with tons of opportunity for growth play a role in the transformation of urban mobility and sustainability work with a team of fun and motivated people competitive salary and benefits we here at lime strive to build a workforce comprised of individuals with diverse backgrounds, abilities, minds, and identities that will help us to grow, not only as a company, but also as individuals. lime is an equal opportunity employer.

business intelligence analyst description sitecore is the global leader in customer experience software that enables context marketing. the sitecore® experience platform™ manages content, supplies contextual intelligence, automates communications, and enables personalized commerce at scale so marketers can deliver the personalized interactions that delight audiences, build loyalty, and drive revenue. sitecore is looking for a business intelligence analyst with the vision to help define and execute on sitecore’s internal business intelligence reporting strategy. the business intelligence analyst will help define, implement and manage the strategies, improve the technical infrastructure, assist with development and create the business intelligence reports that help sitecore staff make the right business decisions on a day-to-day basis.  your responsibilities be hands-on in creating and administrating business intelligence systems from the database layer through to the reports work closely with the bi director to ensure delivery of excellent results to stakeholders execute the implementation of reports from documented requirements extend integration to core business systems from centralised warehouse work to improve and extend the existing data model your qualifications must be able to understand both the technical and business aspect of bi experience designing, developing and deploying power bi dashboards and reports excellent experience in microsoft office excellent english communication skills both verbal and written advanced experience in microsoft excel (vba favourable) advanced powerpivot and dax advanced t-sql query knowledge experience developing ssas tabular solutions favourable experience developing ssis integrations favourable can-do attitude to take on any challenge positively and drive results work independently with an ability to set and meet timelines meticulous approach to implementation with the ability to test and confirm your own work

about imperfect  imperfect is a produce delivery startup on a mission to reduce food waste and to make fresh produce more affordable, accessible, and convenient. we source produce directly from farms, which would otherwise go to waste, and deliver it to customers' doors for an average of 30% less than grocery store prices. since our start in 2015, our customers have saved millions of pounds of produce from going to waste.  imperfect is more than just a produce box! in everything we do, we bring an appetite, lead with heart, embrace imperfection, and work to grow the movement. we aim to cultivate sustainable environments everywhere we go–whether in the office, warehouse, or field. by working at imperfect, you’re helping build a more sustainable and effective food system. you’re helping fight food waste. you’re ensuring farmers are rewarded for their full harvest. you’re improving access to healthy food in food deserts. with each curvy cucumber and misshapen potato, you’re helping shape our world for the better.  we're headquartered in san francisco with operations in each of our cities: the san francisco bay area, los angeles, portland, seattle, chicago, indianapolis, milwaukee, san antonio, austin and baltimore.  we're looking for folks who are positive, motivated, and ready to change the world. if that sounds like you, drop us a line!   about the role:  as a data analyst on the business intelligence (bi) team, you'll be a data expert supporting cross-functional teams, analyzing complex business data, and delivering insights to help drive data-driven decisions for the company. this role requires a strong level of analytical horsepower and communication skills to effectively analyze and tell the story behind the data. we're excited to have you uncover opportunities and insights to continue to fight food waste within our food system. responsibilities: interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets and translate these insights into actionable insights maintain ownership of end-to-end data analysis, including data gathering, cleaning, review, analysis, and visualization provide data expertise to various teams across the business, from ad hoc data requests to in-depth research projects, you will be collaborating with others to help them answer questions and make better decisions build and automate reporting and dashboards assist with building, maintaining, and reviewing data models and supporting our data pipeline maintain deliverable projects, and timelines communicate findings clearly to a broad range of stakeholders skills and qualifications 2+ years experience in an analytical or quantitative role airtight quantitative skills including expert proficiency with sql and excel adept at end-to-end data analyses and turning analyses into actionable recommendations for the business strong communication skills with the ability to transform data into a story for different audiences and various stakeholders and frame your recommendations with a clear view into the assumptions you have made and the rigor employed in the analysis experience leveraging common visualization tools, such as mode analytics, to tell a story with data resourcefulness with the ability to parse internal documentation, developer documentation, and code repositories impeccable attention to detail excellent time management skills bonus: proficiency with analysis languages (python, r), statistical modeling tools, data visualization tools, and creating data models via dbt about you: you are a champion for data and data accuracy you demonstrate intellectual curiosity, and a passion for translating information into actionable insights, with data big, small, structured, and messy you're a self-starter with the ability to juggle multiple projects at once you're excited to join a fast paced startup environment you share our passion for eliminating food waste in the world by learning to love ugly produce details of position: full-time, exempt position reporting to the director of business intelligence position is based out of out san francisco headquarters in the bayview salary and stock options commensurate with experience competitive benefits package includes healthcare, paid vacation, and free weekly imperfect box! physical requirements sedentary work; predominantly involves sitting most of the time standing desks and / or other ergonomic accommodation is available upon request walking, climbing stairs, and standing are required only occasionally regular work with computers, including keyboards, mouses, and screens; regular use of mobile devices, including smartphones and tablets also required individuals seeking employment at imperfect foods are considered without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, ancestry, physical or mental disability, veteran status, or sexual orientation.  u.s. e-verify notice: imperfect foods participates in e-verify in the united states. imperfect will provide the u.s. social security administration (ssa) and, if necessary, the u.s. department of homeland security (dhs), with information from each new employee's form i-9 to confirm work authorization.

data is central to twitch’s decision-making process, and analysts are a critical component to evangelize data-driven decision making in all of our operations. as an analyst at twitch, you will be in on the ground floor with your team, shaping the way product performance is measured, defining what questions should be asked, and scaling analytics methods and tools to support our growing business, leading the way for high quality, high velocity decisions for your team.  for this role, we’re looking for a data analyst who will assist our viewer experience team. the viewer experience team’s mission is to help connect twitch viewers with compelling content from our streamers. your role on the team is to level up the viewer experience stakeholders and guide them towards better decision making from the available data. in a typical week or month, you will be responsible for data instrumentation, dashboard/report building, metrics reviews, and ad hoc analysis. responsibilities evangelize data knowledge and insights: manage communications with your stakeholders and other teams, collaborate with both technical and non-technical colleagues to complete data projects and ensure all parties can use the insights to further improve maintain a customer-centric focus: strive to be a domain and product expert through data, develop trust among your peers and stakeholders, and ensure that your team has access to data to make decisions prioritize and execute in the face of ambiguity: work with stakeholders and mentors to distill the problem, adapt your tools to answer complicated questions, and identify the trade-offs between speed and quality of different approaches create analytical frameworks to measure team success: partner with cross-functional teams to define success metrics, create approaches to track the data and troubleshoot errors, quantify and evaluate the data, then develop a common language for all colleagues to understand these kpis operationalize data processes: provide the team with ad-hoc analysis, automated dashboards, and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state of the business requirements 2+ years of industry experience in a relevant field a/b testing experience with an understanding of hypothesis testing and power analysis expert sql skills-your ability to tap into our data pipeline will be key to your success proven track record of using data to generate insight and drive business results fluency in data analysis and communication around data, including time series analysis, experimentation, data visualization, and defining kpi strategy for your business strong written and verbal communication skills  bonus points product analytics experience with signup funnels, engagement metrics, and retention analysis. technical background and programming experience–especially r or python statistics knowledge and hypothesis testing experience experience developing dashboards using d3.js or tableau passion about online communities, games, and twitch perks medical, dental, vision & disability insurance 401(k) maternity & parental leave flexible pto commuter benefits amazon employee discount monthly contribution & discounts for wellness related activities & programs (e.g., gym memberships, off-site massages, etc.) breakfast, lunch & dinner served daily free snacks & beverages #li-sm1  launched in 2011, twitch is a global community that comes together each day to create multiplayer entertainment: unique, live, unpredictable experiences created by the shared interactions of millions. at any given moment, more than a million people come together from all over the globe to interact around this distinct form of live entertainment. from streaming, watching, chatting, and cheering about video games and esports to many other interests including traditional sports, anime, sci-fi, wrestling, music, cooking, the creative arts, and more, there’s something for everyone on twitch.  we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at twitch. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  4 years of experience in financial/quantitative analysis.  preferred qualifications: experience working with databases, using sql across standard relational environments.  experience with programming and scripting languages.  experience working on large distributed data systems  knowledge of industrial grade is architectures and reporting tools.  ability to meet deadlines and work well in ambiguous environments.  excellent project management skills. about the job at google, data drives all of our decision-making. as part of the finance business intelligence team, you will use data to inform business and product decisions across the company. using your technical skills, business acumen and creativity, you will build tools to automate reporting and generate insight that will allow clients to quickly and accurately see how our key business products and processes are performing. previous experience managing finance systems projects, with emphasis on providing business intelligence and data driven insight through reporting, will have equipped you well for this role. you’ll be involved in projects from inception to delivery, ensuring that your reporting delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business. you will also have extensive knowledge of key financial systems, such as oracle and hyperion, and experience working with a range of other business intelligence tools and platforms.  sales finance is part of google’s financial planning and analysis (fp&a) organization, providing financial and analytical support to google’s business organization. our work is integral to the operations and strategic decision-making of the commercial teams across all our advertising products. from understanding market and usage trends to exploring the productivity and returns on our various investments, the finance organization is an important partner and adviser to the commercial leaders. in this role, you will work on a team that provides finance support to sales leadership. the name google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. and nobody at google loves big numbers like the finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across google products. from developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business. responsibilities  partner with business and finance leadership and their teams to understand needs, ensuring that our data solutions are an excellent fit to their evolving needs.  partner with business intelligence to shape google’s data infrastructure, including business intelligence, reporting, and analytics platforms.  drive cross-functional systems projects with google customer solutions (gcs) business/business intelligence/engineering teams to improve the visibility, profitability, and risk profile for gcs.  manage, drive, and deliver multiple data workstreams on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis.  contribute to the development of the team’s tools, skills, culture, and impact. at google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. we also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. see also google's eeo policy and eeo is the law. if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .
