chime is dedicated to helping our members obtain financial peace of mind. that’s why we offer an award-winning bank account that doesn’t charge unnecessary fees, gives members early access to their paychecks, and helps them save money automatically. hundreds of thousands of people use the chime mobile app and debit card to make purchases, track spending, save for the future, and more. our members love chime and use it daily.  we believe that the big banks fail to help their members achieve financial health - and in many cases work against it, charging hundreds of dollars in hidden fees and pushing products that drive people into debt. we don’t think it needs to be this way, so we’re out to beat them.  we have one of the most experienced management teams in fintech and have raised over $100m in funding and are backed by menlo ventures, omidyar, crosslink, and others. if you’re looking to join a small but fast-growing company with a beloved, daily-use product and an authentic mission that puts people first, we want to meet you.  what you'll do  in this role, you'll analyze data to drive better decision making and create reporting for key business functions with a focus on member services and risk. specifically, you'll:  define and implement kpi/metrics reporting & dashboards for key business functions (member services, risk operations, and general business intelligence). work closely with the member services and risk operations team to develop data driven insights to drive operational improvements and create predictive models to optimize customer happiness and minimize fraud. work with data architects on improving data sources by implementing standardized calculations and variables. partner with product to build and refine products; help manage internal/external analytic platforms and tools.  qualifications   5+ years of experience in an analytics, data science, or business operations role. masters degree with a quantitative focus is plus. you have a solid understanding of sql and can use or a willingness to learn r/python. experience working in looker is a plus. a track record of defining and leading data intensive analytic projects to success. you are collaborative and are able to effectively communicate across a variety of business functions and levels. understanding of financial services, financial products, and the associated risk.  a few of the perks of working at chime:  competitive salary and equity based on experience, with medical and dental benefits. free snacks and drinks, plus catered wednesday lunches. flexible vacation policy. monthly happy hours and company events. dog-friendly office. a challenging and fulfilling opportunity to join one of the most experienced teams in fintech and help create a completely new kind of bank.  pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. chime is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

the digital services data analyst will be the subject matter expert for all data relating to digital banking services. they will be responsible for architecting, analyzing, interpreting and reporting on data from multiple sources with various tools. duties of the data analyst frequently include importing, cleaning, transforming, validating, and modeling data with the purpose of understanding or making conclusions from the data for decision making purposes. the data analyst is responsible for running queries, reporting data and/or providing access to a limited number of database users. the data analyst will be responsible for improving data quality and for designing or presenting conclusions gained from analyzing data using statistical tools like microsoft excel, tableau and cognos. role and responsibilities perform business and data analysis for digital services and products as well as branch data, supporting bank strategy and team initiatives, and collaborating with business analysts, program/product managers, operations, and it. maintain several tableau interactive dashboards and cognos reports to facilitate day to day activities. recognize opportunities to develop new dashboards from spreadsheet data or directly from various source systems. monitor multiple internal it systems and ensure the data quality is consistent and clean. audit the data flowing from internal transaction systems into the data warehouse and subsequently into the front end tools (tableau and cognos). review and log all bugs via a service desk and work with the internal data warehouse teams to resolve the issues. work with the data governance team to scrub or cleanse the data in source system and augment the data if the data does not exist in the source system. minimum qualifications bachelor's degree preferred; equivalent work experience may be considered in lieu of a four year degree; ms/mba a plus minimum 3-4 years’ experience in report writing using business intelligence tools including but not limited to, cognos and tableau 2+ years' experience in online, mobile and payments data sequel server and data base experience proven experience working with excel and developing and maintaining various analyses and reporting tools positive, team-oriented and enthusiastic attitude knowledge of commonly used financial industry concepts, practices and guidelines excellent oral communication and technical writing skills strong research, analytical, planning and organizational skills ability to make objective observations, examination, evaluations and recommendations

job description  ubisoft, a global leader in the video games and entertainment industry, is seeking a senior media analyst to help leverage data to make a meaningful impact with our media teams. this person will bring their expertise to provide advice during the initial planning stages of campaigns, measure and optimize results during execution, and lead critical post mortem analyses to improve future strategies. responsibilities: work closely with media managers to create strategies and measure success of campaigns, channels and customer segments performance, ensuring objectives are being met constantly seek ways to improve the accuracy or timeliness of campaign measurements assess, implement and evangelize best practices in the organization evaluate trends of online and offline campaigns and provide recommendations for optimization contribute to the design and measurement of new tactics deemed appropriate in furthering brand and sales objectives configure and implement cross channel analyses partner with the business intelligence team to define the data roadmap for media data and make connections with other data stay up to date on current data and technology developments and advertising industry trends utilize statistical modeling techniques to transform raw data from multiple sources into actionable insights that ensure media efforts are effectively driving incremental engagement and conversion create, manage and distribute data and insights via regular and ad-hoc reporting utilizing various analytics tools and platforms implement, maintain and improve media data collection and tracking processes  qualifications  bachelor degree in a technical or quantitative discipline (mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science, engineering), master’s preferred 5+ years professional experience analyzing media data strong knowledge of digital and traditional media required knowledge of or experience using one or more of the following would be beneficial: multi-channel attribution analyses third party ad serving platforms, such as doubleclick ad platforms such as facebook, youtube adwords, double click bid manager, snapchat, twitter, etc. syndicated media data sources (ispot, kantar, comscore) web analytics platforms (adobe analytics) dmps (blue kai, adobe audience manager) proven analytical skills; ability to analyze raw data, draw conclusions, and develop actionable recommendations knowledge of visual techniques for data analysis and presentation excellent organizational, communication and interpersonal skills media agency or ad tech experience a plus in-depth knowledge of sql, tableau and excel; programming experience and knowledge of r or python a plus additional information  ubisoft is committed to creating an inclusive work environment that reflects the diversity of our player community. we are an equal opportunity employer. qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, ethnicity, religion, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.

data scientist @ bittorrent/tron role summary do you want to create a free and decentralized internet through blockchain and open a new borderless economy on a global scale? we are looking for a highly motivated data scientist mid-level through senior in experience, passionate about big data and experiment design to join tron’s project atlas team. projects will span many analytics initiatives, ranging from in-app features to product marketing, pricing and more. the ideal candidate will show a strong grasp of business models and statistics, excellent understanding of hypothesis testing, great analytical and problem-solving skills and the ability to coherently describe complex mathematical concepts to a layman audience. key responsibilities provide the insights and discovery on a variety of dataset across the business. serve as the data and analytics domain expert, evangelizing data literacy and building a suite of tools to empower the team to make data-informed decisions: dashboards, reports, ad-hoc queries, insightful observations drive and own a/b testing strategies, implementations, and analysis provide support and expertise to product managers in defining kpis and technical data requirements to ensure all product features and initiatives launch with proper metric tracking. deliver data and data analysis on an ad-hoc basis using whatever tools are necessary for the task measure network performance in one of the world’s largest distributed applications. key skills strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities. good working knowledge of statistics and modeling (be able to explain as well as setup tests). knowledge and experience in a/b testing - know about statistical test, bayesian inference. strong written and verbal communication skills - be able to take complex math and analytical concepts and explain to working teams and client executives. strong sql capabilities - experience querying data from relational db engines. strong teamwork - internally with our teams as well as with clients. knowledge in machine learning algorithm such as linear/logistic-regression, neural-networks and others would be a strong plus. our ideal candidate ms required, ideally in a relevant field to analytics (finance, business, engineering, information systems, math, science, etc). at least 2 years of professional experience as a data scientist / senior analyst experience with the big data technology stack (hdfs, mapreduce, spark, hive) and big data processing direct database experience: data structures, modeling, and sql expertise etl processing experience using python or equivalent java experience with mapreduce using hadoop or spark experience with aws tools/services experience with a business intelligence dashboards tool (tableau, google data studio, superset, or similar) excellent communication skills what we offer competitive salary, stock options, and 401k. 100% paid health coverage (for you and your family) that includes dental and vision plans. flexible working hours, including the ability to work from home (on occasion or as needed), and three weeks paid time off. plenty of free food at the office, 4 rotating kegs on tap, and yummy catered lunches. regular team-wide outdoor events and parties. membership at 24-hour fitness (or $50/month toward a gym of your choice). your choice of the latest, top-of-the-line equipment and tools to work with. work with heaps of smart, awesome people, including a surprising number of people who are great at pool, pinball, and foosball. bittorrent is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status or disability status.

************** about pro host **************  the homes business focuses on helping guests experience the world in a more authentic and meaningful way by staying with gracious hosts who offer their own unique spaces and hospitality. our guests connect with those hosts through the airbnb marketplace, which is unlike any other in the world. the pro host team in the homes business aims to allow anyone with a passion for providing magical hospitality to build and grow a successful business on airbnb. we do this by partnering with businesses to create the future of hospitality.  ************** about the role **************  airbnb product managers work with teams of engineers, designers, and user experience researchers to build the products with which our users engage daily. the pro host team is seeking intellectually curious and entrepreneurial product managers to build innovative products for our hosts. the team has audacious goals in growing the number of homes on the platform, the number of markets we serve, and the quality of those homes. design thinking, host empathy, a familiarity with operations, and ability to balance automation with a human touch will be critical for this role.  ---------------- responsibilities ----------------   sets vision for a product team. challenges the status quo and inspires people toward a unified destination. creates clear goals for the team and efficiently executes to ship product and deliver impact for our business and users. leads large, cross-functional groups of people to deliver on team's mission (without necessarily managing team members). communicates concisely and influences outcomes. identify new market openings, define strategy, and lead the execution of products that delight airbnb's pro hosts. build alignment across the company, from cross-functional partners including marketing, pr, and customer experience, to leadership and executive team. own product experience for the entire pro host journey.  -------------- qualifications --------------   5-8 years of product management experience at a technology company, ideally products that are part of a marketplace. demonstrated track record of product leadership. ability to lead and influence teams. ability to quickly absorb technical concepts and communicate them to a non-technical audience. experience building b2b products or platform ecosystems. entrepreneurial drive and demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in an innovative and fast-paced environment. creative problem solver. able to identify real obstacles and viable solutions.

zeus - flawless stays.  founded in november 2015 and based in san francisco, california, zeus is shaking up the $12b corporate housing industry through its unique strategy of leasing unfurnished, privately-owned homes and converting them into expertly appointed, full-service corporate housing units for today’s global professional. we're passionate about delivering world-class customer service and becoming the most trusted provider of corporate housing on earth. with 700+ homes spanning the san francisco bay area, los angeles, washington d.c., seattle ( more cities coming soon), we are well on our way to realizing our vision. zeus has raised $14.1m in financing from initialized capital, google ventures, bowery capital, and floodgate. the zeus founders have all had previous exits and have worked in real estate and technology for over 10 years.  the role  you will partner with leaders across the company to measure the performance of their teams and make data-driven decisions to improve them. this could include sales, operations, finance, technology, and executive leaders. your primary tool for sharing and analyzing data will be our bi platform (looker). what you will do own our bi platform. organize, develop, and maintain it such that it's easily usable by all teams take company kpis and create the definitive way of measuring them. be the source of truth. build dashboards and reports for every department so they understand performance and what's driving it help department heads understand their data, capture new data, and make data-driven decisions work with data engineering to add data to our bi platform as needed track data about our industry so we understand where we fit in the broader market what we are looking for 5+ years of experience in bi/analytics ability to deeply understand the nuances of our complex business ability to clearly and concisely explain data through written, oral, and visual means proficient in sql. can take raw database and create complex sql queries/views as needed. excellent organizational skills. we have a lot of data to keep track of. ability to thrive and adapt in a high growth, rapidly changing environment. experience with looker is a bonus (our bi platform) benefits 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and their dependents parking, commuter pass, and education or certification expense coverage 20 days paid time off per year + all major holidays catered daily team lunches 401k with matching relocation package zeus is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status in any of its activities or operations.  we do not accept calls from 3rd party recruiters.

company description: okta is the foundation for secure connections between people and technology. by harnessing the power of the cloud, okta allows people to access applications on any device at any time, while still enforcing strong security protections. it integrates directly with an organization's existing directories and identity systems, as well as 4,000+ applications.  because okta runs on an integrated platform, organizations can implement the service quickly at large scale and low total cost.  thousands of customers, including adobe, allergan, nasdaq, linkedin, and 20th century fox, trust okta to help their organizations work faster, boost revenue, and stay secure.  to learn more about okta, visit: https://www.okta.com.  job purpose: the opportunity for okta is massive: any company is a company we can make more productive and more secure. as every company becomes a technology company, okta is the foundation that lets them make this transition successfully. our vision is to bring the benefits of identity to every company.  to help us achieve this ambitious growth objective we are seeking a deep thinker who can rapidly marshall data and insights to power high quality real-time decision making across the organization, and to own analytics and operational reporting for the vps of product and corporate marketing.  this person is responsible for helping their business partners to understand their performance, and identify opportunities for increased efficiency. equal parts data analyst, product manager, and strategy consultant, this role will be an instrumental part of our strategy and operations team.  the ideal candidate brings a deep understanding of b2b go-to-market (and empathy for demand marketers!), fluency working with data and quantitative reasoning, excellent written and verbal communication skills, and most importantly, a passion for teamwork and collaboration. the ideal profile will have experience in a fast paced high growth environment with technology companies, saas or enterprise software.  duties and responsibilities:  metrics and reporting: take ownership of our demand gen metrics and serve as the product manager for reporting. make sure that every stakeholder up through the president understands their performance and can access the data they need to optimize their motion. insights and analysis: be the go-to person for big challenging, strategic questions. develop insightful analyses that guide decision making for your business partners.  qualifications:  5+ years related work experience – marketing or sales operations, management consulting or related excellent written and verbal communication ability to communicate and influence at all levels of the organization from president to sdr demonstrated ability to collaborate, build consensus, and influence with personable persistence ability to prioritize in a fast paced highly demanding environment expert excel data modeling and analysis skills expert salesforce reporting skills advanced sql and fluency working with large data sets / data warehousing fluency in tableau direct work experience in demand gen and/or sales development preferred ba or bs in economics, math, computer science, finance or other quantitative discipline masters degree a plus  okta is an equal opportunity employer.  #li-bm1

Job_Description: founded in 2012, instacart is a leader in north american online groceries and one of the fastest growing companies in e-commerce. instacart's same-day delivery and pickup services bring everyday essentials and fresh groceries to consumers in the u.s. and canada in as fast as an hour. at instacart, we believe that great people are the ingredients for success. we like to think that we are like a potluck, everyone brings something new, different and flavorful to the table. our mix of thoughtful, inventive and neighborly employees work together to deliver our common goal, to make grocery shopping effortless, and give valuable time back to our customers. we believe that just as meals are best shared together, success is best shared together. if this excites you, then instacart just might be the place for you. welcome home.  your day to day…   proactively conduct quantitative analysis of instacart's data that results in actionable insights and recommendations own identifying key questions, problems, kpis and develop analytical frameworks to monitor and improve our product and the experience of our customers and shoppers own the development of statistical models on large datasets to extract trends, measure results and outcomes, and to predict future performance of our product own the design of rigorous experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions present findings to stakeholders and leadership teams at instacart to influence and strengthen business decisions drive the collection of new data and the refinement of existing data sources provide access to data through dashboards and other analytical tools to empower your team through self-service. strategize and look for opportunities to automate insights through alerting and anomaly detection  you have…   3-10 years' work experience (depending on level) in a quantitative role at a product company ability to write complex, efficient, and eloquent sql queries to extract data ability to write efficient and eloquent code in python (preferred), r, or c/c++ ability to run rigorous experiments and come up with scientifically sound recommendations ability to quickly understand business concepts and influence product decision making a desire to build and improve consumer software products eagerness to learn, flexibility to pivot when needed, savviness to navigate and thrive in a dynamic environment, and a growth mindset needed to build a successful team and company  want to learn more? lettuce show you the way!  you will be joining a growing data science team and will tackle some of the most challenging problems that are transforming how people buy groceries every day. you will be embedded in our product teams as a key partner in uncovering barriers in the product's usability and utilize these insights to inform product improvements that drive angle-changing growth. we're looking for a self-driven, strategic thinker who can hit the ground running to ultimately influence decision-making across the entire organization.  want to see a slice of life at instacart? checkout #tasteofinstacart on instagram and linkedin   instacart news ( https://medium.com/@instacart ) tech blog ( http://tech.instacart.com/ )  instacart is committed to fostering a diverse work environment and proud to be an equal opportunity employer. as we highly value diversity in our current and future employees, we do not discriminate (including in our hiring and promotion practices) on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender expression , sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other characteristic protected by law.

about us: want to join a company on the cutting edge of technology and travel? want to be part of a fantastic and fun company that’s revolutionizing the online travel advertising space?  specializing in traveler path-to-purchase data for over a decade, sojern is travel's direct demand engine for thousands of brands -- from global enterprises to boutique operators -- across the hotel, airline, cruise, transportation, tourism industries, and more. analyzing the world's travel intent signals with its proprietary data science methods, the company delivered $10b in generated bookings for its clients to date by activating multi-channel branding and performance solutions on the sojern traveler platform.  recognized on the top company cultures list by entrepreneur magazine, sojern is headquartered in san francisco, with teams based in dubai, dublin, hong kong, london, mexico city, new york, omaha, paris, singapore, and sydney.  who are you?  you are an experienced product manager with knowledge of ad tech, sem, the travel industry, audience management and/or performance marketing. you have formed your own point of view on how to deliver successful products in a rapidly changing ecosystem. you have built and shipped products in the past, owning the entire end-to-end process from ideation to rollout and post-rollout management. you know what it means to own a product and desire to be in a position of personal responsibility for your product’s growth and ongoing success.  you have raving fans who love your approach to product management, both on the technical and commercial teams. internal customers trust your judgment and applaud your communication skills. engineering leaders approve of your specifications -- they are neither bare-bones haikus, nor are they overly-prescriptive...they are just right.  you have a strong customer service orientation, and think about the needs/wants of both internal and external customers in your daily decision-making and product leadership approach. you are a natural problem solver, have a “no excuses” mentality and generally maintain a positive outlook when difficulties arise. you have excellent time management skills, and possess the ability to focus intently on a given product or feature and work relentlessly to design the “right” product.  you are analytical and comfortable with technology. maybe you have an mba, or perhaps you’ve just naturally developed a strong business acumen along the way. you probably have around 3-5 years of recent product management experience in online software development or the online travel sector. more likely than not, you graduated from a rigorous undergraduate academic program with good marks.  what will you be doing?   you will own the product roadmap and portfolio for sojern’s fastest growing product offering. your end-to-end product lifecycle management responsibilities will include: ideation, stakeholder management, customer feedback, product development, rollout/go-to-market strategy, managing a backlog and ongoing, continuous innovation for your product(s) you will work directly with engineering to prioritize backlogs, manage sprints, and deliver product features in an agile environment you will interface directly with commercial teams: gms, sales leaders, account managers, partner managers and advertising customers directly, collaborating on potential solutions and gathering feedback for new products and product features you will lead a cross-functional team, comprised of leaders from multiple disciplines within the company, focused on the ongoing success of your product(s)  you will be:  data-driven and results-oriented experienced running, optimizing and iterating on sem campaigns experienced working with a large group of diverse internal stakeholders passionate about building tools to drive efficiencies for a rapidly scaling business able to ruthlessly prioritize your backlogs in the midst of rapid evolutionary change experienced in agile development methodologies exceptionally good at authentically understanding the needs of our customers, and representing those needs in the form of concrete product requirements self-motivated; exhibiting strong self-management and a sense of urgency able to manage multiple projects and collaborate effectively with other people and departments in a fast-paced, dynamic environment an exceptionally strong writer and presenter able to get things done amid tight time constraints willing to travel occasionally (international and domestic)  you will have:  a bachelor’s degree from an accredited college or university. strong preference given for computer science (cs) or business undergraduate degrees (bs, bba). an mba is also highly desirable 3+ years of relevant experience working as a product manager samples of product requirements that you can share, or the ability to otherwise demonstrate personal excellence in this area strong knowledge of programmatic advertising and big data is a plus a strong technical acumen (explicit engineering background not required)  you will get bonus points for:  travel sector experience experience working with online audiences and targeting tools (web and mobile) previous engineering experience or demonstrable computer science background previous work in strategy or management consulting  perks:  culture: our team loves a good time snacks: well-stocked kitchen to fill your breakfast, lunch, and snack needs opportunities: be part of a growing team with training and support to help you grow give back: we give 40 hours a year to volunteer and organize office volunteer programs with local organizations ownership: lead innovative and challenging projects meals: monthly catered lunches & happy hours vacation: flexible time off wealth: stock options  at sojern, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

product manager:   we are seeking a skilled product manager that has a passion for digital advertising and data-driven platforms. you enjoy gaining a deep understanding of relevant technology and your target customer, creatively solving tough problems, and can effectively communicate your solutions. you are a team player and enjoy working in a collaborative and fast-paced environment. you enjoy playing with data to support your decisions, pinpointing areas of product prioritization and helping align tactical implementation with corporate strategy.   working with internal teams and external stakeholders you will identify product opportunities and partner with engineering to build effective solutions. you will be responsible for the roadmap, feature definition and prioritization of our overall platform supporting ads and analytics products. you need a strong understanding of the back-end workings of a multi-tenant platform as well as understand how to make customer-facing features and workflows as usable as possible.   primary responsibilities: work with key stakeholders to evaluate product needs and identify key business drivers in order to develop a product roadmap develop detailed product requirements inclusive of product mocks and work with engineering to verify understanding and determine loe build business cases and analytical support/insight for new business initiatives; this requires identifying and understanding key issues for particular customer personas, quantitatively analyzing these issues, and communicating key insights and results communicating new product features to internal teams and provide training and related materials    required experience: relevant experience as product manager in digital advertising, marketing technology or related industry required strong problem-solving capabilities evidenced by a proven ability to quantitatively and qualitatively analyze product concepts, strategic opportunities and competitive threats excellent interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to influence cross-functional teams ability to work in a fast-paced, startup environment strong communication skills so that messages can be succinctly delivered to market strong organizational skills; able to juggle several projects at the same time while staying focused on the highest priority one bachelor's degree required. mba preferred

you will work closely with the business stakeholders as well as your engineering team and the rest of the product team to deliver and scale our products that are used by our partners.   ideal results.   this product manager role is available in our san francisco office. the ideal candidate will be innovative and able to craft a vision and communicate it with stakeholders, define products, hotwire launched in 2000, hotwire is one of the earliest innovators in the online travel arena and part of the expedia group family of brands. our roots are in california, and we also have offices in seattle along with an important and fast-growing product & technology presence in gurgaon, india. hotwire has the energy and pace of a startup, plus the stability and backing of the incredible expedia family of companies. hotwire’s culture centers around delivering value to customers and supply partners by being passionate about building great products with the latest and greatest technologies available. we pride ourselves on our organizational transparency, a bias to take action and a customer-centric approach to everything we do. hotwire differentiates itself as a brand within the travel marketplace by offering a unique core value proposition for customers and suppliers with our opaque pricing model. this concept revolves around offering great bargains on hotel room nights without sharing the specific name or location of the hotel until the booking is complete. by giving this flexibility to our suppliers, we can offer great value to our customers. hotwire also offers a full retail suite of other travel products that can fulfill virtually any customer travel need. are you passionate about data analysis? are you a master in excel? do you find travel fascinating and always wondered what it looks like behind the scenes? about the position hotwire’s supply analytics team is positioned as a retail analytics partner to the global supply team, ensuring the health of hotwire’s business model and to further identify future opportunity. we maximize the value of our inventory by evaluating where customers’ demand and hoteliers’ offer meets at best. our team is looking for an analyst with a passion for using data to hypothesize, investigate and solve real-world problems. you will enjoy working with various data sets, spanning from finance, web, marketing, to booking data, over different data platforms, collaborating with bright minds from diverse groups on regular basis. you'll be able to see the impact of your work and analyses on the business and contribute deeply. responsibilities: you complete ad-hoc analysis requests using relational databases/aws, excel, tableau (or looker), hive, python, or r. you create dashboards & reports and work on ad-hoc analysis. you use data to find insights and make data-driven decisions to support and advise our leadership team. you collaborate with various teams - data science, bi, supply, strategy, and other analytics teams. you will work with remote team members and foster relationships as part of a multi-functional project team. you are comfortable working with unstructured and massive data sets. you design and implement reporting solutions as an end state of analyses. you enable internal partners to make data-driven decisions. you build, maintain and monitor kpis and reports. basic qualifications bachelor’s degree (majors in business, statistics, computer science, or data science) with 3+ years of relevant experience. you can write advanced sql code and know basic etl. advanced excel skills. familiarity with tableau, looker, or similar reporting tool. familiarity with a scripting language. you have a bias for action. you think big and small to grasp the entire picture while taking care of details. preferred qualification experience with the agile process and jira board. stakeholder engagement and management skills. why join us: expedia group recognizes our success is dependent on the success of our people. we are the world's travel platform, made up of the most knowledgeable, passionate, and creative people in our business. our brands recognize the power of travel to break down barriers and make people's lives better – that responsibility inspires us to be the place where exceptional people want to do their best work, and to provide them to tools to do so. whether you're applying to work in engineering or customer support, marketing or lodging supply, at expedia group we act as one team, working towards a common goal; to bring the world within reach. we relentlessly strive for better, but not at the cost of the customer. we act with humility and optimism, respecting all ideas. we value diversity and voices of all volumes. we are a global organization but keep our feet on the ground so we can act fast and stay simple. our teams also have the chance to give back on a local level and make a difference through our corporate social responsibility who is yotascale? good question. yotascale is a well-funded silicon valley startup that has built the world’s best enterprise-class cloud infrastructure management platform. the yotascale platform leverages advanced machine learning to deliver cloud infrastructure optimization. the company already has flagship paying customers including expedia, adroll, and reltio.  what is the role? as a senior product manager, you will be designing, developing and launching several new products for yotascale. the ideal candidate for this role will have experience working on agile software development teams, as well as strong domain knowledge in the cloud computing and enterprise infrastructure space. you will collaborate closely with other product managers, engineering, qa, ux, and product marketing team members to ensure a competitive, compelling, next-generation product experience for our customers. yotascale is an early-stage startup and although your primary responsibility is to be a product manager, you will also have opportunity to contribute and shape the company as it grows. you will be working alongside the founders of the company who will rely on your expertise to make critical decisions in the direction of the organization. this responsibility requires a strong bias towards action, an ability to manage uncertainty, to look at problems from many perspectives, and to be an owner at all times. this is an exciting opportunity for anyone looking to have a greater impact in their day-to-day work.  what will you be doing? develop and champion a product vision, product strategy and product roadmap in support of corporate goals and objectives be the voice of customers. foster impactful, personal customer relationships. bring the customer’s perspective to every aspect of innovation. build a backlog and roadmap that excites customers and colleagues alike develop high-level and detailed storyboards, mockups, and prototypes to effectively communicate new product ideas use customer & market research, customer and user feedback, customer usage, and competitive analysis to identify new product opportunities and enhancements keep abreast of the competitive landscape and continuously strive to build differentiated product features and user experiences actively participate in scrum meetings to ensure product features are built as per the specifications defined manage the entire release cycle from requirements all the way to product readiness launch products on a regular basis define, track, and improve key product metrics engage closely with the engineering team to help determine the best technical implementation methods as well as a reasonable implementation schedule what are we looking for? ba/bs in computer science or a related technical field 5+ years of product management for b2b saas products deep domain knowledge in cloud computing experience launching 1.0 products deep understanding of agile software development processes hands on involvement with launching product releases from ideation, developing user stories, performing user acceptance testing, and measuring in-life product metrics able to write clear and concise user stories from a functional requirement standpoint user-focused thinker with ability to translate user feedback and usage data into requirements experience presenting to executive leadership and handling sensitive customer situations ability to handle multiple competing priorities in a fast-paced environment strong troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills ability to lead and work autonomously strong organizational, written and oral communication skills adept at prioritizing features and evaluating tradeoffs experience building product roadmaps and articulating the thinking behind it experience using jira to manage backlog and document user stories (desired) experience at early stage startups (desired)  if this sounds like you, then we want to hear from you. send us an email with your resume at jobs@yotascale.com. new to working at startups? consider reading this to see if it’s the right fit for you. apply for this job

about the job: kenshoo in-market data science team is hiring for the san francisco office ! the role of the analytics team is to empower customers to leverage kenshoo's suite of algorithmic products such as bid optimizers and to demonstrate and test the value of these algorithmic products internally and externally. the ideal candidate should have strong data analysis skills as well as programming skills and good understanding of statistics and hypothesis testing. the ideal candidate will show an intuitive understanding of digital marketing, a strong grasp of business models and statistics, excellent analytical and problem solving skills and the ability to coherently describe complex mathematical concepts to a layman audience. the candidate should also demonstrate a consultative approach to addressing client needs. this role will report to director of analytics and will be positioned in san francisco.  responsibilities: have a full understanding of kenshoo's optimization capabilities and relevant products, for customers' and internal training and support. represent kenshoo research in conversations with clients and partners. advocate for our algorithmic solutions, data driven approaches and view of digital marketing and provide consultation how to best set up and leverage kenshoo’s optimization products. be part of our research team to provide both client feedback and analysis to help guide data driven decisions to improve our products. perform analysis of customer data using ml and statistic methods to provide clients with an understanding of how to read ab test results, compare attribution strategies and more. help build internal tools that allow the automation of data analysis to provide both proactive and reactive support for kenshoo’s optimization products. build pocs ( proof of concept ) that will be tested in production to solve for clients optimization needs using machine learning tools. requirements: skills/attributes required: good working knowledge of statistics and modeling (be able to explain as well as setup tests). strong analytical and problem solving capabilities. strong sql capabilities - experience querying data from relational db engines. experience with advanced analytical tools (at least on of these : python scientific libraries, r, matlab). strong written and verbal communication skills - be able to take complex math and analytical concepts and explain to working teams and client executives. strong teamwork - internally with our teams as well as with clients. prior experience in the internet marketing industry. knowledge in machine learning algorithm such as linear/logistic-regression, neural-networks and others would be a strong plus. knowledge and experience in a/b testing would be a strong plus - know about statistical test, bayesian inference education/experience: bs/ba required, ideally in a relevant field to analytics (finance, business, engineering, information systems, math, science, etc). 3+ years in consulting/business analytics roles. ms in machine learning, data science, statistics, information systems, business intelligence a strong plus. experience with and understanding of the big data technology stack (hdfs, mapreduce, spark, hive) - a strong plus. having worked at google, msft, facebook, or other top internet company in an analytics/business intelligence role a strong plus. having worked in internet marketing analytics at a top advertiser a strong plus./ mba a plus but not required. region: emea

position description a staff data scientist is responsible for analyzing large data sets, developing custom models and authoring deployable algorithms. staff data scientists typically work within optimization.work independently to manage multiple projects at once while ensuring deadlines are met and data output is accurate and appropriate for the business. must also be able to deal with summary the staff data scientist, supply chain strategy & analytics, will lead various projects that deliver future operational strategies across samsclub’s e-commerce supply chain. the staff data scientist will be primarily responsible for leading advanced analytical modeling, simulation and optimization projects sponsored by the senior executive team. he/she will support our strategic plans, reporting team – a future-focused, action-biased, data-driven department chartered with improving all aspects of the supply chain from network design to inbound/outbound transportation and multi-channel initiatives by leveraging big data. this is a high-impact and high-visibility role within the organization with expectations to deliver immediate results.

slack has quickly become the preferred way for teams to get work done within companies of all sizes, from startups like lyft and airbnb to fortune 500 companies like capital one and ibm. what happens when work transcends organizational boundaries? that’s where you come in. as lead product manager for cross-team communication, you will define the experience millions of people rely on every day to collaborate across organizational boundaries.  today, that experience starts with shared channels, which enable slack teams to communicate with each other in the same ways they already do internally: via slack. you will lead the team through the final stages of the shared channels open beta, and help define and execute the long term strategy for making people’s working lives simpler, more pleasant and more productive across organizational boundaries and throughout the network of companies using slack.  what you will be doing you will be responsible for driving product roadmap and execution for a big chunk of cross-team communication, in concert with cross-functional peers you'll balance the needs of administrators and end users, providing both admin tooling and the end user experience you will drive execution against our plan in collaboration with engineering and design peers: making tradeoffs, anticipating staffing needs, risks, and ensuring frequent and clear communication internally and with customers you will help shape slack’s product development process while we grow what you should have passionate about slack and the problem we are solving (previous enterprise software experience is not required) tireless eye for detail and demonstrated obsession with building great user experiences experience building and delivering multiple successful products as an individual contributor (we expect you to get your hands dirty!) ability to paint a concise, compelling vision and rally a team behind it, balancing short term needs with long term strategy comfortable and skilled at presenting to audiences of all sizes, from executive meetings with our ceo, to customer meetings, to company all-hands and external events experience working on fast-growing network-effect products is strongly preferred technically proficient: capable of wading into the details, but can also drive 30k foot view creativity in strategy and execution tactics, and discomfort with the status quo slack is an equal opportunity employer and participant in the u.s. federal e-verify program. women, minorities, individuals with disabilities and protected veterans are encouraged to apply. slack will consider qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the san francisco fair chance ordinance.  slack is a layer of the business technology stack that brings together people, data, and applications – a single place where people can effectively work together, find important information, and access hundreds of thousands of critical applications and services to do their best work. from global fortune 100 companies to corner markets, businesses and teams of all kinds use slack to bring the right people together with all the right information. slack is headquartered in san francisco, ca and has ten offices around the world. for more information on how slack makes teams better connected, visit slack.com. ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace where we learn from each other is core to slack’s values. we welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. we are an equal opportunity employer and a pleasant and supportive place to work. come do the best work of your life here at slack.

at lyft, community is who we are and it's what we do. it's what makes us different. to create the best ride for all, we start in our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization where all team members are recognized for what they bring.  data is at the heart of how lyft makes business and product decisions. as a data scientist on our safety & insurance team, you will collaborate with our product, design, operations, and engineering teams to make lyft as safe as possible for our drivers, passengers, and the community. you'll build a platform that puts safety front and center for lyft by designing and running a/b tests on new safety features, working with our product team to analyze and understand risk factors, and leading initiatives aimed at directly impacting lyft's long term profitability.  *****************  responsibilities: *****************   set business metrics that measure the health of our products, as well as passenger and driver experience partner with product managers, engineers, marketers, designers, and operators to translate business insights into decisions and action find opportunities for growth and efficiency for lyft design and analyze product experiments; communicate results and launch decisions develop analytical frameworks to monitor business and product performance  ************************  experience & skills: ************************   degree in a quantitative field like statistics, economics, applied math, operations research or engineering. advanced degrees are preferred 3+ years of industry experience in a data science or analytics role proficiency in sql - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets experience in programming, especially with data science and visualization libraries in python or r strong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with cross-functional partners to build the business  lyft is an equal employment opportunity employer that proudly pursues and hires a diverse workforce. lyft does not make hiring or employment decisions on the basis of race, color, religion or religious belief, ethnic or national origin, nationality, sex, gender, gender-identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable local, state, or federal laws or prohibited by company policy. lyft also strives for a healthy and safe workplace and strictly prohibits harassment of any kind. pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance and other similar state laws and local ordinances, and its internal policy, lyft will also consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

at lyft, community is what we are and it's what we do. it's what makes us different. to create the best ride for all, we start in our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization where all team members are recognized for what they bring.  the decision science products team (dsp) is a cross-functional group of engineers and scientists focused on leveraging science, product, and engineering to drive better business decisions for lyft. rather than focusing on a specific slice of the business, dsp looks horizontally across lyft to drive change in the areas of greatest opportunity, with the end goal of improving how we operate our business day to day.  dsp sits at the intersection of lyft's product, growth, operations, and finance teams, and serves as a strategic partner for our senior leadership team. the team tackles challenges across many technical disciplines – including time series forecasting, causal inference, optimization, and machine learning. here is a short list of problems we're working on:   manage overall business health and performance measurement develop and publish operational forecasts for our key business metrics build roi and risk management tools to guide budget investments understand and optimize between key growth and efficiency levers across lyft advise on strategic investments and long-term business trajectory  we are hiring motivated experts who can push the boundaries of our technical work. the ideal candidate is a critical thinker, is passionate about solving mathematical problems with data, and is excited about working in a fast-paced, innovative and collegial environment.  ---------------- responsibilities ----------------   end-to-end owner for lyft's financial and operational planning. develop structured frameworks, build scalable tools, and organizational processes to run company planning. work closely with fp&a and biz ops to evaluate trade-offs and develop scenarios. make strategic recommendations to executive leadership team using data-driven frameworks. collaborate and drive cross functional alignment across growth, product, and operations to develop a unified investment framework across lyft.  ----------------------- experience & skills -----------------------   5+ years professional experience in data science or analytics. proficiency with sql, and python/r. prior experience in forecasting, econometric modeling, and planning preferred. passion for solving unstructured and non-standard mathematical problems. willingness to collaborate and communicate with others to solve a problem.

lyft connects people to transportation to change the way we live and get around our communities. we are looking for product managers who bring exceptional creative and analytical skills to drive forward a best in class product. product management at lyft leads the integration of engineering, data science, and design to achieve the company's vision for reinventing transportation. we are looking for entrepreneurial and passionate product managers to innovate and execute across a rapidly growing, fast-paced company and industry from our san francisco headquarters.  trust and confidence is fundamental to lyft marketplace, and the fraud team is charged with ensuring that trust and safety to all customers. this involves enabling passengers to take rides with the appropriate fraud and risk checks, reducing fraud loss while not impacting growth, and paying the drivers securely in a seamless and frictionless manner. the team takes pride in being quick to resolve emerging fraud patterns, forecast fraud scenarios and prevent them before they occur, build long-term system and product features and create sustainable machine learning models and rules. the challenge and opportunity is to enable a superior and secure experience through the lyft app for passengers and drivers.  we're looking for a product leader and rock-star to join a fast-paced and transformational start-up to manage various fraud initiatives. the product manager, fraud will have full responsibility for developing features, platforms, models and capabilities to proactively identify sources of and patterns of fraud and minimize the company's total exposure to financial and reputational risk. the product manager will develop and execute a long-term vision that will establish lyft, its systems and capabilities as the industry leader in fraud management and mitigation and services.  this individual possesses a very high level of product development and management expertise and is very experienced in utilizing information generated from fraud patterns, data and prior experience to create insights for cross-functional stakeholders that includes engineers, analysts, research scientists and fraud operations. the product manager will ensure that we deliver a customer-first approach and define and articulate the customer experience and impact for fraud detection and prevention activities. this individual will be the 'go to' leader for multiple cross-functional teams to deliver the latest fraud and risk solutions across multiple businesses. the individual is an experienced manager who will take an experimental approach to designing and testing new product features.  *****************  responsibilities: *****************   be the product owner driving our strategic product and technology vision for fraud. develop and execute a customer-focused product roadmap via close collaboration with senior leadership, fraud operations, data science, analytics, design and engineering. translate customer and internal-user needs into clear, well-defined functional and technical requirements backed by data analysis and deep understanding of the fraud landscape guide and interface closely with data analysis and engineering teams to define scope, review and refine technical capabilities, prioritize projects for release, and define new opportunities oversee the design, development and management of real-time systems and models to combat systematic fraud, etc. build long-term instrumentation, monitoring and evaluation capabilities for product performance, tracking, and to create product insights. communicate and report overall status, primary metrics, key fraud issues and solution plans and readiness timelines to senior management and executives. establish business cases and projected roi on investment to identify and prioritize opportunities partner with business operations, finance, business leaders and regional gms to manage the impact to profitability of the overall lyft business and individual regions.  ******************************  experience & skills: ******************************   5+ years of product management experience in the tech industry 8-10 years of experience across fraud and risk across payment, ecommerce, retail, digital media or financial services industries proven experience in defining strategic vision and tactical execution to reduce fraud and build sustainable fraud products and systems. experience in iterative, agile software delivery, short release cycles and iterative delivery of a commercially available product focus and rigor on data and analytics to solve problems and a track record of driving results through continuous improvement experience in effectively working with multiple teams for collaboration and company-wide project delivery tenacity to keep issues top of mind of relevant stakeholders and conviction to stand-by decisions excellent written and verbal communication skills, especially to communicate effectively with senior executives strong time management skills and ability to prioritize and drive independently  *************  nice to have: *************   bachelor or master's degree in computer science or data-related domain experience dealing with senior executives in customer organizations experience in ui/ux testing and validation  lyft is an equal employment looking for a product manager to join our pricing and promotions team to drive product vision, strategy development and transformation of our promotions platform out of our san francisco headquarters. we’re looking for someone with a passion for great customer experiences and love of technology to build successful products for rewarding omni-channel retail experiences. promotions are a core function of our business and key aspect of the retail landscape. how easily a customer can redeem promotions and feel the value of the brand, is critical to determining their return. as a result, we strive to make her experience as frictionless as possible.  we’re seeking a strong problem solver with a track record of product innovation. a product manager must lead complex projects independently, manage diverse sets of stakeholders and cross-functional teams, develop a strong understanding of our customers, manage multiple concurrent projects, and identify and lead solutions that achieve significant business value.  what you get to do in this job: develop product vision, strategy and roadmap in support of business goals, customer needs, and clear okrs prioritize a clear, objective job description  description: publicis cosmos is a new class of cognitive customer intelligence for big data powered by a.i. and ml algorithms. publicis cosmos provides our global customers with a collection of best-in-class cloud solutions for marketing, analytics, advertising, and data intelligence. all integrated on a cloud platform purposely built to help brands better engage with their customers across channel and devices. the cosmos team is looking for an experienced lead data scientist to work directly with cosmos client teams to deliver end-to-end data science consulting engagements using our state of the art cosmos solutions including cosmos identity and entity resolution, cosmos data hub and cosmos a.i,. the lead data scientist should also own the development and stewardship of industry-leading solutions and capabilities. you should be passionate about finding insights in large datasets, synthesizing and communicating results of analysis, driving practical business impact, and provide engaging narratives with data. you will be responsible, along with other account leads, to ensure successful delivery for clients. you welcome the challenge of big data and are proficient in azure ml, python, c#, graph databases, deterministic and probabilistic modeling, anomaly detection, social network analysis (sna) and statistical modeling. you must be self-driven, take initiative and want to work in a dynamic, fast moving, and innovative group. you will work directly with clients to own data science solutions as a member of the cosmos cognitive marketing intelligence cloud platform team, and will operate as part of the cosmos platform team to extend the platform functionality when not directly supporting client projects.  qualifications  core responsibilities: develop a strong understanding of the clients' business, current digital marketing initiatives, and customer experience goals. actively work toward insights and recommendations that will help the team deliver solutions to meet these goals perform hands-on analysis of large volumes of web analytics, transaction, customer data, second and third party data. work with complex data structure, manipulate, cleanse data and perform statistical analysis educate clients and fellow team members about implications of customer insights serve as a publicis cosmos evangelist delivering effective thought leadership work with project teams to translate client requests into analytic work plans participate in and support delivery of presentations to clients in senior positions (director level to cxo level) identify new opportunities for data science projects and solutions be superb at time management and management of supporting analyst teams perform advanced statistical analysis and multivariate statistical analysis (regression and simple segmentation) interpret data and analyze results to generate insights, and communicate these insights to clients in an engaging and clear manner extract data and actionable insights from a variety of client sources and systems, find probabilistic and deterministic matches across second and third-party data sources, and complete exploratory data analysis create engaging and meaningful data visualizations of findings linked to clear client business impact expertise in predictive analytics/statistical modeling/data mining/machine learning algorithms and techniques (clustering, regression, multivariate testing, classification) proven capability to deliver end-to-end analyses by asking the right questions, extracting data, and building predictive models to ensure actionable results strong passion for understanding key business problems, bringing together a team to understand data/ instrumentation needs and/or mine through data to unearth deep insights into customer experiences excellent communication & interpersonal skills with an ability to communicate ideas, insights and complicated analysis effectively at all organizational levels, include engineering leadership design and implementation of refinery data product using spark, map-reduce, hive, hdfs, spring, hibernate and java experience with nosql database neo4j, mongodb, cassandra, hbase and orient db design and implementation of data product on hadoop using titan, tinker-pop, hbase, gremlin and java proven track record of problem solving and using experiment driven approaches experience with large scale distributed databases and computing systems like cosmos, hadoop, or hdinsight expertise with statistical software packages like r, matlab, numpy, scipy, or sas experience with cpe initiatives for large scale services is desire minimum qualifications: ms in computer science, math, physics, or equivalent education/professional experience is required. 5+ years in a data science role with demonstrable experience deep experience in machine learning with spark and azure machine learning and cognitive services deep knowledge of azure cloud including azure data factory (adf), cosmosdb, hands on experience in databricks strong experience in at least one database technology (i.e. graph database like oriondb, sql server, redshift, etc.) experience with one or more web analytics tools (google analytics, adobe analytics etc.) strong experience in at least one programming language (i.e. c#, python, r). experience implementing and automating models experience with data modeling and normalization concepts. experience architecting and building data marts, warehouses, etc. experience working with different query languages (i.e. pl-sql, t-sql) understanding and experience working with cloud infrastructure services like azure and amazon web services. azure preferred. experience working with code repositories and continuous integration (i.e. git, jenkins, etc.) graph database experience a plus understanding of development and project methodologies ability to work collaboratively in teams with other specialized individuals, and with team members located remotely and locally able to work in a fast-paced, technical environment. good verbal and written communication skills additional information  all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

playstation isn't just the best place to play it's also the best place to work. we've thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original playstation. today, we're recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. the playstation brand falls under sony interactive entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of sony corporation   product manager, core (mobile)  san francisco, ca (soma)   the team:   playstation's games product management team is charged with delivering great gaming experiences to players around the world. located in san francisco, the team is passionate about gaming and great products, as well as being friendly, supportive, and inclusive.   as part of our initiative to expand and improve playstation's off-console experiences, we are looking for people who can help us build great mobile products!   we're always striving to create a learning and supportive environment, where every team member is empowered to do their best work.   the role:   this product manager will be responsible for defining requirements and deliverables for our mobile products, to help realize our ambition to put players' gaming life within reach, wherever they are.   desired experience:   great product managers don't only come from within the product management discipline. if you have proven experience building great mobile or gaming products, whether from a product, design or engineering background, and love thinking of ways to make gaming better, we want to hear from you!   we are looking for someone with 5 or more years' experience in one or more of these areas.   responsibilities: develop requirements for new mobile features, products and services for playstation, working with stakeholders across the global business work with design teams to create solutions that are compelling, easy to use and realistic to implement work with engineering teams to ensure we build the right thing and ship it at the right time articulate business and consumer rationale to the teams building the product prioritize features based on product strategy and global business objectives maintain and communicate the roadmap for your features and product understand and communicate how your product is used in market, based on customer feedback, research and data, feeding back into future requirements and product roadmap understand and communicate the competitive landscape as it affects playstation and its mobile strategy in particular sony is an equal opportunity employer. all persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, legally protected physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, status in the u.s. uniformed services, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, genetic information or membership in any other legally protected category.   we strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. we encourage everyone to respond.   we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you spent in contacting us and we thank you for your interest in playstation.   #li-lf1

playstation isn't just the best place to play —it's also the best place to work. we've thrilled gamers since 1994, when we launched the original playstation. today, we're recognized as a global leader in interactive and digital entertainment. the playstation brand falls under sony interactive entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of sony corporation.  title: data analyst, digital marketing  description  whether you are working on innovative new hardware like playstation vr, aaa software like god of war, or disruptive network service products like playstation vue, you will take part in the complete marketing experience, as you are involved in every facet of ideation, execution, analyzing, and optimizing our digital campaigns. from determining target audiences, designing test strategies, and communicating with internal or external partners, you will help shape the way that we communicate with gamers to grow our loyal playstation customer base.  be part of building the paid media and crm analytics team at sony interactive entertainment (sie) - a new team built behind dedicated leadership and deep investment in people and technologies. this role sits within the marketing organization that oversees marketing for sie's entire portfolio of products and services.  you will be generating actionable insights from complex customer data to drive growth in product engagement and customer lifetime value across all stages of the customer lifecycle. you will lead the way in helping the team develop a deep understanding of its current and potential customers. your primary goal will be to ensure that we design and execute data-driven lifecycle marketing strategies that drive measurable growth in usage, cross-sell and customer retention/loyalty for all target segments. to achieve this goal, you will be responsible for identifying and communicating key customer insights and trends across multiple products within our portfolio.  you will be making an impact on marketing decision-making but also shape the customer experience. you will be a key stakeholder providing strategic guidance to the management and maintenance of our marketing tech stack, and bring data-driven thought leadership to our marketing efforts by conducting analysis and developing testing strategies that provide insight into the key drivers of digital marketing performance.  marketing at sie starts and ends with the gamer. our job is to demonstrate how playstation truly is the best place to play.  responsibilities   define and implement customer segmentation and profiling strategies translate business challenges into testable hypotheses, own/manage execution, tracking and results in ways that change the way we do business manage, mine and analyze a broad array of quantitative and qualitative data assets lead the application of insights to influence marketing strategies that drive measurable growth in customer acquisition and ongoing retention/satisfaction. compile analyses for reports and conduct presentations to a broad audience, including marketing leadership, to shape strategic and operational decisions ensure the enforcement of legal and privacy standards for managing data work across numerous internal and external marketing automation platforms (sales force marketing cloud, dmps, publisher and social partners, etc)  required qualifications:  sql programming experience experience with web analytics tools such as google analytics or adobe analytics experience with data visualization software: tableau minimum 3-5 years experience working with relational databases minimum 5-7 years marketing analytics experience well versed in spreadsheet modeling and presentation-making skills that effectively present data in a compelling way, both verbal and written, to influence marketing decisions a passion for and the belief in the power of making data-driven decisions a demonstrated interest in digital entertainment and gaming ba/bs degree  preferred qualifications:  experience in the video game industry professional experience working at, or with, a media or digital agency experience using algorithmic attribution models for media optimization advanced degree in a related field (mba, statistics, economics, etc)  sony is an equal opportunity employer. all persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to race,
