diversity. we encourage everyone to respond.  we sincerely appreciate the time and effort you spent in contacting us and we thank you for your interest in playstation

ipsy is looking for a business analyst to provide analytics support to drive decision-making related to personalization and member experience. the analyst’s key role will be to help run ipsy’s monthly subscription personalization algorithm, match members to their monthly products, and contribute directly to the member’s glam bag experience. this role is highly collaborative and you will work closely with inbound, merchandising, and engineering teams. the position requires strong modeling skills, attention to detail, positive professional attitude, and ability to work in a team environment.  key responsibilities: develop monthly personalization models and determine product allocations based on members’ preferences and data integration. iterate testing of production and beta optimization models; execute a/b tests. provide data-driven insights on personalization results. develop and implement processes to support scalability. support ad hoc analyses to drive strategic decisions within operations. present complex data and analyses to non-technical audiences.  qualifications: bs required in engineering, statistics, mathematics, operations research, or applied quantitative field. 1-2 years of work experience in an analytical, engineering, or consulting role. strong proficiency with microsoft excel and access. experience with large datasets is required. sql experience is preferred. strong analytical and detail-oriented aptitude; a high degree of accuracy is required. ability to manage time effectively, set priorities, and meet deadlines. ability to work on a team and collaborate with other stakeholders. excellent problem solving, critical thinking, project management, and communication skills. knowledge of statistics. flexible demeanor and ability to work in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment.  nice-to-have: experience with personalization. understanding of linear programming and constrained optimization. interest in and knowledge of beauty, style, and makeup.  about us:  ipsy was founded with one singular mission: to inspire individuals around the world to express their unique beauty. that’s how the ipsy glam bag came to life. with five products personalized for you—plus articles, videos, and more on ipsy.com—you’re free to try new things and express who you are. ipsy shopper takes our mission to the next level by making beauty more accessible, rewarding, and liberating than ever before. and with ipsy gen beauty, open studios, and all the creator content that we post each day, our intention has remained the same: to give every individual the tools to form their own definition of beauty. with over 2.5m members and 8k digital content creators in our community, and generating over half a billion monthly content views, we’re just getting started. ipsy is headquartered in the bay area with an office in new york city and a studio production and editing facility in los angeles. the company achieved profitability in its first year and raised a series b round of $100m with sherpa capital and tpg in 2015. we owe all of our success to our inspiring, energizing employees who make exceptional things happen every single day—fearless thinking, tenacity, and a pioneering spirit push us forward. from marketing and media to engineering and operations, we are united in our goal to democratize beauty, making it accessible and affordable for everyone and fearlessly representing individuality and inclusivity. we dream. we empower. we create. and we have great fun doing it together. take a look at careers.ipsy.com for some exciting opportunities to join our team. and check us out at ipsy.com, @ipsyofficial on snapchat, and @ipsy on facebook, instagram, youtube, and twitter.

job id: r0028118 position: senior marketing analytics manager organization: stubhub, www.stubhub.com (an ebay company nasdaq: ebay) stubhub’s purpose is to connect people to inspiring event experiences. we connect fans with their favorite teams, shows and artists and introduce them to the ones they'll love next. as the largest ticket marketplace in the world, we enable fans to buy and sell tickets to tens of thousands of events, whenever they want, through our desktop and mobile experiences, including our stubhub app for iphone, ipad, apple watch and android. offering a superior ncaa, plus aeg, axs and spectra ticketing & fan engagement. with the acquisition of ticketbis in august 2016, throughout the world, stubhub provides the total end-to-end event going experience. stubhub is an ebay company (nasdaq: ebay).  for more information on stubhub, visit stubhub.com or follow @stubhub on twitter , facebook and instagram or youtube.com/stubhub. our values stubhub one - we act as one team in pursuit of connecting people through inspiring event experiences. at stubhub, we are: driven - we strive for excellence - constantly improving our game courageous - we are bold & not afraid to challenge the status quo inventive - we see what others don’t & pioneer new paths richly diverse - we recognize & respect everyone as a unique individual brand - we experience the world through stubhub the opportunity we are seeking a marketing analytics manager to lead a team of whip-smart, resourceful analysts who are unlocking opportunities that drive results at scale across search, display and app marketing channels. you will be responsible for describing roi through evolving our a/b test practices and performance reporting.  your business partners will belong to a high acumen and communication skills with excellent quant skills, and particular experience applying experimental design and statistical inference to measure incremental campaign performance. he/she will have a passion for data democratization and will drive towards continuous improvement in the area of performance reporting.  this role will be pivotal to shaping and achieving our global growth strategy. you will working side-by-side with the channel managers, advise on optimization strategy, accurately sizing opportunities, and seeking improved methods for assessing the value of marketing innovations. evolve and accelerate measurement practices, including novel test designs that ensure incremental learnings and modern sampling procedures to streamline results generation. lead by example to build a culture of accountability and rigor to substantiate proven business impact.  support the buildout of performance reporting dashboards that scales with our growing global business. work through tagging and data integrity issues with cross functional stakeholders in engineering and channel teams. bring clarity to kpis, performance drivers, and competitive trends. advise in areas of forecasting, budgeting, and goal setting.  you have must have extensive experience in marketing analytics tools; doubleclick, adwords, bing ads, omniture, google analytics, dcm, app marketing fluency in web analytics and pixel implementations. sql and hive fluency demonstrably strong communication skills: truly knows what it means to assemble a story from data and can easily explain how and demonstrate it. strong listening skills as well as the skills to persuade particularly based on evidence thorough experience designing and analyzing experiments across a variety of marketing channels, and statistical protocols strong communication skills, with an emphasis on teamwork, initiative and integrity experience with app ecommerce and tracking desirable you bring 8+ years in performance marketing analytics roles. at least 4 of those years in each of sem, display, paid social and analytics.  experience with app marketing tracking and performance analytics bs/ba degree in a quantitative discipline, e.g., math, statistics, physics, operations research, economics, cs, etc., from a top tier school. strong preference for candidates with advanced degrees in the same job category sales job details the customer success and growth (csg) organization at salesforce is responsible for on-boarding, product usage, retention, engagement, training, customer support, professional services, and developing long-term relationships with salesforce customers. the analytics & insights group in csg creates data driven intelligence on customers’ usage, adoption & attrition, which in turn is used to help customers find increased value of their product mixes. this role is hybrid of traditional jobs in strategic planning, business operations, reporting, and analysis – requiring a mix of deep analysis, process optimization and business operational support. we are looking for business analysts to be part of a high-performance team comprised largely of former management consultants; as a member of this group you will have immense opportunities to work on a broad cross section of technologies, analyzing data sets, creating reports and supporting business operations. you will play an important role in enabling data to empower business groups, formulate key strategies, segment customers, improve business processes like renewals, success services, accelerators, cloud services etc through a data driven approach. the results of your work will help salesforce customers be even more successful on the world’s greatest customer success platform. moreover, the position requires interaction with various areas of the organization and provides exposure to senior executives, requiring the ability to synthesize complex ideas and convey big-picture impacts. key accountabilities proficient in querying, joining, and analyzing large, complex data sets using sql identify, maintain, and analyze the critical kpis that drive csg success, while partnering with leadership to develop strategies to attain targets for these kpis strong communicator who can present their data analysis/ findings in a clear and concise manner to executive audiences very comfortable extracting data from a wide range of sources (excel, database etc) and develop insightful visualizations, dashboards and reports troubleshoot data issues that impact business reporting and work with cross-functional teams to get them resolved quickly and/or propose changes to systems/ processes to fix root causes perform data uploads and ad hoc reporting to address immediate business needs apply a structured business process architecture approach and methodology for capturing the key views of the enterprise attention to detail, including documenting all analysis, results and data processes, which can be reused by the team design the future state business process architecture to drive the maximum user experience, productivity and value – to include process flow diagrams, heat maps, data flow diagrams recognize areas for automation and develop requirements to facilitate such automation be a strong team player who thrives in a diverse global team that traverses across program teams, success community, support, it, finance, and governance be passionate about quality and have a strong sense of ownership on the work accomplished have a high sense of urgency to respond to critical business questions basic requirements analyst 2-3 years of experience/ sr. analyst 3-5 years of management consulting, business operations, or business analyst experience, with a focus on data & insights, services tools, process automation and/or continuous process improvement have a bs in information systems, economics, or other quantitative field at least 2 years experience in writing complex database queries in sql at least 2 years of experience performing business analysis, to include process, data capture, reporting and analysis of hypothesis proficient in ms excel (pivot tables, vlookups, etc) with the ability to manipulate, extract, analyze and report data capable of developing robust “data narratives” to convey complex data-driven concepts in palettable format for multiple audiences strong analytical skills along with ability to work independently with limited supervision familiarity with crm and data management experience with any analytics/ reporting tools like einstein analytics, tableau, etc is preferable exposure and understanding of web technologies, relational databases, data warehousing and etl tools experience working with global team in multiple locations is highly desirable strong situational analysis, negotiation and decision-making abilities. salesforce experience/ certification is a huge plus but not minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  4 years of experience building and automating reporting dashboards, spreadsheet, and presentation tools.  experience in sql and relational databases.  preferred qualifications: track record of successful project management, execution, multi-tasking, delegating, and collaborating with cross-functional teams to set goals and lead through vision, clarity, and passion.  ability to synthesize data into useful formats to drive actionable insights for product and sales teams.  ability to get things done and work independently.  ability to understand and contribute to a long-term strategic vision.  excellent analytical, strategic thinking, and creative problem-solving skills. about the job the business strategy & operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. we stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  the google customer solutions (gcs) product and sales activation team helps drives the overall success of our gcs advertisers by creating effective solutions to meet advertiser business needs, supporting them with strategic initiatives, and advocating for products that better address the needs of small and medium businesses (smbs).  as a product insights analyst on the product and sales activations (psa) strategy and operations team, you’ll develop data-driven insights across all major advertising products and features globally. additionally, you will work directly with sales, product, and marketing teams to monitor the impact of new launches and programs and identify emerging trends in advertiser behavior and product usage. you’ll test new approaches focusing on how to apply features to help advertisers grow at scale. in the process, you will gain valuable global experience, working with multiple organizations, sharing discoveries, and uncovering new insights to help businesses grow. when our millions of advertisers and publishers are happy, so are we! our google customer solutions (gcs) team of entrepreneurial, enthusiastic and client-focused members are the "human face" of google, helping entrepreneurs both individually and broadly build their online presence and grow their businesses. we are dedicated to growing the unique needs of advertising companies. our teams of strategists, analysts, advisers and support specialists collaborate closely to spot and analyze customer needs and trends. in collaboration, we create and implement business plans broadly for all types of businesses. responsibilities  oversee advertising products and feature-oriented data across the gcs ecosystem.  construct analyses around a specific business question, write a clear, usable project plan, and execute with minimal guidance.  run ad hoc analyses to answer pressing questions.  build and support high-level dashboards and communicate findings and strategic recommendations to management. maintain large datasets.  work with product and engineering teams to build, maintain, and refine reporting architecture for specific products. at google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. we also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. see also google's eeo policy and eeo is the law. if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Job_Description: as the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, fanatics is changing the way fans purchase their favorite team merchandise by partnering with top leagues, clubs and soccer brands worldwide to offer the largest collection of timeless and timely gear from every pro and college team online, on your phone, in stadiums or on-site at the world’s biggest sporting events. a top 50 internet retailer company, fanatics comprises the broadest online assortment by offering hundreds of thousands of officially licensed items via its fanatics ( www.fanatics.com ), fansedge ( www.fansedge.com ) and kitbag ( www.kitbag.com ) brands, as well as the largest selection of sports collectibles and memorabilia through fanatics authentic ( www.fanaticsauthentic.com ). a multi-channel company, fanatics operates more than 300 online and offline stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (nfl, mlb, nba, nhl, nascar, mls, pga), major media brands (nbc sports, cbs sports, fox sports) and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs ( manchester united, real madrid, chelsea, manchester city). the company's in-venue and event retail portfolio includes the nba, nhl, nascar, wimbledon, kentucky derby, the ryder cup, manchester city, texas longhorns, pittsburgh pirates and new jersey devils, allowing fans to experience a seamless shopping experience across online, mobile and physical store locations.  sr. analyst, business analytics  summary  we are looking for someone with a scrappy, get-it-done attitude who is passionate about analyzing customer data to improve our business. this role will be responsible for business analytics to support our crm marketing channels. this role will require interaction with senior leadership and candidates need a proven track record of distilling down complex data into actionable insights.  responsibilities  dive into complex data sets to analyze trends, identify opportunities and quantify the potential value of new initiatives provide ad-hoc analyses that explain drivers of business performance design and analyze experiments that provide robust customer and performance insights develop reporting requirements and work with technology and data engineering teams to implement consult with business stakeholders on ad-hoc analyses, experiments and reporting qualifications  detail-oriented, with strong analytical, technical and problem-solving skills hands on experience working with large and complex data sets. proficiency w/ sql required. experience with other tools such as tableau, r, etc. helpful. understanding of basic statistics strong communication skills. must be able to effectively communicate complex analyses to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including senior leadership 5+ years of professional work experience required; e-commerce or retail industry experience preferred   more about fanatics  as the global leader in licensed sports merchandise, fanatics is changing the way fans purchase their favorite team apparel and jerseys across retail channels through an innovative, tech-infused approach to making and selling fan gear in today’s on-demand culture. powering multi-channel commerce for the world’s biggest sports brands, fanatics offers the largest collection of timeless and timely merchandise whether shopping online, on your phone, in stores, in stadiums or on-site at the world’s biggest sporting events.  fanatics is a technology-driven, consumer company that powers the fanatics, fansedge, kitbag and majestic brands, as well as the largest selection of sports collectibles and memorabilia through fanatics authentic. fanatics also operates more than 300 online and offline partner stores, including the e-commerce business for all major professional sports leagues (nfl, mlb, nba, nhl, nascar, mls, pga), major media brands (nbc sports, cbs sports, fox sports) and more than 200 collegiate and professional team properties, which include several of the biggest global soccer clubs (manchester united, real madrid, manchester city).  in addition to e-commerce, the company’s capabilities include multichannel-integrated event and team retail across all leagues and major events such as the kentucky derby, ryder cup and nhl’s winter classic; an industry-leading tech, data and mobile platform; international capabilities that provide a global sports retail platform that is growing the licensed sports merchandise business both in soccer and across all sports worldwide; and an in-house merchandise division, fanatics branded, that is a licensed partner of all the major sports leagues and helps fans express passion through a broad range of styles, designs and jerseys created under both the fanatics and majestic brands.  fanatics’ vertical manufacturing engine is built for today’s on-demand economy and brings much-needed agility to the industry, better servicing today’s passionate sports fans and their growing real-time expectations with more unique and innovative products readily available across retail channels.  sports is a fast-paced, ever-changing landscape and fanatics, the on-demand and mobile leader in team merchandise, is uniquely positioned to serve the insatiable real-time appetite of fans worldwide, fueled by explosive growth in technology and social media.

at uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. we take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  we welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. if you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. about the role at uber, providing world-class customer support to riders and driver partners is a core feature of our product experience. delivering this caliber of support isn’t easy - it takes leaders who can understand uber’s operations, adapt to our constantly changing business, and help solve problems where no solution currently exists.  we’re looking for a senior business analyst to join the global risk support program who will help standardize and unite our risk support programs around the world. you will be reporting into the analytics & insights manager of the global risk support team and be responsible for managing the alignment of our reporting and metrics around our regional programs, evaluating our cross-regional initiatives, helping to define and standardize process improvements, and much more. this will produce better outcomes for our customers and more consistent data for the risk team to use in building innovative products. this will be an analytical role helping to analyze data in order to develop insights for the team. there will be a heavy focus on stakeholder engagement, creating a reporting infrastructure in order to analyze various programs, and improving processes through data analytics, organization, and teamwork. what you’ll do own data analysis and visualization, and communicate the outcomes/insights to various stakeholders to aid strategic decisions for improvements in support experience develop strategy and analytical frameworks to support decision making globally create, maintain, and communicate detailed reporting & models coordinate with other members of the community operations team to measure the impact and efficiency of global risk programs partner closely with product and engineering teams to establish program specific data infrastructure provide insights that drive decisions around process, policy and service model become a trusted subject matter expert for global risk processes and policies  what you’ll need bachelor’s degree in math, physics, cs, statistics, economics, finance or another quantitative field at least 3 years of data science / business intelligence / investment banking / consulting or related experience expertise with sql experience presenting data visually exceptional excel / data management skills a preference for quality over quantity; you get the math right and aspire to find the right solution excellent communication skills and attention to detail  bonus points if proficiency in python proficiency in r data engineering background  about the team community operations is pioneering how uber manages rider and driver partner support around the globe. global safety support is a new customer service program chartered with driving collaboration, providing the business with a consolidated voice, and defining and delivering on a best-in-class safety support program. this role will help align and standardize our regional safety support programs around the world.
Published_Title: Senior Business Analyst, Global Safety Support

Job_Description: we’re looking for intelligent, driven professionals to join our new client insights team. this client-facing team is responsible for setting growth plans for our live accounts, driving client analytics, and delivering client recommendations to current and prospect merchants. the ideal candidate will have strong analytical and problem solving skills, as well as interpersonal skills to work across the organization and with clients to drive forward recommendations. what you'll do build cross-functional relationships and partner with our client success, sales, and credit team to grow our existing portfolio of accounts and build best practices optimize pricing strategy based on specific client needs develop client relationships and drive conversations/recommendations to ensure best outcome for both the merchant and affirm provide recommendations for quarterly account planning and initiatives to drive largest growth and profitability impact across the portfolio build weekly metrics and reporting to track portfolio progress and help ensure quarterly goals will be met develop repeatable roi models and analytics for merchants - determine right type of analysis and messaging based on audience and merchant segment track and analyze and report performance of financing and marketing programs and a/b tests build out consumer and marketing analytics/insights that are value add to our merchant partners and differentiate affirm from competitors maintain a strong understanding of our evolving data warehouse become an expert in the retail pos financing and e-commerce space what we look for passion and drive to disrupt both the retail and lending industry for the better 2+ year of experience in a client-facing analytically-driven role (consulting, finance, analytics, etc.) strong working knowledge of analytical tools, such as sql, python, r, and excel strong interpersonal skills and ability to work in a team environment and cross-functionally ability to communicate findings and recommendations clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences a passion for finding insights in data and driving change based on those insights ability to think creatively and critically and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic, and often ambiguous work environment enough laziness to find a faster way to do your least favorite tasks humility and team player - you go out of your way to help teammates about affirm  affirm is reinventing credit to make it more honest and friendly. started by paypal co-founder max levchin, affirm gives consumers the flexibility to buy now and make simple monthly payments. unlike other credit options, affirm offers transparent payment terms (no fees or compounding interest), and employs advanced technology to reach a broader consumer population.  #li-ja1

who we are fueled by a fundamental belief that having access to financial services creates opportunity, paypal (nasdaq: pypl) is committed to democratizing financial services and empowering people and businesses to join and thrive in the global economy. our open digital payments platform gives paypal’s 267 million active account holders the confidence to connect and transact in new and powerful ways, whether they are online, on a mobile device, in an app, or in person. through a combination of technological innovation and strategic partnerships, paypal creates better ways to manage and move money, and offers choice and flexibility when sending payments, paying or getting paid. available in more than 200 markets around the world, the paypal platform, including braintree, venmo and xoom, enables consumers and merchants to receive money in more than 100 currencies, withdraw funds in 56 currencies and hold balances in their paypal accounts in 25 currencies. when applying for a job you are required to create an account, if you have already created account - click sign in. creating an account will allow you to follow the progress of your applications. note: provide full legal first name/family name do: capitalize first letter of first and last name. example: john smith don't: capitalize entire first and/or last name. example: john smith note: use correct grammar for names with multiple cases. example: mcdonald or o'connell  provide full address details resume is required multiple attachments can be uploaded including resume and cover letter for each application  job description summary: shape and define the roadmap for venmo  perform in-depth and on-going analysis of our app, identify opportunities, and define requirements for the team to build.  oversee implementation, maintenance, and enhancement of our product with a focus on the customer experience  define new product processes that improve how we work as a team and with our partners in design, research, data, and engineering job description: be a leader by managing the large volume of work we have and aligning resources against the product roadmap. own writing requirements, acceptance criteria, and drawing uml diagrams for all the products you ship. define success metrics for features that you ship and work with the data team to measure their success understand the impact of each new feature and be able to articulate the value relative to customer experience vs business cost be flexible and experienced enough to build products for front-end features such as user registration while also scaling backend services such as push notifications prioritize and plan the backlog to align the work for future sprints lead and motivate a cross-functional group of people that includes design, research, data, and engineering subsidiary: venmo travel percent: 0 primary location: san francisco - braintree/venmo, california, united states of america additional locations: we're a purpose-driven company whose beliefs are the foundation for how we conduct business every day. we hold ourselves to our one team behaviors which demand that we hold the highest ethical standards, to empower an open and diverse workplace, and strive to treat everyone who is touched by our business with dignity and respect. our employees challenge the status quo, ask questions, and find solutions. we want to break down barriers to financial empowerment. join us as we change the way the world defines financial freedom. paypal provides equal employment opportunity (eeo) to all persons regardless of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, genetic information, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. in addition, paypal will provide reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities.

about us: want to join a company on the cutting edge of technology and travel? want to be part of a fantastic and fun company that’s revolutionizing the online travel advertising space?  specializing in traveler path-to-purchase data for over a decade, sojern is travel's direct demand engine for thousands of brands -- from global enterprises to boutique operators -- across the hotel, airline, cruise, transportation, tourism industries, and more. analyzing the world's travel intent signals with its proprietary data science methods, the company delivered $10b in generated bookings for its clients to date by activating multi-channel branding and performance solutions on the sojern traveler platform.  recognized on the top company cultures list by entrepreneur magazine, sojern is headquartered in san francisco, with teams based in dubai, dublin, hong kong, london, mexico city, new york, omaha, paris, singapore, and sydney.  who are you?  you have some experience as a product manager with recent experience developing products for the smb/b2b world. you have built and shipped ui/ux-centric features products in the past, owning the entire end-to-end process from ideation to rollout and post-rollout management. you know what it means to own a product and desire to be in a position of personal responsibility for your product’s growth and ongoing success.  in short - you are the ceo of the products you own.  you have raving fans who love your approach to product management, both on the technical and commercial teams. internal customers trust your judgment and applaud your communication skills. engineering leaders approve of your specifications -- they are neither bare-bones haikus, nor are they overly-prescriptive...they are just right.  you have a strong customer service orientation, and think about the needs/wants of both internal and external customers in your daily decision-making and product leadership approach. you are a natural problem solver, have a “no excuses” mentality and generally maintain a positive outlook when difficulties arise. you have excellent time management skills, and possess the ability to focus intently on a given product or feature and work relentlessly to design the “right” product.  what will you be doing?   this role exists to make every stage of a smb customer’s lifecycle with sojern—from the time of onboarding to account setup to the growth of their account—as easy as possible as a product manager focused on the customer’s journey, you will define and ship successful, meaningful features that help sojern’s smb customers onboard faster, stay in the loop better and love their experience with sojern a critical mission of this role will be to sync and align sojern customers’ account information across systems to enable sojern to track, understand and solve for customer needs and grow products. you will work directly with engineering to prioritize backlogs, manage sprints, and deliver product features in an agile environment. you will interface directly with commercial teams: gms, sales leaders, account managers, partner managers and advertising customers directly, collaborating on potential solutions and gathering feedback for new products and product features. you will lead at least one cross-functional team, comprised of leaders from multiple disciplines within the company, focused on the ongoing success of your product(s) you will have 3+ years of relevant experience, with at least 1 year as a product manager  you will be:  data-driven and results-oriented able to ruthlessly prioritize your backlogs in the midst of rapid evolutionary change knowledgeable about agile development methodologies exceptionally good at authentically understanding the needs of our customers, and representing those needs in the form of concrete product requirements self-motivated; exhibiting strong self-management and a sense of urgency able to manage multiple projects and collaborate effectively with other people and departments in a fast-paced, dynamic environment an exceptionally strong writer and presenter able to get things done amid tight time constraints willing to travel occasionally (international and domestic)  you will have:  demonstrated success in guiding ui/ux-centric features from kick-off to ship. recent experience developing products for the smb/b2b world. experience prioritizing among competing product features. solid sql skills with the ability to write queries to get the relevant data. bonus points for some experience in python. knowledge of statistical analysis, and a/b testing design, execution and measurement. experience leading entrepreneurial efforts, outreach within organizations and/or project management experience. a strong technical acumen (explicit engineering background not required).  you will get bonus points for:  travel sector experience. ad tech experience. previous engineering experience or demonstrable computer science background. previous work in strategy or management consulting.  perks:  culture: our team loves a good time snacks: well-stocked kitchen to fill your breakfast, lunch, and snack needs opportunities: be part of a growing team with training and support to help you grow give back: we give 40 hours a year to volunteer and organize office volunteer programs with local organizations ownership: lead innovative and challenging projects meals: monthly catered lunches & happy hours flexible time vacation days wealth: stock options  at sojern, we value diversity and always treat all employees and job applicants based on merit, qualifications, competence, and talent. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

senior product manager, splunk cloud operations join us as we pursue our disruptive vision to make machine data accessible, usable and valuable to everyone. we are a company filled with people who are passionate about our product and seek to deliver the best experience for our customers and partners. at splunk, we’re committed to our work, customers, having fun and to each other’s success. become a part of our journey! role: splunk cloud has amazing customers taking on complex challenges with machine data. we are looking for a teammate to guide the fast-and-furious pace of our service operational capabilities. are you up for the challenge? responsibilities: what you'll do. you will operationalize key capabilities of our service. to do this effectively you understand business goals, articulate clear requirements and collaborate with service delivery teams on the development, launch and ongoing assessment. you will understand and represent the customer, support, operational and financial perspectives in the delivery of the splunk cloud service capabilities. collaborate with program management on establishing just-enough process and analytics that drive the desired outcome. requirements: what you'll need to succeed. you are organized, positive, and passionate about working in a rapidly changing environment. you have a deep understanding of operational aspects of delivering large scale service experiences. you can point to examples of services you worked on. you have 5-10 years of experience in an operational role, and 2-3 years of product management experience. experience with security and compliance operations and certifications. experience with iaas cloud providers. you can influence product owners you are dependent upon to adjust their roadmaps. you have shown ability to lead without authority. you must be comfortable with shifting priorities and ownership. prior knowledge of splunk a plus. education: bachelor’s degree; mba or similar degree highly preferred we value diversity at our company. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or any other applicable legally protected characteristics in the location in which the candidate is applying. for job positions in san francisco, ca, and other locations where required, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records
Published_Title: Senior Product Manager, Splunk Cloud Operations

Job_Description: why we do what we do: logikculls mission is to democratize discovery. the costs and risks associated with complex data projects like e-discovery, responding to foia requests, and conducting internal investigations are skyrocketing as the amount of data increases. logikcull is transforming these tasks so they can be completed in minutes, by anyone, anywhere. as a result, our customers-modern legal teams from solo attorneys to massive law firms, fortune 500 companies, and leading non-profit organizations - can find and use important information quickly so they can focus on their important work, like pursuing a better democracy or saving the earth.   who we are: logikcull.com is instant discovery for modern legal teams. its secure, cloud-based solution helps law firms and organizations of all sizes solve the expensive, complex, and risky challenges associated with ediscovery, internal investigations, and open records response. with logikcull, you can start a discovery project in five seconds, from anywhere at any time on any device.  what we need: logikcull is a product-led growth company and we are in need of an analytics pm to help us double in size again. this person will spearhead the data initiative at the company to plan, vet and purchase various aspects of the data infrastructure we will need including a data warehouse, visualization tooling and potentially other tools pertaining to etl and bi that are required to drive our product forward. additionally, we are looking for someone who loves data-mining for product insights that help inform our roadmap as well as teach others at the company how to do the same. we need someone who is empathetic to the analytic needs of product owners, engineers, and designers, the right candidate has the ability to translate data requirements into usable, scalable data structures in a way everyone can understand. what you'll be doing: reviewing and analyzing data to advise our product growth assess our current tools and systems, then advise on the aspects of data structure we need moving forward be an advisor to our team on how to think about and analyze data implement our data warehouse, etl and bi tools lay the foundation for any machine learning/intelligence initiatives in the future provide regular updates for technical and non-technical stakeholders about dataset updates and necessary changes practice good data hygiene and implementation standards combine the voice and needs of the users and business requirements to create both high-level roadmaps and detailed delivery plans of features and capabilities based on the data use a metrics driven product development approach. define success measures for roadmap items and demonstrate measurable impact on those success metrics mind melding with key stakeholders throughout the organization including engineering, design, finance and the exec teams on the product vision using data lead and collaborate on all business readiness activities including product testing, end user education, rollout, iteration and support what we need from you: 5+ years of experience working in a data driven role or product manager role you love data and taking chaos and turning it into something actionable previous experience with analytics tools and understanding of the analytics landscape extensive experience running deep analysis of a data set ability to run sql queries for common metrics such as funnel conversion, churn etc. enjoys the fast paced, ever changing landscape of a startup strong communication skills, both written and oral, and an ability to listen and understand root needs across many different business units well-established personal processes to handle multiple requests from varied stakeholders, in a way that maintains clear priority, adjusts when needed, and is always helpful and pleasant successful track record of building data products and capabilities highly analytical and collaborative qualities with strong technical, strategic and problem-solving skills an understanding of the technical architecture of data and machine learning pipelines high sense of ownership and a focus on building fast without sacrificing quality

about lastline: lastline, inc. provides innovative ai-powered network security products that detect and defeat advanced threats attempting to enter and operate within a network. we protect network, email, cloud, and web infrastructures, minimizing the risk of damaging and costly data breaches with fewer resources and at lower cost. headquartered in redwood city, california with offices throughout north america, europe and asia, lastline's technology is used by global 5000 enterprises, is offered directly and through resellers and security service providers, and is integrated into leading third-party security technologies worldwide. www.lastline.com ( http://www.lastline.com )  the job: the lastline product management team is responsible for product planning and execution throughout the product life-cycle, including: defining product vision, gathering and prioritizing product requirements, as well as working closely with sales, r&d, customers, and marketing to ensure successful product releases and high customer satisfaction.  we are looking for a product manager who helps us bring cloud security product offerings to the market that truly address the security problems of organizations as they embrace the cloud. this role will report to our senior director, product management. as our product manager for cloud security, you will have a deep understanding of the (security) challenges that organizations face when moving assets and workloads to the cloud. you have helped organizations architect solutions that address these challenges, or you have helped security vendors build security products for the cloud. you understand the roles of devops teams in leading the charge of digital transformation and the anxieties of security teams that struggle to keep up. you have a deep understanding of the vast cloud provider landscape, and you are fluent in the way cloud marketplaces work and how products and services are offered and consumed on these markets.  you will have a bias to action, to break down complex challenges into steps that drive product development at speed. you will be a leader for our cloud efforts who can inspire and motivate a cross functional team of resources. you will be able to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously, own deliverables end-to-end, prioritize workloads, and thrive in a dynamic environment.  what you will do: your responsibilities will focus on taking and extending lastline's leading security capabilities into the cloud. this includes the entire process from problem discovery for cloud security products all the way through to delivering optimal solutions to those problems:   drive product definition, requirements analysis, documentation of requirements, and product positioning for lastline's cloud security offerings investigate and document cloud provider capabilities, technical details and configurations as they relate to security, networking, identity and access management engage with cloud service providers and make them aware of lastline's security products, for example, through partnership/integration programs and events validate product directions by interacting with customers and internal stakeholders manage feature prioritization and tradeoffs, balancing quick wins and longer-term investments provide critical input to lastline's cloud security strategy based on market trends, competitive analysis, and customer needs produce product collateral and messaging, and partner with sales and marketing to accelerate go-to-market help evangelize the cloud security vision, roadmap plans and product decisions so all stakeholders are aligned and have context  who you are: we are looking for a candidate who has a deep understanding of the cloud computing ecosystem and the security problems that organizations face when they move to the cloud. we are looking for passion to make an industry-wide impact by driving projects from concept through implementation to successfully delivery. and we require razor-sharp instincts about what makes a good security product, either based on previous product management experience or by understanding how great products fit into solutions that address customer pain points:   bachelor's degree in computer science or related field 5+ years of experience as a solution architect for cloud (security) solutions or 5+ years as a product manager for cloud security products / services (it is a plus if you have both) deep understanding of the security challenges that organizations face as they migrate assets and workloads into (public) cloud, and a passion for solving these challenges strong technical experience with public cloud technologies (aws, azure and gcp) and virtualization/container technologies excellent understanding of native cloud development (especially on public clouds such as aws, azure and gcp) and dev / sec op models experience with cloud provider ecosystems and partner programs (aws preferred) working knowledge of product development lifecycle (such as agile development) and product management activities such as use case development, requirements and technical designs with engineering, feature release, etc. effective communication skills to evangelize the product and technology to both internal and external audiences strong analytical mindset and data-driven approach for solving complex business problems robust leadership and consensus building skills  location: redwood city office  some travel may be required (customer visits, events, and product meetings)  we offer competitive salary packages with an excellent health benefits 100% covered  the team: you will work with some of the world's leading experts in cyber security. our team values excellence, continuous innovation, getting stuff done quickly, transparent communication, and a friendly work environment. our organization and team is geographically distributed, with offices located in redwood city, santa barbara, boston and london.

product manager - notifications multi media, llc is looking for a notifications product manager. we are a technology company that operates a sex-positive video and chat platform that allows a very diverse, worldwide group of independent broadcasters to earn, without middlemen, a very comfortable income from home. our community has millions of fans, and our website ranks among the top 100 of all websites.  now is a terrific time for growth-oriented people to join our team. we are strategically expanding our teams, specifically focusing on our san francisco and austin groups as well as our so cal, miami and milwaukee offices. we believe the san francisco area is where our best leaders will emerge. we have, therefore, committed to the development and expansion of our state-of-the-art office in soma. our soma office has good mass transit access and several desirable lunchtime(company-paid)options.  responsibilities: select and manage a team to help accomplish your goals send and improve over 1 billion email and in-browser notifications per month. manage and grow social media accounts. expand on our overriding goal of establishing a sex-positive environment that focuses on empowerment. identify kpis and improve upon them. create new types of notifications and modify existing notices. use a/b testing to know that you're going in the right direction. own parts of django applications related to notification management, such as opting in and out.   requirements: growth and data-focused mindset strong written english and marketing copywriting leadership relevant experience or education related to the job responsibilities

Job_Description: job description  visa inc. global marketing & communications is searching for an analyst to join our global business analytics team. the selected candidate will support numerous aspects of digital analytics, marketing measurement, and insight generation. visa has a unique and strategic advantage as the global payments leader. our goal is to be the most creative and impactful data-led marketer in the world. we are on a journey to develop our data, capabilities and agency ecosystem to bring more effective and efficient business results to visa. as part of this journey we are transforming our systems, capabilities, organization and processes. the business analytics team is responsible for campaign measurement across paid-owned-earned media, data management, and strategic analytics on behalf of global marketing. this remit includes leveraging the best available data and analysis to (i) develop recommendations on critical investments, (ii) inform strategic decisions; (iii) optimize media investment or creative, and (iv) assess the effectiveness of campaigns. job description reporting directly to the director of digital analytics for global marketing, this role will: analyze various data (from such platforms as dcm and facebook) to understand how advertising performed against media benchmarksmonitor local market media performance to mine for global learnings and best practicesevaluate digital data to assess how media partners successfully delivered target audiences and/or amplified messagesevaluate data from earned media to measure trends, message pull-through, and sentimentpartner with internal and external partners to understand their data collection processtranslate analysis into insights that clearly and succinctly address business needs  qualifications  you have 2 - 4 years of experience in an analytical rolefamiliarity with paid, earned, and owned media data is preferredan undergraduate degree in marketing, economics, business, finance, mathematics/statistics, or related field preferredyou are comfortable with quantitative analysis / modelingyou are proficient in powerpoint and excelexcellent communicator, particularly in translating data-driven insights into business implicationsyou have a passion for both the analytical rigor and creativity inherent in the discipline of marketingyou are detail-oriented and possess strong organizational skills additional information  visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of article 49 of the san francisco police code. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

Job_Description: about us: luma health was founded on the idea that patients should easily be able to connect to their healthcare provider in a way that's modern and mobile-first.  for doctors, it means a full schedule, better patient outcomes, and caring for more patients. for clinics, it means a more automated practice, more revenue, and higher mips scores. for patients, it means getting the care they need and experiencing next-level patient care.  needing to see a doctor is hard. being able to see one shouldn't be.  the role: are you a detail-oriented self-starter who's passionate about business strategy and data-driven decision making?  we're looking for a business analyst to help monitor, understand and report business-critical insights from various sources both qualitative and quantitative. you will have a unique opportunity to work closely with an impact every team at luma health, for us, that means marketing, sales, talent, product, and our leadership team.  this is an excellent opportunity for a recent graduate or someone interested in breaking into startups and contributing to the healthcare, tech, and saas space.  with your help, we'll fulfill our goal to ensure that everyone in the business has access to accurate information and encourage data-informed decision making across the organization. as luma continues to grow, and the business continues to expand, this person will be responsible for setting up the system and procedural changes to ensure efficiency across all levels and functions of the business.  while no day at luma is the same, your tasks will be fluid and include things like:   handle data extractions and translations from salesforce, marketo, and product databases in order to build and support sustainable action plans for various department needs researching the market to help identify strategic trends using sql, python or r as needed to work on product and business data empowering teams at luma health to track business success on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis through the building and maintaining of dashboards and other tools consolidating our data integrity across departments scaling business operations and processes  what we are looking for:  ability to thrive in a fast-paced startup environment ability to rapidly run ad hoc reports and organize output effectively in spreadsheets and presentations comfortable writing sql (preferably postgresql) queries to pull reporting data, annotating for clarity, and optimizing for elegance with ease communication skills both written and verbal to share complex findings in a structured and clear manner to a non-technical audience a high eq -- you can apply both business insight and empathy in all situations to make recommendations smarter, not harder. a college degree or equivalent experience.  what would set you apart:  previous startup experience  what we offer: luma health takes care of you and the people you care about. we're headquartered in the financial district of san francisco (~1 block from montgomery bart).   401k and roth 401k benefits stock options comprehensive health, dental, vision, and life insurance unlimited vacation time (woohoo!) as well as flexible working hours weekly lunches and fully-stocked kitchen with snacks and a fresh variety of fruits pre-tax commuter benefits (we're very close to montgomery bart and muni!) comfortable lounge areas for work and play  luma health is proud to be an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer. we believe in order to thrive, businesses need a want to work in a dynamic environment at the intersection of wall street and technology? ss&c advent software, a leading provider of award-winning software and services for the global investment management industry, is seeking a senior business analyst in san francisco.  job responsibilities  be a key contributor to the development of genesis, a complex cloud enterprise application with large a scope and high complexity. the successful candidate needs to be self-motivated, creative, proactive, and have impeccable communication skills to work successfully in a fast-paced agile development environment. assume responsibilities including: develop detailed product requirements and specifications for genesis, our saas enterprise trading application. lead a cross-functional team of engineers in multiple disciplines to drive the development and delivery of features and workflows. collaborate with designers to design cutting edge, user-centric, functional software. collaborate with software engineers in the implementation of proposed architectures and software designs. collaborate with advent quality assurance to develop test plans and ensure test coverage. collaborate with technical writers to develop first class documentation, help, and case studies. collaborate with services and sales to help drive customer success. represent the product team within ss&c advent with respect to product features, demonstrations, issue resolution, and design validation activities. must have a strong understanding of clients’ needs and satisfaction issues. develop product strategies that will improve client satisfaction. develop good relationships with clients by helping them to be successful with the product. develop client references. help the development team get access to client feedback and information. develop a strong understanding of advent’s sales, implementation, and support processes for this product. document issues and promote actions to make us more effective and efficient. resolve escalated support incidents and manage issue tracking for the product. provide project management and status reporting for specific product releases or beta programs. provide general technical guidance and mentoring to other engineers on the team. train advent engineers, other employees, and clients on the product designs and implementations. qualifications requirements 3-5 years of previous experience in enterprise software development is required. 5+ years preferred. strong experience and passion for designing software are required. strong analytical skills and technical proficiency are required. experience with the software product lifecycle is required. experience with financial services, investment management, and reporting software preferred. experience with cloud based applications preferred. experience with agile development practices is preferred. experience working directly with clients is required. excellent written and oral communication skills are required. bachelor's degree is required. willingness and ability to travel (up to 5%) is required.  at ss&c advent, you will find a rewarding career where you can thrive at every level. we invest in our employees through offering competitive compensation and benefits, progressive training opportunities, and wellness programs that empower employees to achieve total (physical, financial, social & community) wellbeing. in addition to challenging and meaningful work, you will find a strong work-life balance and deep commitment to giving back to the communities where we live and work. ss&c advent’s culture thrives on teamwork and diversity. so, bring your unique perspective and talent to ss&c advent and thrive in your work today!  ss&c advent software is an equal opportunity employer, committed to a diverse workforce.  principals only please. no agency candidates will be considered. please apply directly to advent. no phone calls please.

about playstudios playstudios is an award-winning developer of beautiful and engaging games of chance. with content studios in the san francisco bay area, tel aviv, and hong kong, we craft and care for our collection of top-ranked apps. we are growing quickly and partnering with some of the world’s largest entertainment companies. our most recent product release is a joint effort with king - the makers of candy crush, bubble witch, and farm heroes. we’re looking for an experienced data analytics professional to join the myvegas business intelligence team at playstudios. at playstudios we encourage a culture in which we’re always learning about our products, our customers & our industry. the bi analyst will partner closely with the product, ua, marketing & management teams to develop data-driven insights to solve our business challenges. responsibilities execute quantitative analyses that translate data into actionable insights, on topics related to business analytics, product performance, new feature releases, marketing operations, player behavior, & competitor analysis helping design and analyze ab and multivariate experiments collaborate with game teams to design data instrumentation regularly present data insights to the management team the business intelligence analyst will report directly to the hiring manager required comfortable manipulating, transforming, and analyzing complex, high-volume, high-dimensionality data from varying sources solid understanding of statistical analysis and core statistical functions advanced sql competency exceptional analytical ability excellent communication/presentation skills - ability to work closely with departmental managers and with senior staff preferred experience with mobile gaming or casino gaming. familiarity with any statistical package (r, stata, sas, spss, etc.) a strong plus familiarity with at least one scripting language (python, php, ruby, perl, etc.) a strong plus benefits and perks 100% health benefits coverage for you and your dependents! open, creative office space with inviting outdoor patios three fully-stocked kitchens and large communal dining areas catered lunches throughout the week employee-driven entertainment, happy hours, and team-building events throughout the year ping pong table and game room commuter benefits program flexible vacation policy location, location, location! right across from caltrain and vibrant downtown burlingame free employee parking a great place to work! come by to find out for yourself! this is an exciting opportunity to join a world-class team and bring our exciting games to even more fans worldwide. playstudios is an equal opportunity employer. applicants will be considered regardless of their sex (includes pregnancy, childbirth, breastfeeding and related medical conditions), race, age, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, military or veteran status, or other protected category under the law.

at bank of the west, our people are having a positive impact on the world. we’re investing where we feel we can make the most impact, like advancing diversity and women entrepreneurship programs, financing for more small businesses, and promoting programs for sustainable energy. from our locations across the u.s., bank of the west is taking action to help protect the planet, improve people’s lives, and strengthen communities. we are part of bnp paribas, a global leader supporting the un sustainable development goals (sdgs). yes, we’re a bank, but as the bank for a changing world, we are continually seeking to improve the ways we help our customers, while contributing to more sustainable and equitable growth.  job description summary responsible for providing support to the equipment finance division's technology and healthcare solutions business unit in reviewing, analyzing, and evaluating data to support the business needs.  essential job functions  evaluates and develops various methods of analysis and/or project planning that influence strategic initiatives. analyzes and evaluates data gathered from multiple sources. reconciles differences and applies consistent approaches to data interpretation and performance measurement results. engages with business partners and users to ensure that critical strategic decisions are vetted and well thought out prior to implementation. ensures project dependencies are clearly defined and communicated appropriately in terms of time required to complete. liaises with the business, development team, and technology on an ongoing basis. acts as the "subject matter expert" (sme) and provides business knowledge as needed. responsible for critical examinations of current business processes and provides recommendations for improving quality and/or increasing efficiency within business unit operations. may lead efforts in the development of business unit analytics, department or operational procedures, reporting, financial analysis, communication, and/or strategic planning activities. other job duties may assist business unit production functions during high volume periods. performs other duties as assigned.   qualifications  required experience bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, business administration required and/or equivalent work experience requires 5 years minimum experience working in an a business analysis role proficient in microsoft word, excel, and powerpoint detail oriented, analytical and inquisitive strong analytical and problem-solving skills coupled with thoroughness and attention to detail is highly desired excellent written and verbal communication skills for report writing, business requirement proposals, client interaction, and methodology documentation. ability to work independently and within a team environment extremely organized and strong time-management skills equal employment opportunity policy  bank of the west is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers without regard to any status protected by applicable law. bank of the west is also an affirmative action employer - minority / female / disabled / veteran.  bank of the west will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance subject to the requirements of all state and federal laws and regulations.  “while bank of the west considers all applicants, we will not sponsor candidates for work visas at this time.”  #li-am1
