this is an opportunity to work for one of the hottest financial technology start-ups. we are founded by a world-class team with decades of experience in international payments. our mission is to change the legacy financial payment system through innovation. we are backed by some of the top investors in silicon valley, san francisco, and asia.  as an analyst of business analytics, you will work all across the organization to help shape our business and pricing strategies by processing, analyzing and interpreting huge data sets. using analytical precision and statistical methods, you will mine through data to identify opportunities to better optimize our service for customers through pricing analytics, cost optimization, market analytics - forecasting, segmentation, behavioral vs demographics.  pricing is the most critical part of your job. with hundreds of corridors and tiers, you must bring the ability to demonstrate elasticity and clv from pricing proposals based on your ability to interpret site and account information.  in the end, you do more than just crunch the numbers. you work with sales, marketing, and product leadership to help drive insightful actions through your findings. identifying the problem is only half the job; you also figure out the solution.  responsibilities   primarily supporting sales and marketing pricing analytics - formulate, present and implement pricing proposals for numerous corridors and tiers keeping in consideration: volume and margin inter-dependencies, customer segmentation, foreign exchange costs, and clv, among other considerations. work closely with product to ensure precise and secure implementation of all required pricing actions. you should be able to navigate across datasets to bring elasticity and clv results back. business analytics – perform, evaluate and interpret for executive leadership team, analysis on business metrics to include: clv, retention, segmentation and tiering of customers, acquisition and churn trigger. acquisition modeling – join customer segmentation, sales cycles, and clv analysis to help project future growth of our various channels. provide insights through modelling on what is our most efficient approach for scaling. communicate business findings and strategic recommendations to senior management. drive the implementation of analytics platforms that connect data systems and business intelligence systems.  qualifications  requirements:  minimum of bachelor's degree, mba desirable minimum of 6 years of experience in business analytics experience with sql. experience in statistical modeling techniques. strength in matching customer behavior to revenue implications. experience and understanding in price elasticity. demonstrated ability to understand all parts of the business strong analytical ability and ability to assess cross functional processes exceptional system application skills, comfortable operating in multiple systems to extract and analyze data, including sales force, looker, snowflake. expert level skill in ms excel or other analytical tools. demonstrated track record of applying creative thinking and analysis to solve business needs in ambiguous environments. must have experience implementing operational rigor and programs across organizations  additional qualifications   strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with people in diverse and different settings exceptional oral and written communication and presentation skills, with ability to summarize analytics and modeling challenges in a suitable format and content for easy consumption by the audience ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced, environment where you must take on multiple responsibilities and do what it takes to get things done

with thousands of beautiful spaces built for travel and life, sonder is transforming the future of hospitality. each sonder is purposefully selected, designed and maintained - customized to reflect the vibe of its neighborhood. whether your stay is two days, two months or two years, in a studio or a six-bedroom, sonder ensures a unique, yet consistent experience. and with 24/7 on-demand service, crisp linens, and over 200 other quality standards, we're taking stay further for guests all around the world.  sonder started a little over four years ago, and now has thousands of spaces in cities across the globe.  sonder is building the future of hospitality. analytics is core to how we make decisions that drive success, every day.  as an analyst, you will partner with leaders across the organization to understand business challenges, identify opportunities, and analyze data to influence data-driven action. you will work cross-functionally with product, design, ops, and finance to define key metrics and measures of success, instrument tracking, and uncover insights to guide decision-making and accelerate performance.  analysts will apply their expertise to challenges in product analytics, user / guest analytics, market analytics, real estate, ops, and finance. if you are passionate about using analytics to drive performance, thrive in a cross functional and collaborative environment, and want to tackle complex data and analytical challenges, we want to hear from you!  at sonder, data-drivenness is part of our culture. your insights can accelerate our vision of building the future of hospitality.  at sonder you will:  partner with product, design, ops, and finance to plan, prioritize, and scope projects scope and build data models, working with data-engineering when needed design key metrics and identify their drivers to understand how we can accelerate performance design and run a/b tests and regressions and communicate actionable insights to stakeholders scope and build dashboards to effectively visualize trends in key metrics analyze metrics and tell a compelling story to inform decision-making communicate findings and recommendations to peers, executives, vps, and managers  what we look for:  2-4 years of professional experience in an analytics role at a public company and/or high-growth startup technical expertise in sql, excel/sheets. proficiency in python or r is an asset ability to query unstructured data and build data models. experience with etls is an asset eye for effective data visualization and proficiency in tableau or similar visualization tool comfort in statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions) a passion for analytics: you love wrangling tough data sets, extracting valuable insights, and rallying team to act on findings ability to think critically of existing ideas and processes and ask the tough questions a bias for action and delivering impact excellent communication and people skills  we also have great benefits to make your life easier so you can focus on what you're best at:   competitive salary generous stock option plan medical, dental and vision insurance unlimited vacation annual free credits and discounts to stay in sonders a company with a huge vision, a dynamic work environment, and a team of smart, ambitious and fun to work-with colleagues!  depending on your location:  daily catered lunches all the coffee you can imagine snack-filled kitchen  we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

description in this program, you’ll work on a wide range of e-commerce related projects for our profitable professional services marketplace. our program provides you with ongoing developmental assignments and exposure to multiple disciplines. justanswer has a flat organizational structure; it’s difficult to identify a typical career path so we encourage you to explore the opportunities both within and outside of your division. we look for individuals drawn to understanding complex business problems and finding viable solutions – candidates who are curious, attentive to detail, and excel in a team environment. great candidates fit our company values of “smart, fun, and get things done”. below is a list of the teams that this role will potentially have exposure to:membership: focusing on retaining and growing our very best customers, through a variety of cost-effective loyalty and engagement initiatives. ja’s members make up the very best of our customers, and we strive to find new and effective ways to attract, engage, and retain them at ever higher rates.expert operations: the supply-side of the business, ex ops works to recruit, support and engage a high-quality expert community capable of fulfilling our customers’ 24/7 demand. projects include communications, recruiting, program development, research, demand and supply forecasting, supply-side analysis and incentive modeling.product management: product managers define and prioritize the product roadmap for key areas and lead cross-functional team of engineers, designers, and business owners to drive the launch of a product.customer care: justanswer’s customer care team offers 24x7x365 multi-channel support to ensure premium customer satisfaction as well as provide the voice of the customer to company stakeholders.engineering: the engineering department designs, builds, and tests the technical infrastructure that serves our customers worldwide.we release frequently and continually monitor for improvements. inbound marketing (pr, social, email, seo): drive millions of users to our site via pr, social, content marketing and more + optimize the customer lifecycle via marketing automation and ad hoc email campaigns that rely on cutting edge behavioral targetingadvertising: responsible for acquiring customers online for the company’s domestic and international sites, we are data driven and roi focused, and dedicated to helping the thousands of people we reach each day.artificial intelligence: get in on the ground floor and help develop our ai chatbot. interact with millions of users each month and help them get the answers they need from trusted experts. create an end-to-end experience where our chatbot makes the question process more efficient, keeps the customer company while he/she waits, follows up on the user’s experience and promotes premium services.international: full ownership of different ja sites outside the us. intl creates global business opportunities for justanswer by leveraging relevant and appropriate .com efforts to domestic markets, like germany, spain, japan, mexico or the uk. analytics: analyze consumer needs and make data-driven recommendations to guide product & marketing strategies and drive measurable business impact. by harnessing the power of business analytics, big data, a/b testing, statistics, and algorithms you will create analytic tools that fulfill key business needs, and help thousands of people across the world.quality assurance: the quality assurance team provides confidence that all product requirements will be fulfilled appropriately, safely, and quickly. we do so through a mixture of testing, planning, process implementation and force of will, among other things.  responsibilities develop innovative and creative solutions for real business challenges invent new systems or alter existing ones research customers & experts using qualitative and quantitative data prepare statistical reports using data and internal surveys participate in user acceptance testing and testing of new system functionality analyze and map internal processes, data, and problems recommend changes to processes or product offerings to make internal departments operate more efficiently collaborate on cross-functional projects and improve how people work together  requirements analytical skills: work with large amounts of data: facts, figures, and number crunching. you will need to see through the data and analyze it to find conclusions. communication skills: present findings or translate the data into an understandable document. you will need to write and speak clearly, easily communicating complex ideas. critical thinking: look at the numbers, trends, and data and come to new conclusions based on the findings. attention to detail: you are vigilant in your analysis to come to correct conclusions. undergraduate bs degree in one of the following majors: mathematics, statistics, engineering, economics, business administration, computer science, or other analytical major

stat revenue’s business analysts help increase a hospital’s bottom line by analyzing large volumes of data for payment accuracy. analysts are challenged to constantly improve stat revenue’s ability to identify and capture revenue opportunities in a more efficient manner for hospitals.  other responsibilities include:  collaborate with internal team members to identify, analyze, and produce meaningful data using sql, excel, access and some vba/python programming languages proactively look for solutions and enhancements to internal processes communicate any issues when they arise and present solutions to the challenges validate and analyze internally and externally generated data summarize data and present analysis with a focus on delivering results maximize the reusability of created solutions as much as possible communicate with external parties to recover lost revenue from hospital payers job qualifications:  we provide extensive training to support the business analyst, but a few key traits will benefit you immensely:  strong computer skills, including advanced knowledge of excel and familiarity with a programming language (sql/python preferred) outstanding research skills ability to work both independently and in a team environment excellent written and verbal communication skills strong aptitude for accounting and math comfortable on the phone contact information: recruiting@statrev.com

title: business analyst job overview: the role of a business analyst is to lead the delivery of solutions and services to the business. they are responsible for understanding business processes and developing business requirements for solutions. they will perform analytical and conceptual activities. this role serves as the interface between the business and the software development team in support of solution lifecycle management including business stakeholder management. key responsibilities: collaborate with solution architects to develop solution designs and developers to ensure solutions meet the business requirements collaborate with project managers to ensure requirements are managed effectively on projects partner with delivery service managers to ensure requirements for operational changes/enhancements are managed effectively establish high quality user requirements and functional requirements on the basis of identified business needs. business requirement are analyzed on time at high quality, requiring no or little rework. evaluate information gathered from multiple sources, reconciling conflicts. decomposing high level information into details. abstracting up from low level information to a general understanding distinguishing user requests from the underlying true needs. create work effort estimations. support testing process on projects to ensure the solution is fit for purpose. operational changes derived from business customers’ change request are tracked and implemented. responsible for ensuring that the final solution matches the urs and meets the customer's needs. business value realization and business adoption role interfaces closely with: demand manager, business solutions manger, project manger, solution architect, solution owner, process owner and key business stakeholders, component smes, solution lifecycle manager, software developer qualifications/requirements: bs/ba degree or related experience must have 4+ years of related experience must have demonstrated experience in stakeholder management, leadership and influencing skills ability to facilitate and have strong presentation skills excellent communication skills both written and verbal teamwork and collaboration negotiation skills and problem solving excellent understanding of business processes

as a business analyst on the business intelligence team, you will have a unique opportunity to work closely with and impact every team at getaround, including marketing, sales, operations, product, finance, and our leadership team. it is our goal to ensure that everyone in the business has access to accurate information and enable data-informed decision making.  our ideal candidate has a strong analytical, technical, and business background with a motivation to influence the future of mobility. what you’ll be doing: working closely with business owners to understand and identify key business questions, challenges, and kpis to increase cars and renters on the getaround platform and guide outstanding decision making empowering teams at getaround to track business success on a weekly, monthly, and quarterly basis through the building and maintaining of dashboards and other tools interpreting large data sets, preparing recommendations, and presenting to senior members of the team to influence the strategic direction of the company troubleshooting data issues, validating result sets, and recommending/implementing process improvements requirements: academic background in finance, economics, math, computer science, or related quantitative field 4+ years experience in an analytics role in a fast-paced environment like tech, consulting, investment banking, etc. expertise manipulating large data sets and building models in excel/google sheets expertise with lookml or other sql languages experience with a business intelligence tool like looker, tableau, gooddata, pentaho, etc. results driven“get it done” personality; able to balance multiple projects as second nature strong verbal and written communication skills; able to produce high quality and concise deliverables experience managing project ambiguity, complexity, and interdependencies in a methodical and structured way nice to haves: expertise with google app script or another programming language like javascript, python, or r exposure to operations research methodologies experience designing and building custom software tools. at getaround, we are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we believe that no matter your race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status, your perspective has value.  come join us in continuing to make getaround a great place to work!

the position  worklete is delivering millions of dollars in direct and indirect cost savings across all of our clients by preventing common musculoskeletal injuries such as strains, sprains and back injuries. we are seeking a business analyst to develop a best-in-class framework for measuring our program's impact on our customers' bottom line and analyzing ongoing program effectiveness. reporting to the director of customer success, this cross-functional position will play a strategic role in helping to shape the long-term go-to-market success of the company.  responsibilities:  work with cross functional teams to normalize and analyze injury data from disparate sources for client-facing business reviews. apply findings to inform and influence product roadmap and business decisions. develop deep analytical insights around injury reduction results, product usage and customer experience across varied data sets and products. analyze product and customer experience data, develop objectives and metrics, and ensure product priorities are data-driven. understand the needs of the different teams and develop reports and models to make an impact across our business. translate data-driven learnings into actionable insights, and communicate them to customers and internal stakeholders to power business decision-making. collaborate with sales, marketing, product, engineering, design, and finance and provide them with data-driven recommendations to accelerate business growth. participate in cross-functional project planning and business prioritization as needed. help identify areas for data ingestion and optimization within our product.  qualifications:  bs/ms in engineering, computer science, math, economics, statistics, or equivalent. at least 3 years of analytics and database experience. previous experience in insurance or workers' comp data analysis is a plus. proficiency with analytical and database tools (e.g., hive, spark, presto, vertica, tableau). strong proficiency in excel. strong data visualization skills. experience creating dashboard reporting in tableau or similar and ability to communicate findings to key stakeholders. strong communication and presentation skills. ability to present data trends and recommendations clearly and concisely. thrives in a fast-paced startup environment. loves to tackle interesting problems and tough challenges.  about worklete  worklete is a technology platform that reduces musculoskeletal injuries for transportation, shipping and logistics companies by over 53% on average, saving companies millions of dollars a year in direct and indirect workers' compensation costs. its mobile-ready platform is scalable and effective for even the largest, most distributed, and highly-mobile workforces. founded in 2015, worklete's customers include nestlé waters, penske logistics, and hub group trucking.  worklete is headquartered in san francisco and recently secured $6.5m in series a funding from top-tier investors trinity ventures, launch capital, riverpark ventures, and kapor capital.

vti life sciences (vti) is seeking forward-thinking and ambitious engineers looking to accelerate their career in the pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device industries. we offer an opportunity to help support our teams of industry subject matter experts and thought leaders while consulting with some of the biggest companies in the life sciences industries. we are looking for a business analyst for our client in the san francisco bay area to work with user departments to develop and document user requirements for the microsoft dynamics 365 erp system. requirements: collect and analyze business requirements and design, implement and customize business system and standard operating procedures accordingly. assess functional configuration changes for impact to business processes, other system values, and integrations. complete system and user acceptance testing. manage daily support and maintenance of the microsoft dynamics 365 erp system. configure and perform performance tuning, optimization and testing of business processes and building reports. develop plans for system operations and technical procedures for cost-effectiveness and clarify program objectives using optimization analysis. work on complex service-oriented architecture design and implementation for various business operations. work closely with the project team to track issues through to resolution and resolve queries. responsible for compliance with applicable corporate and divisional policies and procedures. qualifications: bachelor’s or master’s degree or equivalent in commerce, business administration, management information systems, computer science. system support experience in microsoft dynamics 365 erp system strong analytical and technical skills. possess excellent verbal/written communication, user interaction & interpersonal skills and work well in a team environment. ability to handle highly sensitive data with confidentiality and integrity; ability to exercise appropriate judgment. demonstrated ability to quickly learn new systems and processes. vti life sciences strives to maintain and inspire professional excellence by providing commissioning, qualification, quality engineering, automation and validation services to the pharmaceutical, biotechnology, biologics and medical device industries. vti offers professional development, training, competitive compensation, excellent benefits, 401k plus a stimulating and collaborative work environment. we are committed to providing exciting career opportunities in a work environment that values trust, respect, openness, teamwork, creative talent, enthusiasm and diligence. as one of the leading global commissioning, qualification and validation services organizations, vti is always looking for innovative, talented and experienced validation professionals for our multinational and global offices. we offer some of the best salary and benefit packages in the industry for our full-time/permanent employees as well as competitive hourly pay for our contractors. www.validation.org

hypotheses, and developing recommendations. the ideal candidate will have a demonstrated passion for discovering growth levers in the world of advertising, marketing, merchandising and retail. key responsibilities: perform strategic and operational data analysis, driving insights that have a meaningful impact on the business develop a deep understanding of key value drivers to identify product. the role is highly visible throughout the organization and will give ideal candidates a great platform to grow and be heard amongst leaders in the organization. zypmedia, a leader in local digital advertising solutions for small and midsize businesses, is seeking an business analyst to join its team. zypmedia has built a leading programmatic advertising platform that connects small and midsize businesses with digital advertising opportunities across more than 50,000 desktop, mobile and connected tvs websites and apps. zypmedia's proprietary technology and dedicated service organization were built from the ground up to handle the unique requirements of local digital adverting campaigns. zypmedia partners with tv station groups to offer the zypmedia product as part of a opentable's consumer marketing team is looking to hire a seasoned analyst with a knack for extracting insights from raw data, and a desire to craft how opentable drives diner growth and invests in marketing channels and campaigns. to be successful you are self-directed; have a background in analysis; are comfortable working with large datasets; have the ability to break down complex problems to their basic elements. this is a highly visible role so confidence and clarity in communicating to all audiences is critical.  your key responsibilities   use quantitative and qualitative analysis to inform and influence business and marketing decisions partner with channel experts to establish and guide strategy and critical metrics by channel, evaluate marketing targets, inform marketing investment (level and placement), and find opportunities for growth conduct analyses not limited to cross-channel marketing, e.g. a/b or multivariate testing, marketing attribution; and/or customer analytics, e.g. lifetime value modeling, behavioral segmentation own and lead projects or work streams as relates to larger marketing and crm strategy, including identification of key issues, development of hypotheses, analysis, conclusions, and presentation of findings work with our data analytics team to define key data requirements and build robust reporting to answer key customer, marketing, and business strategy questions be the analytic authority for internal and external data sources and systems, standardize and reconcile data from disparate sources build and foster relationships with key business partners, helping them to structure solutions to data and business questions communicate findings and recommendations across departments and to executive leadership.  requirements:  4 or more years of experience as a business or data analyst you have advanced data visualization and sql skills prior experience with internet marketing software packages a plus (e.g. google analytics, optimizely, mixpanel, etc.) you are experienced with business intelligence solutions, such as microstrategy or tableau strong business insight as well as high proficiency in analytical modeling skills, working understanding of statistics and statistical methods strong intellectual curiosity with the ability to think critically and strategically. you are able to structure a problem, hypothesize solutions, and dig into the data to figure things out excellent presentation skills; must be able to synthesize, articulate and effectively present complex data/analyses verbally or in written form in a variety of presentation settings (one-on-one, small and large groups, with peers, and senior management) project management skills; identify the business question, define project scope and timing, and manage partnership and communication with key stakeholders ba/bs degree in business, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative discipline  about our team: we love introducing diners and restaurateurs to opentable and helping them get the most out of our service. we believe marketing is as much science as it is art. we are passionate about measuring results, and we see every campaign as an opportunity to learn. if you love producing programs that move the needle and have a real passion for dining out and helping restaurateurs succeed, we might have the role for you.  as an employee of opentable, you will be part of a global network that includes opentable and kayak's portfolio of metasearch brands including momondo, cheapflights, swoodoo, checkfelix and mundi. many employees are dedicated to one brand, but we all have the benefit of using each other's strengths and insights. together, we're able to help people experience the world through dining and travel.  we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

about this role  the senior growth marketing analyst will work closely with our crm team, marketers, product and growth teams to influence strava's central communications strategy that drives subscription growth, winback and user engagement. you will develop insights, drive decisions with data, and build capabilities that allow us to deliver the right message to the right athlete at the right time. the successful candidate will have curiosity, a passion for data, and demonstrate data leadership to impact the business.  responsibilities   develop data-driven frameworks and insights that further our understanding of how our email, push, and in-app notifications impact the new user experience, retention, winbacks, and monetization, both on a campaign level and holistically develop key metrics that informs the communication strategy, and build out reports and dashboards for both leadership and working teams build consensus and prioritization for strava-to-athletes communications across multiple teams and stakeholders identify opportunities and develop methodologies to improve our communication relevancy with standardized audience segmentation, campaign targeting, and personalized data in the message content contribute to the centralized data platform that moves data between our crm tools and our data warehouse to connect various touch points from strava's communication channels to our athletes and their experiences recommend, design and evaluate a/b tests, as well as standardize campaign effectiveness measurement, and spread best practices in the company seek out ways to make data more useful, accessible, and actionable for the rest of the organization  requirements   undergraduate degree in economics, math, statistics, physics or similar quantitative field; advanced degrees a plus 3+ years of digital marketing, email, or crm analytics experience excellent sql skills experience in statistical analysis (e.g., hypothesis testing and regression analysis) experience with tableau, looker, or other reporting and visualization tool strong communication and prioritization skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple projects and stakeholders in a fast-paced environment experience with strategic thinking, turning high-level requirements to kpis or data-driven framework to influence business decision-making  about strava  strava is swedish for "strive," which epitomizes our attitude and ambition: we're a passionate and committed team, unified by our mission to build the most engaged community of athletes in the world. every day, we're searching for new ways to inspire athletes and make the sports they love even more fun. but it's not only about achieving – we're an inclusive team, dedicated to elevating each other and the members of our community. that balanced approach has helped us revolutionize our industry, and we're just getting started. millions of athletes are on strava, millions more will come. when you're ready for a challenge and a team that will support you along the way, join us.  backed by sequoia capital, madrone partners and sigma partners, strava is expanding in order to exceed the needs of our growing community of global athletes. by joining our team, you will help push strava forward in fresh, innovative ways. you will engage in interesting and challenging work that will improve the lives of our athletes every day. and in the same way that strava is deeply committed to unlocking the potential of our athletes, we are dedicated to providing a world-class workplace where our employees can grow and thrive. join us!  strava is an equal opportunity employer. in keeping with the values of strava, we make all employment decisions including hiring, evaluation, termination, promotional and training opportunities, without regard to race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, ancestry, sexual orientation, physical handicap, mental disability, medical condition, disability, gender or identity or expression, pregnancy or pregnancy-related condition, marital status, height and/or weight.

ripple is seeking a senior data analyst within the analytics and business intelligence team. this person is passionate for delivering insight beyond just dashboards. the data analyst will be critical towards ripple’s strategic growth of the ripplenet network, partnering closely with product, marketing, customer success and other teams on cross-functional projects. they must be comfortable working both independently and in a collaborative environment, always with acute attention to detail. this role reports to the head of data analytics and business intelligence.  what you’ll do:  work within the data analytics & business intelligence team to provide insights to the company to enable the internet of value, driving critical business decisions towards the growth of the ripplenet network. partner closely with product, marketing, customer success and other business units to develop and own the analytics pipeline for our flagship product, xcurrent. analyze a variety of data sources and surface insights to stakeholders through recurring business reviews, self-service dashboards, and cross-team presentations (including to senior-level leaders). partner with the data infra team to define requirements for the data warehouse. what we’re looking for:  at least 4+ years in an analytics/quant/bi type role masters or advanced degree / coursework a plus but not necessary strong understanding of statistical concepts solid understanding of graph theory and hands-on experience with network analysis a huge plus rock-solid, advanced-level sql 2+ years hands-on experience with python (preferred) / r or other mathematical programming language 2+ years experience building dashboards with bi tools like tableau, looker or mode familiarity with payments and remittances a plus ability to work in a fast paced, ever changing, start-up environment what we offer: competitive salary and equity 100% paid medical, dental & vision insurance for employees; 65% paid for employee dependents generous health & wellness program industry-leading maternity & paternity leave policies flexible vacation policy- work with your manager to take time off when you need modern office in san francisco’s financial district fully-stocked kitchen with organic snacks, beverages and coffee drinks weekly lunches and optional gourmet dinners monthly team outings to sports games, happy hours, game nights and more! a learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact who we are: ripple provides one frictionless experience to send money globally using the power of blockchain. by joining ripple’s growing, global network (ripplenet), financial institutions can process their customers’ payments anywhere in the world instantly, reliably and cost-effectively. banks and payment providers can use the digital asset xrp to further reduce their costs and access new markets. with offices in san francisco, new york, london, mumbai, singapore and sydney, ripple has more than 200 customers around the world. ripple is an equal opportunity employer. we’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. we do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance. please find our uk/eu applicant privacy notice here.

every single day, zendesk’s products capture millions of customer service interactions. each of those interactions serve as data points and glimpses into customer service trends and behavior. zendesk is looking for a product analytics manager to lead and scale a team of analysts, mining these data for insights and communicating those findings back to the business. we are looking for someone who has the technical skills to surface insights quickly, and the interpersonal skills to communicate those insights in a way that persuades action. this role will join the enterprise data and analytics (eda) team. about you: you are passionate about all things data and analytics. you’re intellectually curious and will search for context and insight behind the numbers you are a player-coach, looking to inspire and be inspired you lead with empathy, but know that empathy and urgency can coexist you are scrappy, self-motivated, and unafraid to ask questions in order to grow you embrace tough, hairy problems and can unpack them into smaller, meaningful deliverables responsibilities include: conduct high-quality analyses to uncover insights about our product and users: segmentation, cohort analysis, funnel analysis - the usual suspects mentor and manage team members and their professional development, while balancing managerial responsibilities with individual project portfolio partner with product growth teams, design, and marketing, and eda leaders to execute against a prioritized list of growth analyses and evergreen assets ensure consistency and collaboration across product analysts as they develop dashboards, predictive models, and ad-hoc analyses make the analytics accessible to others - regardless of technical or analytical background collaborate with engineering to optimize data quality and improvements qualifications: 5+ years of experience in data analytics, business intelligence, or related field, including prior experience managing analysts bs/ba degree in interview deep knowledge of statistics with a solid understanding of at least one statistical tool/language (python, r, tensorflow, jupyterhub) exceptional visualization and presentation skills. you’re able to tell a visual story with graphs and data that leads to results and decision making (tableau experience a plus) the best customer experiences are built with zendesk. zendesk’s powerful and flexible customer service and engagement platform scales to meet the needs of any business, from startups and small businesses to growth companies and enterprises. zendesk serves businesses across
