are you passionate about technology and digital marketing? does revolutionizing the trillion-dollar fashion industry excite you? are you interested in identifying complex data solutions to aid in the growth of one of silicon valley’s fastest growing startups? if so, then this is a role for you!  thredup is looking for a talented and experienced senior growth marketing analyst to help our performance marketing team acquire and retain customers efficiently at scale. this person will grow into an expert on a few digital marketing channels, with ownership of the channels’ strategy and success. the role interacts extensively with the marketing, creative, engineering, finance, and product teams. his or her input will help shape key business decisions. responsibilities analyze and manage digital paid marketing channels, incorporating innovative strategies and rigorous optimization across acquisition/retention identify and size new marketing opportunities work closely with product and engineering to build site features and enhance user experience design, implement, and analyze marketing a/b tests to cultivate learnings create and maintain kpi dashboards on marketing performance requirements 3+ years of work experience in consulting/banking, performance marketing, e-commerce, or other quantitative/data-driven fields strong written and verbal communication skills ability to prioritize work and manage time efficiently strong analytical and problem solving skills master using excel and other office tools proficiency in sql ability to learn and thrive in a fast-paced startup environment ba/bs in quantitative fields or marketing from a top university preferred experience in e-commerce experience in startups knowledge/experience with performance marketing and/or e-mail a plus looker basics. lookml experience a bonus

who we are  founded in 2013, madison-reed is a prestige beauty brand empowering women with the ultimate hair-color hack. rather than settling for a suboptimal hair color "box" product or an expensive and time consuming salon visit - they provide her with a hair color experience she never thought possible: salon-gorgeous multi-tonal hair color with shine and softness, a no-smell low chemical ingredient profile, gold standard customer service with certified licensed colorists on call, cutting-edge diagnostic color matching technology, delivered to her door/on her schedule at a revolutionary price.  in addition to their at-home hair color product, madison reed recently announced the expansion of its new concept: madison reed color bars, that are expanding nationally to 20 stores by 2019. these color bars are designed for women who either need a little more hands-on assistance before doing their hair color at home, or for women who will always want assistance. color bars are the "un-salon" where clients can get salon-quality hair color at a fraction of the time and expense of a traditional salon, using our same great hair color formulations.  madison reed at-home hair color kits and color bars combined represents a two-pronged attack on the $15bn (us only) hair color market and a welcome innovation for millions of women who didn't think a better way was possible.  the above is what madison reed does, but what is more profound is their why. the company's proposition is an expression of a deep-founded belief of its founder, amy errett, who believes a confident woman is a beautiful woman and that women should confidently demand more because they deserve more, not just in hair color, but in their lives. she believes this so deeply that she named the company after her daughter, madison reed. consistent with "confident is the new beautiful", the company recently announced zero retouching in all advertising photography.  madison-reed is headquartered in san francisco and is backed by leading investors: norwest partners, true ventures, comcast ventures and maveron. the company is growing 70% year-over-year and is positioned for continued growth.  recent articles: madison reed just raised another $25million to open hair color bars across the u.s. ( https://techcrunch.com/2017/10/19/madison-reed-just-raised-another-25-million-to-open-hair-color-bars-across-the-u-s/ )  with dye jobs for just $45, hair color startup madison reed takes on $15 billion market ( https://www.forbes.com/sites/clareoconnor/2016/12/15/with-dye-jobs-for-just-45-hair-color-startup-madison-reed-takes-on-15-billion-market/ ) (forbes)  these ingenious at-home hair-color brands are disrupting the salon scam ( https://www.wsj.com/articles/these-ingenious-at-home-hair-color-brands-are-disrupting-the-salon-scam-1525273730 ) (wall street journal)  beauty brands glossier, curology, beautycounter, and madison reed make 2018 direct brands worth watching list ( https://www.cosmeticsdesign.com/article/2018/02/13/beauty-brands-glossier-curology-beautycounter-and-madison-reed-make-2018-direct-brands-worth-watching-list ) (cosmetics design)  the latest product to hit your doorstep? hair dye. ( http://fortune.com/2015/08/20/madison-reed-hair-dye/ ) (fortune)  the warby parker of hair color, madison reed, scores new funding and a cmo ( https://techcrunch.com/2017/02/09/the-warby-parker-of-hair-color-madison-reed-scores-new-funding-and-a-cmo/ ) (tech crunch)  madison reed commits to using "raw" photography ( https://www.prnewswire.com/news-releases/madison-reed-commits-to-using-raw-photography-300604325.html ) (pr newswire)  this beauty startup raised $25 million to defy the retail apocalypse and open stores across america ( https://www.businessinsider.in/this-beauty-startup-raised-25-million-to-defy-the-retail-apocalypse-and-open-stores-across-america/articleshow/61210182.cms ) (business insider)  madison reed bridges the brick-and-mortar divide ( https://www.pymnts.com/news/retail/2017/madison-reed-branches-into-brick-and-mortar-hair-dye-salons/ ) (pymnts.com)  who you are  you have a passion for performance marketing and are able to manage, analyze, and execute paid social ad campaigns. you are analytical, methodical and thoughtful, with the ability to articulate strategy and performance to executives and creatives alike, in a clear and concise manner. if you're ready to dive in, disrupt a huge category, do meaningful work, and make lasting connections, then this may be the right role for you!  what you'll do   plan, build, and execute paid social ad buys across facebook, instagram and pinterest provide data-driven and thoughtful analysis of strategy and performance to management and other cross functional partners advise creative team on creative best practices, insights and trends that will drive continued innovation in our best-in-class creative program partner with the digital experience team to analyze and optimize ads and down funnel conversion performance work with analytics team to tie deeper customer insights to social acquired customers and use that to inform future customer acquisition  skills we're excited about   2-4 years of experience running performance media on facebook, google, display or other channels. strong statistical understanding and highly analytical approach experience in working with large datasets and performing quantitative analysis ability to clearly and concisely communicate results and insights to management and creative teams well organized, meticulous about the details, and able to juggle multiple priorities a self-starter and proactive, positive thinker

at fitbit, our mission is to help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their goals.  we started our journey in 2007—as a team of two with one big idea. since then, we've grown to over 1,500 employees, sold over 60mm devices, and built a health and fitness community across the globe. in fact, the fitbit community has taken enough steps to walk from the sun to pluto! offering award-winning products, a top-rated mobile app and an easy-to-use online dashboard, fitbit provides personalized experiences that help our users reach their goals. with a reenergized focus on innovative devices, interactive experiences, and enterprise health we are transforming the way consumers and businesses see health & fitness.  from your first steps as a fitbitter, you will be at the forefront of developing new products. our culture combines the spirit of startup with the perks of being public. we offer a competitive benefits package and amazing perks like unlimited snacks, friday happy hours, onsite workout classes, and a strong focus on a healthy work-life balance. as part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to grow your career, contribute your ideas to life-changing products and services, and—above all—have fun doing it.  fitbit's hq campus is located in the heart of san francisco with office locations in boston, san diego and around the world. think you've found your fit?  fitbit is seeking an ecommerce analytics manager who will lead web analytics, fitbit.com sales forecasting, ecommerce sales analyses, as well as oversee web and email testing efforts. this individual will be responsible for leading a team of direct reports to produce insightful and actionable recommendations to optimize fitbit.com. this position based in san francisco, ca which is fitbit's headquarters and will report to the director of marketing analytics & operations.  key responsibilities: web analytics   lead ecommerce analyses of user engagement focused on web behavior and key drivers to recommend growth opportunities expand suite of data of analytical tools (e.g. google analytics) to provide metrics for marketing channels advise marketing about web engagement showcasing best practices for product pages, homepages, and product information pages based on data  ecommerce analytics   model scenarios to quantify and evaluate new business opportunities from promotions or new website functionality produce ecommerce forecasts and models that include key drivers such as new launches, cannibalization, industry impacts, geographical expansion, etc. develop with the team a testing roadmap to promote stronger kpis including traffic, engagement, conversion  relationship management   liaise with key stakeholders to interweave ecommerce analyses into coherent retrospective analyses for holiday promotions and product launches manage relationships with third party ecommerce partners to leverage technologies, tools, and data that provide new perspective about how consumers are interacting with fitbit.com partner with engineering to coordinate testing efforts, new data sources, bug fixes, and new technologies guide development of team through sharing of industry best practices, sharing of relevant webinars, and provide training for professional development delegate projects and provide feedback to each direct report to grow each person into becoming the key subject matter expert in his/her respective area  requirements:  advanced knowledge of web analytics, preferably usage of google analytics or adobe analytics advanced experience with data visualization software tableau, looker, or similar technologies used for analyses and dashboard creation experience with third party analytical software tools that provide quantitative and qualitative insights proficiency with testing tools such as google optimize or optimizely prior experience managing direct reports ability to succinctly distill analyses to key points and convey actionable next steps equally to business and technical teams ability to manage multiple projects at one time and be nimble in a dynamic organization at least 4 years of experience with web and sales analytics strong proficiency with ms office ba/bs degree  fitbit is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. we recruit, hire, train, promote, pay, and administer all personnel actions without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, citizenship, religion, age, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, and medical conditions related to pregnancy, childbirth, or breastfeeding), sex stereotyping (including assumptions about a person's appearance or behavior, gender roles, gender expression, or gender identity), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, medical condition, mental or physical disability, military or veteran status, genetic information or other statuses protected by law. we interpret these protected statuses broadly to include both the actual status and any perceptions and assumptions made regarding these statuses.  san francisco applicants: pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance fitbit will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

job description  product analysts at square are embedded within product teams and leverage engineering, analytics, and machine learning to empower data-driven decision making in the full lifecycle of product development. as a member of the team, you will lead experimentation and growth initiatives, develop automation solutions to personalize product experiences, provide insights to our sellers about their business, and drive strategic decisions with data. squares mission is economic empowerment, and our team supports this by using data to understand and empathize with our customers, thereby enabling us to build a remarkable product experience. for more insight into what we do, check out this blog post. the square appointments product helps service professionals manage their calendar on the go for appointment-based businesses. with squares online scheduling software, customers can always get access to their availability and confirm their appointments seamlessly online. our merchants can easily keep their schedules open and attract new businesseven when they're done for the day. our team has a plethora of interesting data challenges. product analysts need to deeply understand the business and help understand strategic trade-offs in our development process. appointments is unique in that it has both payment transaction and software as a service (saas) business models. analysts are deeply involved during our development process, providing insights and digging deeply with applied data science to help drive decisions. appointment scheduling is a unique in that there are many complex interactions between both consumers as well as merchants. youll get to work on both side of the product, both the consumer booking behavior and the merchant scheduling features. you will: partner with product stakeholders to make data-driven decisions across the organization by leveraging descriptive and predictive analytics where it will have material impact apply a diverse set of tactics including statistics, quantitative reasoning, and machine learning, to solve problems as well as independently research and produce actionable insights own, coordinate, and solve complex, cross-functional problems that extend beyond the traditional boundaries of product domains, analytics, and data science communicate analysis and decisions to high-level stakeholders and executives in verbal, visual, and written media lead the data strategy of the product, influencing them to make well-informed architecture and design decisions that affect data at square provide comprehensive day-to-day analytics support to partner teams, develop tools and resources to empower data access and self-service so your expertise can be leveraged where it is most impactful lead and mentor others in product analytics on medium and long-term initiatives that span across product domains.  qualifications  you have: 3+ years of analytics experience or equivalent strong written and verbal communication skills and ability to build strong relationships and influence with product partners proven ability to lead cross-functional projects that depend on the contributions of others in a variety of disciplines fluency with data, analytics and visualization technologies (we primarily use sql, looker, and python) experience in applying both data-backed heuristics and machine-learning techniques to solve practical product problems such as predicting churn, cross selling, clustering user archetypes, and more familiarity with data warehouse design, development and best practices additional information  at square, our purpose is to empower – within and outside of our walls. in order to build the best tools for the businesses and customers we support all over the world, we have to start at home with a workforce as diverse and empowered as our sellers. to this end, we take great care to evaluate all employees and job applicants equally, based on merit, competence, and qualifications. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law. we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply and always consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records, in accordance with the san francisco fair chance ordinance. applicants in need of special assistance or accommodation during the interview process or in accessing our website may contact us by sending an email to assistance(at)squareup.com. we will treat your request as confidentially as possible. in your email, please include your name and preferred method of contact, and we will respond as soon as possible.

at stockwell, we are using design and technology to build the worlds largest retailer. in our world, brick and mortar stores look much different - we place stores right where our customers live, work and play and curate the products in our stores with the help of our customers. this is all possible because we design, build and operate automated stores that put the customer first with a seamless, frictionless checkout experience.  were looking for a data analytics professional to join our retail team and help develop our growing business intelligence capabilities. our ideal candidate is someone who has strong analytics experience and has demonstrated the ability to enable data-driven business decisions by leveraging existing analytics platforms as well as building out custom data architecture from scratch. he/she is fluent in data analysis, including experimentation, data visualization, defining kpis, and communication around data to inform the success of the business.  stockwell is different in that were a consumer-facing company with machine learning baked into our dna. as a result, in your day-to-day you will be using and contributing to the design of analytics tools and retail processes powered by machine learning and artificial intelligence. your job is to use your expertise in business intelligence and leverage stockwell's proprietary technology to accelerate business growth and strengthen our understanding of and ability to delight the stockwell user. responsibilities: own the development, and maintenance of business intelligence platform, kpi reporting and dashboards leverage data sets to provide insightful analysis and strategic recommendations to both technical and non-technical colleagues function as the technical go-to person on the retail team on various retail initiatives that are cross-functional in nature such as product lifecycle management, customer lifetime value and user engagement tracking translate strategic initiatives into detailed product specifications and project milestones work with cross-functional partners to catalyze product development and drive execution support data roadmaps and lead thinking on step change improvements to existing retail tools and analytics support engineering initiatives with the objective of data quality improvement, new data capture, data feed management and platform upgrades for more efficient data consumption and application recognize and adopt best practices in business intelligence reporting and analysis: data integrity, test design, analysis, validation, and documentation qualifications: bachelor's degree in a quantitative field (engineering, computer science, mathematics, economics or finance) with 5 to 7+ years of practical experience in analytics or business intelligence roles experience with data engineering & statisticsexperience writing complex queries and report automation experience with sql, tableau and powerpoint comfortable building presentation materials to tell a clear story preferred/bonus qualifications related advanced degree or mba experience in retail and/or dotcom experience with syndicated data such as nielsen or iri experience in management consulting

---------------- role description ----------------  dropbox has evolved into a product that keeps teams in sync, through a focus on content based collaboration. in this role, you will define the future of collaboration for the millions of teams and hundreds of millions of users who use dropbox today. our aspiration for sharing on dropbox is that dropbox users will share with ease and confidence, at any time, from anywhere. they will continue to choose dropbox to collaborate on content and produce their best work because our sharing experience is simple, reliable, trustworthy, and valuable.  as the product analyst for the sharing team, you will be focused on product analysis related to these critical sharing experiences that inform both strategy and execution. your work will enable all of dropbox to share effectively and successfully across mobile, web and desktop interfaces. you will partner with a world-class team of product managers, researchers, engineers, designers, and marketers to leverage data to drive better decisions. you will also contribute to building a data-driven environment that enables colleagues and partner teams to act with confidence and speed.  we are looking for product analysts who can jump in and make an impact quickly. product analysts can expect to set up and analyze a/b tests for new experimental features, generate and size opportunities to prioritize features, and define key performance metrics for the team. as this small team continues to grow, there is also an opportunity to help craft and guide its expansion through mentorship and advocacy across the company. we hope you'll join us!  ---------------- responsibilities ----------------   working with engineering to implement, document, validate, and monitor our logging and metrics creating simple, trustworthy data pipelines and automated reporting to surface key metrics identifying, translating, prioritizing, and informing important product questions with data exploring data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and more setting up, analyzing, and promoting best practices for multivariate experiments synthesizing and communicating insights during the product development process empowering and teaching others to work effectively and efficiently with data building a data-informed and data-inspired culture at dropbox  ------------ requirements ------------   degree in math, physics, statistics, economics, computer science, or other quantitative field preferred 3+ years experience doing quantitative analyses for a technology company fluency in sql, and a solid understanding of statistical analysis, experiment design, and the common pitfalls of data analysis self-starter: you drive projects with minimal guidance and focus on high impact work strong communicator: you effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others critical thinker: you are thoughtful, self-aware, and use available evidence to make decisions collaborative: you work effectively with others and win credibility quickly  ------------------ benefits and perks ------------------   100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage 401k + company match market competitive total compensation package free dropbox space for your friends and family wellness reimbursement generous vacation policy 10 company paid holidays volunteer time off company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

temporaryjob id: 161413 location name: ca-fsc sf off (0174) address: 525 market st, 32nd floor, san francisco, ca 94105, united states (us) job type: full time position type (regular/temporary): regular job function: marketing sephora department: sephora is revolutionizing our approach to client-driven marketing. we are taking our passion for our clients and injecting it with new thinking and agile processes to accelerate how we do crm. for this transformation, we need a diverse team of strategists, digital marketing experts, data scientists, developers and creatives dedicated to testing new ideas. this team will be really good at interpreting data and insights, then asking "what if we tried...?". beyond ideation and concepting, we need scrappy individuals who can dig into the how. this team must thrive working in a dynamic environment to get things done. they'll use their expertise and ingenuity to fill in gaps where needed. and last, this team will be unwavering in their focus, upholding a mandate to rapidly test, iterate and inspire the entire organization with client learnings and opportunities.  your role at sephora: as manager, crm analytics, you will work as part of a cross functional agile crm scrum team focused on rapidly testing, learning and iterating new client led marketing opportunities. you will be at the center of revolutionizing our approach to personalization testing. your role on the scrum team will be to lead a testing portfolio and will be responsible for the size, design, coordination, measurement and insights of a/b tests across multiple media channels and platforms: email, mobile app, direct mail. reporting to the sr. manager of crm strategy, you will oversee 1 to 2 analysts to support: crm pilot opportunity sizing: actively explore our marketing, sales and client data to identify business opportunities use a data centric approach to estimating the business impact of potential crm pilots prioritize and manage the backlog of crm test ideas campaign test design & coordination: design the test plan to ensure ability to get a statistically significant read for kpis to support the test hypothesis work closely with the marketing channel specialists to ensure the test is designed and executed as needed work with vendors to build and enhance a/b testing capabilities to support testing at scale be open to creatively solving for and supporting cases where a pilot requires data or functionality that isn’t readily available or out of the box results measurement & insights: measure the results of a/b tests, provide clear takeaways and insights, extrapolate the impact of winning tests at scale conduct deep adhoc analysis to identify future points of optimization, opportunities, and learnings track the testing throughput and incremental revenue generated by crm pilots communicate results daily with the core scrum team and more broadly with the larger cross functional stakeholders.  qualifications: 5-6 years’ experience in an analytics role strong a/b testing background – ideally across multiple channels with experience and comfort with testing processes that requires being in the details of the data strong sql skills excellent communication skills – able to articulate findings that are not always straightforward or intuitive experience managing a team is a plus experience with apt test & learn is a plus experience with adobe test & target, adobe campaign and tableau is a plus a passion for client and change management strategic mindset intellectual curiosity and willingness to accept feedback  company overview: sephora has been changing the face of prestige cosmetics since its debut in 1970s paris. sephora was acquired by luxury group moët hennessy louis vuitton (lvmh) in 1997 then launched stateside in 1998, and is currently home to 200 world-class brands - including its own private label, sephora collection. sephora's curated assortment features more than 14,000 products including makeup, skin care, perfume, hair care, body, professional tools and more. sephora is the beauty education hub, offering consultations at the beauty studio, a variety of complimentary classes, one-on-one service from personal beauty advisors, and exclusive retail technology skincare iq, color iq, and fragrance iq. sephora is an international force in beauty, and its award-winning website and ever-growing presence on social-media make it the world's premier digital beauty destination.

about thoughtworks we are a global software consultancy and a community of passionate, purpose-led individuals. we think disruptively to deliver technology to address our clients' toughest challenges, all while seeking to revolutionize the it industry and create positive social change.  our product analysts play a key role in project success. you will be working with clients across a variety of sectors and making sure the business-critical software solutions we develop deliver real business value every time. fascinating clients on one side, passionate software developers on the other. you are the bridge between the two. it involves a lot of open and honest communication. it means getting to know our clients' businesses inside out by finding out what their software must achieve, how it will be used and then generating the ideas our developers draw on to create custom applications.  as a product analyst, here’s how you can expect to add value:  generate ideas and content for solutions through facilitating and leading workshops deliver custom software products with a cross-functional team help companies achieve true, differentiating outcomes by analyzing and designing complex business applications in the latest technologies be an expert in agile and continuous delivery principles and practices, and facilitate organizational transformations mentor others and evangelize agile, lean, and continuous development analysis best practices. develop your career outside of the confinement of a traditional career path by focusing on what you’re passionate about rather than a predetermined one-size-fits-all plan work in a dynamic, collaborative, transparent, non-hierarchical, and ego-free culture where your talent is valued over a role title requirements:  demonstrated experience working successfully with teams to deliver software; ideally as part of a consulting organization experience with agile delivery methodologies (e.g. scrum and xp) strong facilitation, prioritization and influencing skills experience unearthing the root cause of a client’s pain points and validating a business opportunity or problem experience with modeling business processes using a variety of tools and techniques able to define key objectives and ‘to-be” state, identify success factors, and comprehend constraints, challenges and risks experience with facilitating collaboration within cross-functional team articulate the “big picture” of the solution to a wide variety of audiences a genuine passion for quality software - and the know-how to get from sketch to code perks:  exposure to a huge variety of client engagements. you could be influencing the digital strategy of a retail giant, building a new mobile application for a bank or redesigning platforms using event sourcing & intelligent data pipelines. you’ll use the latest lean & agile thinking, solve critical problems and challenge yourself every day. allowances for books, conferences & training, cell phone, local transit, and high-speed internet personal development programs and training tailored to the career path that you choose opportunities for global assignments/travel internal conferences and community events a few important things to know: projects are almost exclusively on customer site, so candidates should be flexible and open to extensive travel.  candidates must possess work authorization that does not require h-1b visa sponsorship by thoughtworks or dependent ead.  not quite ready to apply? or maybe this isn’t the right role for you? that’s ok, you can stay in touch with accessthoughtworks, our learning community (click "contact me about recruitment opportunities" to hear about jobs in the future).  it is the policy of thoughtworks, inc. to provide a work environment free of discrimination. the company will take affirmative action to ensure applicants and thoughtworks employees are treated without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ethnic origin, veteran status, family status, disability, sexual orientation, gender expression or gender identity. this also includes individuals who are perceived to have any of the aforementioned attributes. thoughtworks will adhere to all federal, state, and municipal laws and regulations governing employment.

why roblox?  roblox is ushering in the next generation of entertainment, allowing people to imagine, create, and play together in immersive, user-generated worlds. we're the one and only fastest-growing entertainment platform that lets anyone teach themselves how to code, publish, and monetize any experience imaginable—across any device—reaching millions of players across the globe.  the impact that you can have at roblox is powerful. we're looking for someone who's eager to take on a meaningful role in the success of roblox on a massive scale. someone who takes play seriously, but also isn't afraid to have some fun either. someone who's ready to take roblox—and their career—to the next level.  in 2018, we were honored to be recognized as a certified great place to work® ( http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/roblox-corporation ). we've fostered a company culture that empowers people to do the most defining work of their career in an environment that's made up of the most passionate, team-oriented, visionary, crazy-smart people you'll ever meet. join the roblox team where play rules and the possibilities are endless.  as a data analyst - discovery, you'll be on the front lines of using big data to drive machine learning and improve game recommendations. you will work with a cross-functional team of engineers, product managers, and community experts to improve algorithms, run ab tests, and ensure structured metadata is consistent and accurate. if you have a passion for data and want to have a big impact, you'll be right at home within our highly-skilled and rapidly growing game discovery team.  you are:  passionate about data: continuously learning new techniques and tools to extract value from data. you have studied and used statistics, economics, science or other relevant disciplines. a strong communicator: you are able to work well with technical and non-technical colleagues alike. you are able to gather qualitative insights to inform analyses, and present your findings in meaningful ways. capable with sql. you can translate questions into queries, independently run analyses across large data sets, and generate useful conclusions. strongly motivated to become proficient in the state-of-the-art tool set for accessing and crunching massive volumes of data, for instance, spark, flink, and drill. relentlessly curious  you will:  accelerate product development through your understanding of the underlying data and your ability to partner with product and technical leaders to provide insights that drive machine learning improvements use quantitative analysis to design and test new algorithms, and report on results drive and track improvements in meta-data coverage and quality  you'll love:  excellent medical, dental, and vision coverage a rewarding 401k program flexible vacation policy free catered lunches five times a week and several fully stocked kitchens with unlimited snacks onsite fitness center and fitness program credit annual caltrain go pass a roblox admin badge for your avatar  roblox – powering imagination.  #li-tml1

each day, our users visit our app with the hope of connecting authentically with someone. these interactions generates millions of data points that can be used to help us better understand our customers’ experiences. we need you to ask and answer the questions that will transform this data into a better understanding of what our customers find delightful and what they find painful so that you can help drive changes that further our vision of helping singles form meaningful connections with other amazing singles!  the senior product analyst will be responsible for partnering with our product and growth teams to provide the facts needed to make better decisions and a well thought point of view to help push our products and services to better serve our customers. you will be responsible for building a strong understand of our ecosystem, working with the product team to determine which projects are the most important, and being willing to use the right tool (a scripted model, a dashboard, a presentation) to find and explain the relevant and timely findings that help us operate better.   responsibilities work cross-functionally with product, design, finance, and engineering teams to provide data-driven insights that will help define the product & marketing roadmap and drive significant increase in core business kpis (growth, revenue, engagement) create internal dashboards to monitor the health of the product and business kpis (growth, revenue, engagement). deliver ad-hoc analyses and reports to support business needs, investigate, triage and resolve metrics-based issues without heavy guidance assist in feature development from ideation to execution, including helping with user research, designing and analyzing a/b tests, and running deep analysis of feature performance post launch create and share compelling presentations that motivates and inspires the team to build with conviction when necessary, build models in r, python, or other systems that help us better measure and understand the results of experiments or user flows. qualifications bachelors and 5+ years post-collegiate work experience within tech, finance, consulting or related industry 3+ years working as a product analyst working with a team to understand and sharpen a product experience working in a fast-paced environment such as startup expert level in sql & business intelligence tools (e.g., mode, tableau, etc) competency in r, python, or another scripting language strong analytical skills, with experience solving ambiguous problems using data ability to analyze data and condense data to tell a persuasive story proven ability to effectively communicate with cross functional teams self-starter, with ability to thrive in a dynamic, fast-paced environment, drive change through influence, and collaborate effectively with a variety of cross-functional stakeholders. excited and hungry to try new tools and processes to achieve results. passionate about building delightful products for our customers.

bind is a health technology and services company founded in 2016 and headquartered in minneapolis, mn with satellite offices in new york and san francisco. bind is health insurance for the way we live now. unlike traditional health insurance that charges you for services you may never need or want, bind is on demand: pay for what you need, not what you don't, and adjust your coverage when those needs change. health coverage that's flexible, clear, and intuitive. we are creative, collaborative, and a little bit fiery. the bind team is comprised of like-minded individuals passionate about healthcare, and our cause is the collective act of rewiring it. we embrace new ideas. we're more wheel than cog. more spark than smoke. and we are playful and venturesome in our daily mission to render real and refreshing solutions to health insurance that works better for us all. product analyst – transaction systems – san francisco summary bind is designing and building a modern payment system in support of on-demand health insurance. we are looking for a product owner who can identify, analyze and act on opportunities to automate health care claims payment. we are looking for a high energy, data-driven product analyst who acts thoughtfully and proactively. you will work across product, operations and technology to help design and deliver an accurate and scalable solution that enables bind to continue to grow its customer base. responsibilities analyze data and system performance to inform product requirements propose and define new and enhanced product features develop and support testing plans work with operations, technology and quality assurance teams to ensure high quality delivery requirements bachelor's degree 2+ years of experience in a technical role computer science or related technical background ability and desire to dive into the details strong data query and analysis skills agile development experience health care experience, preferred bind is committed to providing equal employment opportunities. all qualified applicants and employees will be considered for employment and advancement without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Job_Description: about us: epic! (www.getepic.com ( http://www.getepic.com/ )) is a leading digital media brand for kids, bringing unlimited reading and learning to millions of children in homes and in schools. used in 91% of u.s. elementary schools, epic!'s award-winning subscription-based platform encourages kids to explore their interests and learn in a fun, safe, kid-friendly environment.  about the job: we are looking for a product analyst to partner with our product managers and be one of the first members of our analytics team. you will work with our pms to define key metrics, conduct analysis, and build our overall analytics processes and capabilities. this role will report to our head of analytics.  responsibilities:  partner with product team to design quantitative analyses that drive strategic decisions track ongoing product performance and assess the impact of new features conduct creative analyses to develop insights into complex questions and drive product decisions develop dashboards to empower other team members with data help build a world-class analytics function  requirements:  3+ years of experience in a quantitative or analytical role, preferably in tech extensive hands-on experience with sql and excel proven experience in quantitative analysis sharp business judgement and ability to see past the noise in large datasets to synthesize and present actionable insights strong verbal and written communication skills ability to multitask and take on diverse projects in a dynamic environment ba/bs degree and exposure to economics, math, statistics, computer science and/or business.  benefits:  full medical, dental and vision coverage, 401(k) plan unlimited vacation plan $80/month transportation reimbursement unlimited access to our product!

at fitbit, our mission is to help people lead healthier, more active lives by empowering them with data, inspiration and guidance to reach their goals.  we started our journey in 2007—as a team of two with one big idea. since then, we've grown to over 1,500 employees, sold over 60mm devices, and built a health and fitness community across the globe. in fact, the fitbit community has taken enough steps to walk from the sun to pluto! offering award-winning products, a top-rated mobile app and an easy-to-use online dashboard, fitbit provides personalized experiences that help our users reach their goals. with a reenergized focus on innovative devices, interactive experiences, and enterprise health we are transforming the way consumers and businesses see health & fitness.  from your first steps as a fitbitter, you will be at the forefront of developing new products. our culture combines the spirit of startup with the perks of being public. we offer a competitive benefits package and amazing perks like unlimited snacks, friday happy hours, onsite workout classes, and a strong focus on a healthy work-life balance. as part of our team, you'll have the opportunity to grow your career, contribute your ideas to life-changing products and services, and—above all—have fun doing it.  fitbit's hq campus is located in the heart of san francisco with office locations in boston, san diego and around the world. think you've found your fit?  what you'll work on:  apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining and presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with our core/business products. partner with customer support, research, product specialist, community, social and engineering teams to identify trends and opportunities inform, influence and support our product decisions using insight on customer experience designing and evaluating experiments monitoring key metrics, understanding root cause of changes in metrics building and analyzing dashboards and reports understanding the customer support ecosystems, user behaviors, and long term trends identify levers to help move key metrics evaluating and identifying metrics building models of user behaviors for analysis  required skills   5+ years experience in an analytics/data science role bachelors, masters degree in quantitative discipline (economics, finance, statistics, engineering, computer science or mba with emphasis in analytics) proficient at analyzing large multi-dimensional data sets using data/statistical tools such as r, python, sas, spss and excel. experience utilizing tools like tableau, highcharts, qlikview linux skills (shell scripting, java, php, etc.) a strong passion for data, charts, analysis, trends, and evangelizing data usage an appreciation for fitbit's products ability to draw conclusion from data and provide recommendations presentation skills including creating keynote/powerpoint presentations part of a growing company that is focused on providing an outstanding customer experience, you’ll have the opportunity to expand your skills and discover your potential.   if you’re looking for a career at a socially conscious company that offers great benefits — including matching 401k and tuition reimbursement — then you may have just found your new home.   esurance combines the spunk of a startup company with the backing of allstate (the largest publicly held personal lines insurer in the u.s.) to create a unique, energized, and exciting place to work.   the sr. bi manager is who we are:  keeptruckin is on a mission to modernize the trucking industry. with the leading fleet management platform, we are bringing trucks online and fundamentally changing the way freight is moved on our roads.  we are a forbes cloud 100 company and we’ve been recognized by glassdoor as a “best place to work” in 2019. we’re on the hunt to find talented individuals to join our growing team.  located in the city’s south of market (soma) neighborhood, the keeptruckin headquarters is a walk away from oracle park (go giants!) and union square. our building—built in 1923—has a unique industrial, open feel made comfortable with countless comfy couches and beautiful greenery. when they’re not working, you can find fellow team members playing pool, enjoying the rooftop view, and exploring this historical city.   about the job:  as a senior business intelligence analyst, you will have the opportunity to work closely with our stakeholders at all levels using data to drive strategy (finance, product, customer success, marketing & sales). you’ll lead in the design, execution, and analysis to tackle our unsolved business problems. we are looking for candidates who can not only analyze complex data sets with an acute attention to detail, but also provide hypotheses and test why specific metrics are changing. responsibilities: develop predictive models such as identifying customer churn, addressing forecast accuracy, and market sizing. perform exploratory product data analysis to identify gaps, test hypotheses and formulate opportunities to inform roadmap teach internal teams on technical skills and guide users through new dashboard and analytics tools and create support documentation. be a champion of data culture among our teams and mentor junior team members collect and develop requirements for business-facing issues to translate to technical problems. partner with business teams to set kpis and report weekly on performance to proactively find gaps, set targets, and identify new market opportunities build self-service tools to enable cross-functional teams to optimize processes interface with executives to drive projects from inception to completion - data warehousing, etl, modeling, dashboarding, and recommending insights create, optimize and maintain queries against large databases and automate reporting and etl jobs. design and create visualizations and dashboards across marketing, sales, and customer success that empower them to access data and draw insights in a self-serve manner qualifications: 4-6 years in an analytical or strategic role b.a./b.s in math, statistics, or related quantitative discipline experience with sql - extracting, transforming, loading, then analyzing data experience with looker or other visualization tools familiarity with python/r, or other scripting language using statistical packages, such as numpy and pandas experience with snowflake data warehouse, salesforce crm, and big plus if you’re familiar with aws demonstrated self-learner interest and curiosity ability to problem-solve and work in an evolving environment   as an equal opportunity employer, we are committed to diversity in the workforce. in accordance with applicable law, we prohibit discrimination against any applicant or employee based on any legally recognized basis, including, but not limited to; race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, lactation, childbirth or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, age (40 and over), national origin or ancestry, physical or mental disability, genetic information (including testing and characteristics), veteran status, uniformed service member status or any other status protected by federal, state or local law.

the principal business intelligence (bi) analyst applies skills as a seasoned, experienced professional with a full understanding of industry-wide business process and analysis practices and organizational policies and procedures. resolves a wide range of business process issues of moderate to complex scope. demonstrates good judgment in selecting methods and techniques to obtain solutions.  the principal bi analyst utilizes knowledge of radiology operations along with a polyglot data infrastructure to construct actionable, visally appealing reports and data visualizations, and dashboards. works closely with end-users, leadership, and other teams including data warehouse owners.  the principal bi analyst in concert with the director of clinical informatics works to establish and execute the radiology and biomedical imaging department clinical bi strategy.   the analyst actively advances the department's financial and operational goals through team leadership, data analysis, and proactive problem solving. the analyst collaborates and independently designs strategies for 1) aggregating and analyzing data to meet department-wide financial and operational goal requirements, and creating appelaing, easy-to-understand data visualizations and reports, and 3) disseminating the financial/operational data and systems expertise department-wide.  this position reports to the director of clinical informatics with a dotted line report to the chief financial officer. the analyst is an ex officio member of the bi steering committee. this position also works closely with several external teams within ucsf and ucsf health including those responsible for managing data warehouses.  department of radiology & biomedical imaging the department of radiology & biomedical imaging at ucsf combines clinical excellence, trailblazing research, and outstanding education in a leading academic health sciences institution. our faculty includes some of the foremost names in diagnostic and interventional radiology today. the department of radiology and biomedical imaging provides state-of-the-art clinical imaging for patients. in addition, it conducts world- class scientific research to develop the next generation of clinical imaging tools and techniques to fight cancer and other life-threatening medical conditions globally.  about ucsf  the university of california, san francisco (ucsf) is a leading university dedicated to promoting health worldwide through advanced biomedical research, graduate-level education in the life sciences and health professions, and excellence in patient care. it is the only campus in the 10-campus uc system dedicated exclusively to the health sciences.

zeus - flawless stays.  founded in november 2015 and based in san francisco, california, zeus is shaking up the $12b corporate housing industry through its unique strategy of leasing unfurnished, privately-owned homes and converting them into expertly appointed, full-service corporate housing units for today’s global professional. we're passionate about delivering world-class customer service and becoming the most trusted provider of corporate housing on earth. with 700+ homes spanning the san francisco bay area, los angeles, washington d.c., seattle ( more cities coming soon), we are well on our way to realizing our vision. zeus has raised $14.1m in financing from initialized capital, google ventures, bowery capital, and floodgate. the zeus founders have all had previous exits and have worked in real estate and technology for over 10 years.  the role  you will partner with leaders across the company to measure the performance of their teams and make data-driven decisions to improve them. this could include sales, operations, finance, technology, and executive leaders. your primary tool for sharing and analyzing data will be our bi platform (looker). what you will do own our bi platform. organize, develop, and maintain it such that it's easily usable by all teams take company kpis and create the definitive way of measuring them. be the source of truth. build dashboards and reports for every department so they understand performance and what's driving it help department heads understand their data, capture new data, and make data-driven decisions work with data engineering to add data to our bi platform as needed track data about our industry so we understand where we fit in the broader market what we are looking for 5+ years of experience in bi/analytics ability to deeply understand the nuances of our complex business ability to clearly and concisely explain data through written, oral, and visual means proficient in sql. can take raw database and create complex sql queries/views as needed. excellent organizational skills. we have a lot of data to keep track of. ability to thrive and adapt in a high growth, rapidly changing environment. experience with looker is a bonus (our bi platform) benefits 100% medical, dental, and vision coverage for employees and their dependents parking, commuter pass, and education or certification expense coverage 20 days paid time off per year + all major holidays catered daily team lunches 401k with matching relocation package zeus is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, gender expression, age, national origin, disability, marital status, sexual orientation, or military status in any of its activities or operations.  we do not accept calls from 3rd party recruiters.

job overview: reporting to the director of enterprise analytics and reporting platform, the bi manager will be responsible for setting vision and providing day-to-day leadership and supervision over a team of direct and indirect resources supporting the analytics and reporting services function for the enterprise. perform other duties as assigned. essential functions: manage a team of internal resources and external partner resources to support, maintain, design and expand our reporting and analytics solutions and platforms. work in partnership with peers on high-value innovation opportunities. drive a culture of rapid prototyping and service design thinking. ensure that bi solutions and platforms adhere to privacy, information security, quality and regulatory requirements. socialize enterprise analytics and reporting solution and platform roadmaps. define and manage sla metrics and kpis to track and measure the availability and quality of our services. foster an environment and culture that is characterized by high performance, impactful work, strong engagement, customer focus, innovation and pride. proactively work to identify and encourage career development opportunities that will support the professional development goals of each team member. develop and maintain processes, tools, and training to support innovation center colleagues to ensure professional development and advancement. regular, dependable attendance & punctuality. qualifications: education/experience: bachelor s degree in computer science, engineering, it or a related technical field, or equivalent work experience. more than 8 years of managing bi development team and supporting complex data analytics, business intelligence and enterprise dashboard/reporting solutions and platforms. minimum 5 years of working with bi tools such as cognos, tableau or business objects. minimum 3 years of experience working with cloud technologies. hands on experience with sql and prototyping. experience with cloud databases like redshift and google bigquery preferred. experience with large scale database in retail/complex business environment is desired. communication skills: excellent presentation and communication skills. mathematical skills: basic math functions such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division, and analytical skills. reasoning ability: must be able to work independently with minimal supervision and make sound decisions. physical demands: this position involves regular walking, standing, sitting for extended periods of time, hearing, and talking. may occasionally involve stooping, kneeling, or crouching. may involve close vision, color vision, depth perception, focus adjustment, and viewing computer monitor for extended periods of time. involves manual dexterity for using keyboard, mouse, and other office equipment. may involve moving or lifting items under 10 pounds. work hours: ability to work a flexible schedule based on department and company needs.

minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  4 years of experience in financial/quantitative analysis.  preferred qualifications: experience working with databases, using sql across standard relational environments.  experience with programming and scripting languages.  experience working on large distributed data systems  knowledge of industrial grade is architectures and reporting tools.  ability to meet deadlines and work well in ambiguous environments.  excellent project management skills. about the job at google, data drives all of our decision-making. as part of the finance business intelligence team, you will use data to inform business and product decisions across the company. using your technical skills, business acumen and creativity, you will build tools to automate reporting and generate insight that will allow clients to quickly and accurately see how our key business products and processes are performing. previous experience managing finance systems projects, with emphasis on providing business intelligence and data driven insight through reporting, will have equipped you well for this role. you’ll be involved in projects from inception to delivery, ensuring that your reporting delivers high-quality and relevant data to intelligently grow our business. you will also have extensive knowledge of key financial systems, such as oracle and hyperion, and experience working with a range of other business intelligence tools and platforms.  sales finance is part of google’s financial planning and analysis (fp&a) organization, providing financial and analytical support to google’s business organization. our work is integral to the operations and strategic decision-making of the commercial teams across all our advertising products. from understanding market and usage trends to exploring the productivity and returns on our various investments, the finance organization is an important partner and adviser to the commercial leaders. in this role, you will work on a team that provides finance support to sales leadership. the name google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. and nobody at google loves big numbers like the finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across google products. from developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business. responsibilities  partner with business and finance leadership and their teams to understand needs, ensuring that our data solutions are an excellent fit to their evolving needs.  partner with business intelligence to shape google’s data infrastructure, including business intelligence, reporting, and analytics platforms.  drive cross-functional systems projects with google customer solutions (gcs) business/business intelligence/engineering teams to improve the visibility, profitability, and risk profile for gcs.  manage, drive, and deliver multiple data workstreams on an ongoing and ad-hoc basis.  contribute to the development of the team’s tools, skills, culture, and impact. at google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. we also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. see also google's eeo policy and eeo is the law. if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .
Published_Title: Senior Business Intelligence Analyst, Google Customer Solutions, Ads Finance

Job_Description: our mission: as the world’s number 1 job site, our mission is to help people get jobs. we need talented, passionate people working together to make this happen. we are looking to grow our teams with people who share our energy and enthusiasm for creating the best experience for job seekers.  the team: our marketing team helps job seekers and employers around the world to discover indeed. whether creating impactful advertising, coding bidding algorithms, or looking for the news stories in indeed's labor data, indeed marketers bring diverse skills to help shape and share indeed’s story. every month, over 250 million people count on us to help them find jobs, publish their resumes, process their job applications, and connect them to qualified candidates for their job openings. simply put, we help people get jobs, and we want to share our story with you.  your job: indeed is looking for an accomplished marketing analytics professional to lead marketing analytics for it’s smb business in an effort to better measure and optimize marketing investments across the globe. the sr. manager, smb marketing analytics will lead a team of business and data analysts as well as manage the team’s relationship with media strategy and business intelligence.  the ideal candidate has a proven track record of developing robust test designs, attribution methodologies and optimization protocols for both on and offline direct response campaigns. you have a unique combination of quantitative skills, business acumen, media expertise and management experience. you understand the pitfalls of many attribution offline methodologies and design tests to measure the full incremental impact of a campaign. once a campaign is running, you obsess over detecting strong signals that allow you to make creative and media optimization recommendations. you not only inspire your direct reports, but you inspire internal teams and agencies to develop high performing credit karma is working to make financial progress possible for everyone. data and analytics play a pivotal role in this mission and every part of our business – informing new product design, driving marketing efficiency, and powering the recommendations we personalize to each of our 80+ million members.  we’re looking for a senior manager, product analytics to be the single point person for personal loans, our fastest growing vertical. in this high-impact, high-visibility role, you will lead a team to drive key product decisions through deep analytical insights and rigorous measurement. if you love designing tests and turning analysis into tangible business results, this role could be for you. what you’ll do: lead a team and be responsible for their career development and growth conduct analysis and design tests to support new product launches, drive improvements to existing features, and inform the product roadmap. have oversight into business intelligence and recommendation analytics challenges for the vertical be a thought partner to product management and drive data-informed product decisions. develop learning agendas and test plans to support agile, data-driven decision-making. perform exploratory analysis to generate hypotheses, identify gaps, and size opportunities for new product feature what’s great about it: you’ll get to solve highly analytical problems and have a direct impact on the future of the credit karma product. the role is highly cross-functional, which means you get to work with product, engineering, marketing, business development, and data science. you’ll serve as an influential sounding board for product leadership and help apply a high level of rigor to decision-making. your work will help us design better products, improve user experience, and inform overall business strategy. what we expect: 8-10 years of analytics experience in a fast-paced environment bs/ms in business, economics, engineering, math, stats, or equivalent experience experience of managing people and teams required experience with consumer finance/lending is a bonus ability to problem-solve and understand key drivers of marketing effectiveness strong sql and excel skills with exposure to r/python experience with working with engineering/product experience with working with consumer finance a plus great communication skills with analysts and non-analysts alike

overview oportun is a financial technology company founded in 2005. our mission is to provide affordable loans that help people with little or no credit history establish credit and build a better future. oportun uses advanced data analytics and technology to “score” and lend money to individuals with limited credit history that other lenders consider “unscorable.”  in recognition of oportun’s goals of increasing economic opportunity for our clients, promoting community development, and serving low-income or underserved communities, oportun was certified by the united states department of treasury as a community development financial institution or cdfi.  at oportun, everything we do reflects our corporate values of service, care, innovation, courage, excellence, and empowerment.  oportun is a great place to work if you are as enthusiastic about helping others as you are about your own professional development and career. as our ceo raul vazquez says, “earning a paycheck to support yourself and your family is critical. satisfying career ambitions is rewarding. but there is no greater privilege than having a challenging job where you are growing and learning professionally, while having a strong positive impact on the lives of others… and that is what we do here every day.” responsibilities are you hungry to be at the forefront of innovation, to help define and create never-before products and experiences that will benefit millions of americans? do you get excited at the prospect of helping build, from the ground up, scalable marketing programs leveraging the latest in customer insights, data and technology? are you interested in identifying optimal marketing strategies and figuring out what mix of channels (from owned channels like the website, to digital, social media, email, and direct mail) work best? do you geek out using data to relentlessly pursue hypotheses until the case is solved? if so, read on!  the director of marketing analytics leads a team responsible for analyzing and optimizing our marketing investments across all of oportun’s marketing channels, primarily focused on digital (e.g., digital display, website, email, social etc.). this highly visible role partners with marketing and is responsible for the entire analytics lifecycle, from ensuring proper experimental design and implementing timely tracking, to ensuring insights and learnings are actionable and used to improve future marketing programs. the individual will also lead a cross-functional team to test and build scalable digital marketing programs.  measure effectiveness of all marketing programs and customer acquisition campaigns. develop multi touch attribution methodologies across all channels to assess effectiveness of multi-channel marketing efforts. partner with cross-functional teams internally and external data and technology vendors to test and build scalable digital marketing programs. develop data strategy to support marketing analytics and enhance business intelligence needed to provide timely, insightful and action-oriented monitoring of marketing programs. lead experimental design and implementation of a/b tests needed to improve funnel performance (from awareness to purchase) and channel efficiency and inform marketing investment decisions attract, mentor, and grow a high-performing marketing analytics team qualifications master's degree in statistics, economics, mathematics, business, engineering, operations research, or physics. 8+ years of analytics experience. 4+ years of direct to consumer marketing (b2c). experience in marketing in financial services / lending a plus. 4+ years’ people management experience 2+ years’ experience in managing digital marketing channels, e.g., display, sem, seo, email, and affiliates excellent sas and sql (or similar language) programming skills. experience with python a plus. familiarity with leading marketing technologies and tools such as google analytics, optimizely, data management platforms, etc. excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work directly with sr. management from the following areas: marketing, compliance, risk management, engineering etc. and external partners: credit bureaus, marketing technology vendors etc.

about figure  figure technologies creates innovative consumer financial solutions for home improvement, debt consolidation, and retirement while providing financial literacy and financial empowerment. our mission is to build and promote innovative financial products on blockchain that benefit consumers and eliminate rent-seeking, illiquidity, and other inefficiencies present in current financial markets.  at figure, we build really big things. and to build big, we need a company in which everyone is supported in doing their absolute best work. that is what culture means to us. we are a team of incredibly smart people who love architecting and building things from scratch. we know we are working with the absolute best and are challenged by our colleagues every day. we are the kind of people who wake up curious each morning and go to bed each night wanting to accomplish more.  this is an amazing opportunity to be part of a startup focused on solving real problems with blockchain and to work with a team of proven leaders who have created billions of dollars in value in the fintech space. join us!  about the role  the data analyst is a key team member supporting the business with reports and analytics to make quality, data-driven decisions. the analyst will use advanced data modeling, predictive modeling and analytical techniques to interpret key findings from company data. we are looking for a driven, data loving, team player that will jump in and thrive in a startup environment.  what you'll do   partner closely with data and business teams and support them with high quality reporting and analytics be a champion for data accuracy and consistent reporting mine and analyze data from company databases to drive optimization and improvement of product development, marketing techniques and business strategies. use both descriptive and predictive modeling to increase and optimize customer experiences, revenue generation, underwriting as well as other business outcomes. develop and manage our company's a/b testing framework and drive towards data-founded conclusions.  what we're looking for   5+ years of experience manipulating, processing and extracting value from large, complex datasets… all while making insights easy to consume for a general audience. working knowledge of data mining principles: predictive analytics, mapping, collecting data from multiple data systems on premises and cloud-based data sources. strong sql skills, ability to perform effective querying involving multiple tables and subqueries. advanced tableau coding skills with a track record of developing visualizations that drive and optimize business outcomes. strong r and/or python (preferred) coding skills. understanding of and experience using analytical concepts and statistical techniques: hypothesis development, designing tests/experiments, analyzing data, drawing conclusions, and developing actionable recommendations for business units. experience and knowledge of statistical modeling techniques: glm multiple regression, logistic regression, log-linear regression, variable selection, etc. excellent communication skills for coordinating across teams a master's (or equivalent experience) in statistics, mathematics, economics, or other quantitative field preferred ability to thrive and succeed in a startup environment  benefits to you   competitive salary based on experience and skills firm-wide bonus target competitive stock options package as an early member of the team a flexible paid time off and vacation policy comprehensive health, vision, dental insurance and much more to come!  figure will not sponsor work visas for this position. in compliance with federal law, all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the united states and to complete the required employment eligibility verification form upon hire.

be self-motivated, with a results oriented demeanor great communication skills and a strong desire to succeed experience in an agile environment  qualified candidates must be able to travel to client sites in and around the bay area.  what's our mission?  great people working together with passion, enthusiasm, and commitment to consistent delivery of high quality, high value services that fully satisfy the needs of every client. focus on developing fulfilling long-term relationships with clients, employees, partners, and the technical community.  what makes designmind a great place to work?  awesome clients, cutting edge projects, a great team who really likes to work together. designmind recognizes the value of diversity, supports professional development, and celebrates the achievements of our team members.  designmind ( http://www.designmind.com ) offers medical, dental & vision benefits, 401(k), annual and performance bonuses, sunny offices in the heart of downtown san francisco, and many other great perks.
