the company the we company started as a platform for creators in providing members space, community, and services that enable them to do what they love and craft their life’s work. wework alone has grown to over 400,000 members in 26 countries as one of the many business lines of the we company to help people achieve their purpose and connect with others.  our dedication to technological innovation has enabled us to grow to more than 400 workspace locations as well as support the other business lines including welive (living space), wegrow (education), rise by we (wellness) and powered by we (enterprise). every day, we see and feel the impact we can have on an employee’s and member’s lives. we do good work on every scale, and we’re proud of it. the team the core platform mission is to stimulate, accelerate, and scale creative capabilities in connecting communities with space. we do this by providing we developers with programmatic tools based on single sources of truth about identity, space, time, and utilization. within core platform, the space kit team has created the world’s largest digital repository of interior space and are looking for a data analyst to help us onboard customers and build new functionality. what you’ll do each of the we business lines has their own unique needs for space kit’s digital representation of physical space and uses it to support their own unique use cases. as a data analyst, you will work with these internal customers to define data requirements for their space kit implementations, mapping our capabilities to their needs, and assist them during the implementation process. because of your key customer-facing role, you will also work with product managers to define and prioritize new space kit capabilities. your specific responsibilities will include:  managing customer integrations, including requirements gathering, data mapping, and project management. systematizing customer integrations to develop efficient, repeatable onboarding processes. developing implementation plans and project managing data migration, data quality checking, and clean-up efforts. organizing and prioritizing customer requirements for ongoing development. determining the teams responsible for generating source data and suggesting business process changes needed to reliably pass the data from source to api. testing to validate data quality. writing user guides for accessing data, as well as maintaining data definitions of terms. building dashboards in looker or similar to visualize a range of data trends, including internal performance metrics, usage analytics, and quality-check tools. working with pms and data engineers to convey specifications for specific data models, tables, or views to be built into the data warehouse. what we’re looking for in you you have a college degree and at least 2 years of experience working with data-intensive projects. you’re skilled in excel, sql, and in working with large datasets. you’re proficient with looker, tableau, powerbi or similar bi tools. you are compassionate, humble, and collaborative. you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. it would be very nice, though not strictly necessary, if you were also proficient with revit. the we company is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in all its forms. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

nurx is looking for a data analyst who loves answering complex business and health questions through data. this is a rare opportunity to help build a data-driven culture from the ground up and impact the lives of millions by helping reinvent the healthcare system. we're building a system to support delivery of medical care in a modern and truly empathetic way.  on this team, you'll work closely with engineering, product, operations, and finance to analyze and mine data available internally to help drive process. you'll be reporting to the director of data & research and will engage with all aspects of nurx to discover insights on how to drive operational efficiency, help plan for staffing, and most importantly, increase our ability to improve our patient's health.  what you'll do:  deliver the insights necessary to help nurx scale its operations and medical teams. build intuitive dashboards to empower other team members with actionable data. identify, track, and report regularly on key operational performance metrics. develop quantitative analysis, ad-hoc reports, and models to support key operations decisions, including staffing plans, process optimizations, and personnel performance management. take an active role in tracking and analytics across the company. flex into other areas of the organizations to help drive data driven decision making. assist the product, finance, and engineering teams derive key insights as needed. engage with stakeholders to understand business problems and translate their questions into insights and easily digestible summaries.  a bit about you:  bachelor's degree in: math, finance, economics, statistics, data science, physics or related field. minimum of 3+ years of experience in data science, business intelligence / consulting / investment banking / healthcare / public health or related experience. analytical mindset, with the ability to focus on a problem, ask insightful questions, and gain expertise quickly. proven ability to write, optimize and execute complex sql queries. experience with python, r, scala, or other programmatic data analysis languages. experience working with etls or an understanding of data warehouse organization. expertise in a/b testing is ideal. bonus points if you've used and understand splunk, looker, or mode. competent understanding of statistical principles (eg. statistical significance). ability to derive meaning from raw data in order to influence product decisions and direction.  bonus* qualities:  prior experience with or interest in distributed data store environments. passionate about improving the state of healthcare in the united states and beyond.  about us: at nurx, we're creating a future where healthcare is easily accessible and affordable for everyone and building software that empowers people to be in control of decisions about their own health.  our platform enables doctors to give patients personalized care at lower costs and prescriptions delivered straight to their door. we are committed to disrupting the healthcare system and increasing access to healthcare for millions across the country, starting with birth control and prep.  and we need you to help us continue to make this happen.  benefits:  talented and collaborative team who will both support and challenge you. market competitive salary and equity. medical, dental, commuter, wellness, and engineering technology benefits. 401(k) retirement plan. paid holiday, vacation, and sick leave. take what you need vacation (and we really mean it!).  this position is full-time and based in san francisco, ca.

job description shipt is a membership-based marketplace that helps people get the things they need. our friendly shoppers handpick fresh groceries and household essentials and deliver them to members in as soon as one hour. we're looking to add a sr. product analyst to the data science team to help turn in-app member and shopper behavior into valuable insights and influence our product development and strategy. we have rich, complex datasets collected in a multi-sided marketplace and our team performs a wide variety of analytical tasks of those datasets, ranging from designing and evaluating a/b tests, conducting ad-hoc research, creating dashboards, crafting complex database queries and etl pipelines, and developing sophisticated predictive models. the ideal candidate will be data-driven, intellectually curious, and a clear communicator. your responsibilities develop a thorough understanding of all data elements and interpret them as they relate to member and shopper behavior, profitability, and product development work closely with the product and engineering organizations during all points of a feature's life cycle: event instrumentation, performance analysis, and a/b testing explore data to find actionable insights and make product recommendations through funnel analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and related techniques design dashboards and data visualizations to communicate meaningful metrics to different audiences within the business find opportunities for improvement across the business and assist in decision-making across teams requirements 5+ years of experience with data analysis and turning data into insights and recommendations strong sql skills are required (we use postgres and redshift) experience with a business intelligence tool is required (e.g., chartio, tableau) experience with a statistical scripting language is required (e.g., r or python) experience with hypothesis testing in a business setting is a plus experience with event instrumentation is a plus experience with mobile app metrics (user acquisition, sessions, re-engagement) is a plus a bachelor's degree in a quantitative field we are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

Job_Description: at porch, we are reinventing the way homeowners connect with professionals to get work done on their home. do you enjoy collaborating with teams to solve challenging puzzles? are you passionate about working with large data sets? if so, join our team. as a product analyst, you will partner cross-functionally with product and business teams to (1) identify and report on core metrics used to make decisions, (2) define and solve tough business problems and (3) derive insights that have a meaningful impact. you will work across all business functions, using data to derive strategic insight, communicate the insight with business leaders, and assist in driving long-term growth. you will be a member of highly collaborative team that values personal growth and education, and offers team-led courses and sessions in sql, scripting, and advanced analytics. in this role, you will work with our product development teams touching the core part of the user experience. this team works with key people across engineering, product, marketing, sales, and operations to ensure that homeowners are connected with the most qualified pros. if you are a fast learner with the ability to thrive in a high-speed, ambiguous environment, using data to build frameworks where none exist, this might be the role for you. what you will do partner with product managers to define and report on kpis use data to analyze opportunities and risks to the business collaborate with data engineers and product teams to ensure that data is being captured accurately and efficiently within the data warehouse work with leaders to identify inefficiencies within the marketplace and opportunities to improve customer satisfaction partner with product and engineering teams to drive understanding of existing and new product usage, and measure product stability what you bring bachelors degree with 2+ years of experience or graduate degree with some experience within related field and industry 2+ years of relevant experience in an analytical, data and/or business roles experience querying databases, researching, analyzing and summarizing data in a business environment strong sql or scripting skills and ability to use excel to do further analysis strong creative problem-solving skills, business insight, and customer focus strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to translate technical data into actionable insight to general audiences able to work cross-functionally and to manage multiple competing tasks in a fast-paced environment strong data visualization skills preferred competency in at least one scripting language (r, python, etc.) preferred experience working with financial data or accounting preferred experience solving ambiguous problems using data and making it easy for the business to take action based on practical business insight preferred about porch launched september, 2013, as an online home improvement network connecting homeowners with qualified professionals, porch has grown into the industry leading partner for the home. with more than 250,000 active professionals across the u.s., porch partners with large retailers like walmart, lowe’s, and pottery barn to provide home services fulfillment for their customers, as well as direct-to-consumer access to more than 160 different home services offerings through porch.com. focused on assisting customers at every stage of the “home journey” – including moving in, installations, assembly, repairs and ongoing maintenance – last year alone, the company facilitated over 2 million home-related projects, generating almost $1 billion in revenue for small business owners and sole proprietors in specialty areas such as plumbing, roofing, electrical work carpentry, and more.

socrata, now the data & insights division of tyler technology, helps governments use data more strategically and effectively in the design and delivery of their programs and missions. our data platform and cloud-based solutions support the world’s most ambitious data programs at every level of government. our customers include the us federal government; half of the us states and most major us cities and counties.  socrata is addressing multiple interconnected markets, supporting innovative customers around the world, and solving some of the hardest technical challenges at the intersection of big data, analytics, visualization, and the cloud. we are looking for a product analyst to partner closely with product managers and colleagues in engineering, design and customer support to manage and groom the product backlog. success in this role is demonstrated by (1) a product backlog that is consistently up to date and reflects latest product priorities, and (2) a product development team that is aligned on the product development goals and working effectively to achieve them. as a product analyst you will be critical for helping us ship the product features that create real customer value. your responsibilities may include… understand and communicate the product vision, priorities, and success metrics for your product area. be a champion for agile product development and the continuous improvement of the product development process. oversee project decomposition and estimation activities that set engineers up to ship features on schedule. ensure project flow by driving research & analysis needed to identify and manager risks and challenges related to customer adoption,, user experience, and technical development. groom the product backlog balancing new feature development, bug triage and technical work to drive both new customer growth and existing customer retention. communicate information in the form of user stories that support user needs, program functions, test cases and steps required to develop or modify systems. you have… ba/bs degree or equivalent practical experience. familiarity with agile software development. attention to detail and commitment to high-quality results-oriented output. strong creative problem-solving skills, business insight, and customer focus. strong interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to translate technical data into actionable insight to general audiences. able to work cross-functionally and to manage multiple competing tasks with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. it would be great if you also have… 1-2 years of experience working in a fast-paced, data driven environment. experience working in a software development environment. experience working with jira or atlassian products. how we act how we act with each other and our clients embodies the core values and our code of conduct: we value big ideas and creative execution we build open and honest relationships we are results driven and accountable we celebrate success together we aspire to be remarkable we take individual responsibility for the success of every client  competitive salary including a 401k with employer match, employee stock purchase plan as well great health benefits are offered. qualified applicants are encouraged to apply! about us our mission at socrata, the data & insights division of tyler technologies, is to help government use data more strategically and effectively in the design and delivery of their programs and missions. our data as a service platform and cloud-based solutions support the world’s most ambitious open data programs and internal data sharing programs at every level of government. our clients include the us federal government; half of the us states and most major us cities and counties. some of our amazing clients include states like new york, texas, massachusetts and utah; cities like seattle, chicago, los angeles and new york; federal agencies like the centers for disease control and prevention (cdc), us department of commerce, the us department of transportation and the centers for medicare & medicaid services! our select few non-governmental clients are ones with influence over government data policy, including the world bank, the united nations and the european commission. socrata is about to embark on its next stage of robust growth as part of tyler technologies. on april 30, 2018, tyler technologies (nyse:tyl), the leading provider of end-to-end information management solutions and services for local governments acquired socrata, the market leader in making existing government data discoverable, usable, and actionable for government workers and the people they serve. the potential to layer socrata’s powerful data technology on top of tyler’s mission-critical line of business systems in more than 15,000 local government organizations will allow socrata to provide data and insights on a scale that has the opportunity to fundamentally change the way local government understands their operations, uses their resources and serves their constituents. now is the time join socrata – the data & insights division at tyler - and change your career trajectory! tyler technologies (nyse: tyl) is a leading provider of end-to-end information management solutions and services for local governments. tyler partners with clients to empower the public sector - cities, counties, schools and other government entities - to become more efficient, more accessible and more responsive to the needs of their constituents. tyler's client base includes more than 15,000 local government offices in all 50 states, canada, the caribbean, australia, and other international locations. in 2017, forbes ranked tyler on its "most innovative growth companies" list, and fortune included tyler on its "100 fastest-growing companies" list. headquartered in plano, texas, tyler has more than 4,200 employees in multiple divisional and regional offices across the u.s. you can learn more about tyler technologies at www.tylertech.com. the data & insights division employs 130 team members, and is headquartered in a vibrant and creative workspace in seattle, wa. you can learn more about this amazing, new division of tyler at www.socrata.com. tyler technologies is committed to the principle of equal employment opportunity for all employees and to providing employees with a work environment free of discrimination and harassment. all employment decisions are based on business needs, job requirements and individual qualifications, without regard to race, color, religion or belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, veteran status, family or parental status, or any other status protected by the laws or regulations in the locations where we operate. tyler technologies will not tolerate discrimination or harassment based on any of these characteristics. tyler technologies encourages applicants of all ages. at the data & insights division of tyler, we aspire to be remarkable: in the culture we create, the products we build, and the services we deliver. we believe a diverse team that embodies many different backgrounds and experiences is necessary for us to be the best we can be. within the division, we pursue a culture of inclusivity by identifying and removing aspects of our culture that stop people from being able to do the best work of their lives in physical and emotional safety, while being their authentic selves. we seek diversity, equity, and inclusion across our organization and in our daily work as individuals. we understand change takes time and that we still have work to do, and we are committed to making continual progress.

development.  as a member of the team, you will lead experimentation and growth initiatives, develop automation solutions to personalize product experiences, provide insights to product teams, and drive strategic decisions with data. responsibilities: partner with product stakeholders to make data-driven decisions across the organization by leveraging descriptive and predictive analytics where it will have material impact apply a diverse set of tactics including statistics, quantitative reasoning, and machine learning, to solve problems as well as independently research and produce actionable insights own, coordinate, and solve complex, cross-functional problems that extend beyond the traditional boundaries of product domains, analytics, and data science communicate analysis and decisions to high-level stakeholders and executives in verbal, visual, and written media lead the data strategy of embedded product engineering, influencing them to make well-informed architecture and design decisions that affect data at carta provide comprehensive day-to-day analytics support to partner teams, develop tools and resources to empower data access and self-service so your expertise can be leveraged where it is most impactful lead and mentor others in product analytics on medium and long-term initiatives that span across product domains qualifications: 5+ years of analytics communication skills and ability to build strong relationships and influence with product partners proven ability to lead cross-functional projects that depend on the contributions of others in a carta is creating the ownership network that maps the world's assets. check out who we are and how we work here.  at carta we want to create an environment for carta's owners - you - to do your best work, by offering competitive benefits and perks:  we are committed to wellness: health, dental, vision, and life insurancecompetitive pto and unlimited sick time  we are committed to investing in your future:401k matching program  we are committed to a supportive work environment:commuter benefitscatered lunch and unlimited snackscell phone stipend  we are committed to lifelong learning:unlimited reimbursement for work related booksfast paced work environment geared towards professional growth  carta is backed by many of the best investors in the world, including social capital (slack, intercom, box), union square ventures (twitter, twilio, coinbase), menlo ventures (uber, warby parker), spark capital (oculus vr, slack, cruise automation), meritech capital (gofundme, looker, snowflake), and tribe capital.

sift is the leading machine learning fraud detection solution for online businesses, processing hundreds of millions of events each day for companies around the world (eg airbnb, seatgeek, traveloka). customers use our cloud solution to stop fraud and abuse, slash operational costs, and grow revenue. we're making the internet a safer place!  what we're looking for: -----------------------------  we're looking for a product manager to join our team who is early in their product career and is looking to grow rapidly. we believe the best way to learn is through hands on experience. so, you'll work closely with a senior pm, product designers, and engineers to take ideas and make them reality. you'll have responsibility for key components of the product which will help you develop your pm skills in practice, not just theory. up for the challenge?  what you'll do: ---------------------   own key components of the roadmap and work with a senior pm to define, develop, and execute projects. work directly with engineers to develop and ship your projects write specs, mock up concepts, lead product reviews, cut tickets, write copy and do whatever it takes to ship. communicate within your r&d team, across the product teams, and directly with sift's customer facing teams. be obsessed with customers. talk to them. validate your ideas with feedback and data. ensure that the customer is infused in everything you do.  what would make you a strong fit: ---------------------------------   you have a technical degree (eg cs, math, physics) or experience writing code. if you have a side project, send us a link. we'd love to check it out. you have 0-2 years of experience in a product facing role (program manager, product ops, product analyst, etc) for a tech company. previous pm internships at tech companies is a big plus. you love building and getting things in the hands of customers. you're hands on, passionate, and collaborative. you're flexible, can deal with change, and ambiguity excites you.  a little about us: ------------------  sift is a hyper-growth series d company that facilitates the largest trust network of online businesses and consumers on the internet.  the sift trust platformtm uses real-time machine learning to accurately predict which users businesses can trust, and which ones they can't. the upshot? consumers know which companies they can entrust with their personal and financial information. and businesses can customize each user's experience based on their trust score – which leads to more revenue, higher conversion rates, and less fraud and abuse.  benefits and perks: -------------------   competitive total compensation package 401k plan medical, dental and vision coverage wellness reimbursement education reimbursement flexible time off catered meals  sift is an equal opportunity employer. our core value of "be tough on ideas and excellent to each other" is built on a foundation of diversity and inclusion; we work together to ensure the best ideas win. we hire people with different perspectives, educational backgrounds, and life experiences, because we know this makes us stronger, healthier, and more innovative. our commitment to belonging enables us to bring our full selves to work so we can contribute our talents in meaningful ways and "win as one team."

product analyst  analytics | san francisco, ca chegg office   summary   the product:  chegg’s flash tools team develops the leading crowdsourced learning service to help students succeed in school. it is used by millions of students to create and share flashcards, study guides, and quizzes. we help students learn faster, stress less, and get better grades. working with the flash tools team offers the unique opportunity to have fun and work on amazing projects while reshaping the world of education.   the role:  as we look to continue to scale existing products and build new products, the candidate will be instrumental in analyzing data by dashboarding business analytics, forecasting business goals, leveraging data to uncover new insights, and improving decision making for the products and business.   strong communication and analytical skills are critical for success in this role. persistence, creativity, strong detail-orientation and a strong desire to improve will make you successful in this role. the candidate should have aspirations to one day becoming a business or product leader.   responsibilities core analytics: derive insights on conversion, retention and financial performance build dashboards to track kpis for the product and business ongoing product analysis support - understand the “why” behind data support creation and presentation of reports on user trends, user behavior, product engagement, and experiment performance support project prioritization through the sizing of various potential product initiatives proactively identify product pain points and opportunities from the data identify key levers in the business and support goal-setting process by uncovering trends conduct and present ad-hoc analyses to inform roadmap decisions and investments build thoughtful and detailed models to support business cases partner with engineers, marketers and product managers to solve pressing issues and build new features requirements 5+ years’ experience in product/business analysis or background in a quantitative field is preferred. self-starter, persistent and strong desire to learn ability to zoom out - to see the big picture - and zoom in – to conduct detailed analysis – on the business diligent and consistent ability to follow-through on long, comprehensive projects strong analytical skills, organization skills and attention to detail ability to communicate ideas and key points clearly with every level within the organization must be persistent, creative and have strong team skills must be comfortable taking initiative and proactively offering product recommendations and enhancements through analysis of various data sources qualifications bachelor’s; technical fields preferred (business, econ, math, statistics, engineering, etc) strong analytical skills and business acumen fluency in sql and familiarity using python experience with adobe analytics, google analytics, google tag manager, and data visualization tools (tableau/domo/kibana) preferred, but not required advanced computer proficiency skills using excel and powerpoint strong modeling experience excellent written and verbal communication skills 5+ years of experience in a business analyst, product analyst, investment banking or management consulting role is preferred about chegg:  as the leading student-first connected learning platform, chegg's student hub makes higher education more affordable and more accessible, all while improving student outcomes. chegg is a publicly-held company based in santa clara, ca with offices in san francisco, new york, portland, india, israel, berlin, and ukraine. chegg student hub services includes; chegg study, tutoring, writing tools, math help, test prep, careers search, internship admissions, and college admissions.   video shorts - life at chegg: https://jobs.chegg.com/video-shorts-chegg-services   certified great place to work!: http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/chegg   chegg corporate career page: https://jobs.chegg.com/   chegg is an equal opportunity employer  #li-vp

at uber, we ignite opportunity by setting the world in motion. we take on big problems to help drivers, riders, delivery partners, and eaters get moving in more than 600 cities around the world.  we welcome people from all backgrounds who seek the opportunity to help build a future where everyone and everything can move independently. if you have the curiosity, passion, and collaborative spirit, work with us, and let’s move the world forward, together. about the role  we are looking for a high performing product analyst to make significant contributions to our mission. product analysts work closely with product, data science, engineering, and operations on fast moving, high-stakes problems. a deep analytical passion to learn and ability to execute on key business priorities is a must. what you'll do  you will shape the direction of uber’s products by using data-driven insights to identify opportunities and prioritize of product and engineering initiatives. you will:  define and analyze key product data sets to understand customer and product behavior. build visualizations to communicate data to key decision-makers. explore data to identify opportunities and discover customer and product insights. recommend product and business decisions based on your analysis. analyze and design experiments to assess the impact of product changes. solve problems and answer data-related questions about customers and products. communicate your findings to cross-functional peers and management. what you'll need  undergraduate and/or graduate degree in math, economics, statistics, engineering, computer science, or other quantitative field prior experience in product analytics or other forms of data analysis excellent sql skills and experience in at least one scripting language (python or r preferred) demonstrated ability to use data to help solve business problems solid understanding of statistical methods ability to learn and adapt to new methodologies and approaches to data collection and data analysis ability to deliver on tight timelines and move quickly with cross-functional teams to execute on decisions while maintaining attention to detail ability to work in a self-guided manner superb communication and organization skills  about the team  the consumer data science team uses data to improve the ways that uber’s users engage with our products. product analysts on our team produce and interpret business metrics, design and conduct product experiments, and develop actionable insights from the data. we work closely with six major product areas: driver: creating a seamless product experience for drivers across the driver journey: matching drivers to cars, onboarding onto our platform, creating a stress free trip experience, and providing flexible earnings opportunities to engage drivers long term. rider: building products that create an awesome experience for people who ride with uber. maps: provide optimal routes and magical pickup / drop-off experience for riders, drivers, and eats couriers using a rich dataset about maps, location, and sensors. payments: building delightful ways for users to pay and get paid for their uber rides and more uber for business: creating products for organizations needing a seamless global travel solution and who want to provide courtesy rides to their customers and clients. new mobility: developing new products and businesses including bikeshare, scooters, and other emerging modes of transportation on uber’s platform.

job description  overview: this role of product analyst in the seller solutions group will report to the senior director responsible for visa account updater (vau). vau is a key value added service that enables card account updates to help avoid disruption to customer relationships and maintain the continuity of payment relationships for cardholders and credential-on-file merchants and consequently enabling higher authorization rates. the product analyst will help evaluate potential product opportunities, develop product proposals, and help recommend market expansion strategies. he/she will contribute to the product vision and delivery, including managing functional requirements, feature expansion/prioritization, and product operations. he/she will also partner with internal groups to develop product expansion opportunities to new clients/markets and will partner with north american client facing teams to help clients optimize their use of the product. he/she may also be required to manage independent programs. he/she will be responsible for working cross-functionally with product, client services, sales, marketing, finance, risk, legal and technology. the ideal candidate will be comfortable with a dynamic environment, highly organized and a creative problem solver. responsibilities include: support expansion of vau functionality support development of new issuer and merchant functionality global expansion of vau - partner with regional product teams on opportunities to expand vau adoption globally support regional hubs and market product teams to expand vau to key markets in lac, ap, and cemea work with marketing to create/updated new client and consumer facing communications and update sales materials help develop training materials to encourage acquirer and merchant adoption of new vau functionality gather market intelligence to support strategy development and product commercialization; research and analyze competitive landscape in priority markets analysis to support key clients (issuer, acquirer, and merchant) as well as to identify opportunities to expand or optimize usage partner with to client services teams to support issuer and acquirer implementation and answer operational questions use gbi and vau data to conduct merchant and issuer vau utilization analysis and identify opportunities for improvements complete analysis for issuers to show vau impact/value as well as to identify opportunities to help optimize issuer vau practices support portfolio/co-brand conversions develop presentations for client calls produce monthly and quarterly vau reporting; tracking to support issuer and cof merchant penetration; identify and implement opportunities to improve/reengineer internal vau reporting partner with client services to ensure accurate lists of participating vau issuers, acquirers, and merchants responsible for aspects of management reporting (including key performance metrics including client adoption, fee revenue, and payment volume saved)  qualifications  bachelor's degree required, advanced degree desirable 2+ years of experience working in product management or management consulting, with experience and knowledge of payment solutions a strong plus excellent interpersonal skills to build connections with internal visa teams and clients ability to transform business ideas into detailed requirements that enable technology teams to deliver new products or product enhancements based on business needs. flexible and creative thinker with the ability to generate outside-the-box solutions ability to excel in a large organization by finding solutions that meets the needs of diverse stakeholders strong analytical, problem solving, and organizational skills ability to create and influence strategy passionate about what you do, sense of humor, and fired up about the opportunity to transform payments globally excellent problem solving skills with a strong focus on clients excellent communication skills, including verbal, written and presentation necessary ability to influence those without direct management responsibility  additional information  visa will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of article 49 of the san francisco police code. all your information will be kept confidential according to eeo guidelines.

minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree in data science field or equivalent practical experience. 6 years of experience in analytics utilizing data sets. experience in working autonomously and prioritizing multiple tasks. experience using sql, python, or other data/scripting languages.  preferred qualifications: database querying experience. demonstrated ability to understand new databases and data structures. solutions and client service-oriented, with the ability to support internal customer needs. familiarity with google products, tools, and data infrastructure. excellent analytical skills and ability to navigate through ambiguity in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. ability to work and influence cross-functionally with multiple teams. excellent organizational skills and attention to detail. excellent written and verbal communication skills. about the job the google play team ensures a safe and high-quality experience for users by designing, managing and continuously improving the scaled operational review processes that carry out global policy enforcement to remove non-compliant content.  our operations and policy team has the critical responsibility of protecting google's users by ensuring app safety by fighting abuse and inappropriate content.  in this role you'll be responsible for providing analytics/bi support for play apps and games verticals to ensure our platform’s trust and safety. you'll understand the operational metrics, and develop and maintain critical platform security and abuse metrics for policy, operations, program management, engineering, business development, and executives. you're passionate about driving data vision, providing analytical insights, and ensuring the quality of our metrics. you'll work globally and cross-functionally to navigate challenging data problems, make data-driven decisions, and resolve abuse and fraud cases. google play offers music, movies, books, apps and games for your devices, powered by the cloud. it’s a google approach to entertainment, syncing magically across your devices and on the web. as part of the android and mobile team, googlers working on google play do everything from engineering our backend systems, to shaping the product strategy, to forming great content partnerships. they make it possible for people to do things like buy an ebook or song on their android phone, then have it instantly available on their laptop. the google play team helps strengthen the overall android ecosystem by giving developers and partners a premium store where they can reach millions of users. responsibilities develop, monitor, and maintain abuse/quality operations metrics, including proposing and aligning with leadership and regularly re-evaluating choice of core metrics. own analytics and metrics processes, including preparing data to inform project prioritization, operational insights, and quota setting. define and manage tools and processes, respond to ad-hoc data and analysis requests. work with leadership and cross-functional teams to identify insights and actions to improve quality, compare performance to other products/platforms and identify potential best practices. influence evolution of analytics/bi infrastructure and push for upstream data hygiene, build abuse metrics reporting and tools. identify internal data sources across systems and teams, and ensure data hygiene. at google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. we also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. see also google's eeo policy and eeo is the law. if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

Job_Description: the challenge this is a high impact, highly visible role well suited to individuals with a highly quantitative, inquisitive bent of mind. the ideal candidate will be able to work autonomously and will have a technical background with strong communication and project management skills. as a sr. customer and product analyst you will be responsible for helping different businesses and teams achieve operational and execution efficiencies using data. your leadership and interpersonal skills will help you engage with product management, customer success, marketing, and sales teams to understand and distill their business intelligence needs and deficiencies. your strong data etl skills will help you combine disparate sources of data so that they can be analyzed and your understanding of statistics will help you analyze the data and derive useful actionable insights for the various teams. your success is predicated on providing insights that enable digital marketing businesses to lower customer churn, identify product feature utilization, and facilitate upsell and cross sell opportunities. what you’ll do manage the data collection, analysis, and delivery of kpis for a digital marketing business. collaborate with a digital marketing business’ technical teams to understand where data is stored and how it can be extracted. analyze customer usage data and derive insights for product, customer success, and marketing teams. standardize insight generation and help build automated self-service tools for the same. own and lead relationships with stakeholders across digital marketing businesses. what you need to succeed 3- 5 years relevant experience degree in engineering, statistics, mathematics or related disciplines are strongly preferred. ms/phds are preferred. prototyping skills in r, python, spark or similar language are required. ability and preference to work in a rapidly changing and less defined business environment. very strong project management skills are required. the ability to work with disparate teams, often in different geos, prioritize tasks and following up on them is critical for success in this role. experience with machine learning, artificial intelligence, and/or econometrics is strongly preferred. knowledge of the digital marketing industry preferred but not required. at adobe, you will be immersed in an exceptional work environment that is recognized throughout the world on best companies lists . you will also be surrounded by colleagues who are committed to helping each other grow through our unique check-in approach where ongoing feedback flows freely. if you’re looking to make an impact, adobe's the place for you. discover what our employees are saying about their career experiences on the adobe life blog and explore the meaningful benefits we offer. adobe is an equal opportunity employer. we welcome and encourage diversity in the workplace regardless of race, gender, religion, age , sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

position summary  this is a unique opportunity to join a small, high-visibility team that is making a big impact. anchored by the world’s largest retail audience database, we help brands perfect point-of-purchase advertising, delivering media performance coupled with best-in-class targeting and reporting. we believe all digital advertising at walmart can address the ever-evolving needs of full-funnel advertising – from shopper marketing to brand advertising, from upper funnel awareness to lower-funnel conversion, across online and offline channels.  we are looking for an exceptional individual who is intellectually curious, enthusiastic, detail-oriented, and a self-starter to join our team as a product analyst for our wmx platform. this role is a highly visible position central to the continued growth, efficiency and success of the walmart media exchange (wmx) platform as well as the walmart media group / advertising team.  walmart media exchange (wmx) houses instore and online shopping data from the world’s largest retailer, walmart. we have amazing and actionable insights that our supplier brand partners love and are super excited about, as we activate their campaigns either on walmart.com or on our managed dsp.  the role will have broad exposure across product, engineering, sales, marketing and finance. the ideal candidate will have a strong background in product analytics with specific experience around segmentation, targeting and reporting workflows.  this position will report to the director of product, wmx display, within the walmart media group and will be located in our san bruno, california offices.  what you will get to do:  analyze advertising interactions to optimize advertiser experience provide key business insights that drive decision making based on trends (large focus on ad products). manage analytics lifecycle for ad products from concept to delivery. visualize key metrics on an ongoing basis to communicate out to various teams. design dashboards to simulate and track product and advertiser performance implement, manage, and reconcile internal and 3rd party metrics to drive product decisions. identify shopper and advertising trends and provide these inputs for product improvements. develop quantitative analysis, ad hoc reports, and models to support advertising decisions.  who you are:  customer-centric: you are passionate about supporting an efficient and impactful advertising centric product organization with awesome insights and strong focus on the shopper experience. strong sql, hiveql, spreadsheet and presentation skills with an exceptional ability to communicate new ideas and findings. previous product analytics experience in digital advertising preferred. strong analytical skills and ability to clearly synthesize large dataset into key insights. experience working with relational databases and sql query languages. familiarity with no-sql architectures, r, or python is a plus. self-starter looking to gain broad operating experience in helping scale a fast-growing business. intellectually curious with strong analytical and communication skills. a good balance of analytical and creative thinking ensuring that business objectives are delivered consistently. thrives under pressure, balancing multiple work-streams and priorities. team player who is a self-starter and is able to thrive in a fast-paced, results-oriented environment. ba/bs in economics, statistics, mathematics, or related field.  what we can offer you:  unique opportunity to accelerate your career by collaborating in the evolution of the roadmap for the dmp of the world’s largest retailer. exposure to high visibility and strategic projects with potential for big impact. first-hand experience to help define the future of omni-channel advertising. to develop and generate your professional network. exciting, challenging problems to solve - you'll never have a boring day at the office. a refreshingly fun work environment where you will collaborate with a smart and talented team of product managers, engineers and business folks who care most about getting stuff done. opportunity to learn and participate in the growth of a fortune one startup.  minimum qualifications  bachelor's degree in business or related field  about walmart  walmart global ecommerce is comprised of walmart media group, walmart.com, vudu, samsclub.com, and our technical powerhouse @walmartlabs. here, innovators incubate next-gen e-commerce solutions in real-time. we integrate online, physical, and mobile shopping experiences for billions of customers around the globe. how do we do it? we continuously build and invest in new technology including open source tools and big data innovations. data scientists, front and back-end engineers, product managers, and web and ux/ui teams collaborate alongside e-commerce experts to envision, prototype, and bring revolutionary ideas to life in a dynamic, flexible and fun work culture

about snowflake  snowflake is growing fast and we’re scaling our team to help enable and accelerate our growth. we’re passionate about our people, our customers, our values and our culture! we’re also looking for people with a growth mindset and the pragmatic insight to solve for today while building for the future. and as a snowflake employee, you will be accountable for supporting and enabling diversity and belonging.  snowflake started with a clear vision: make modern data warehousing effective, affordable, and accessible to all data users. because traditional on-premises and cloud solutions struggle with this, snowflake developed an innovative product with a new built-for-the-cloud architecture that combines the power of data warehousing, the flexibility of big data platforms, and the elasticity of the cloud at a fraction of the cost of traditional solutions.  in addition, snowflake’s culture was built on the following values that are even more important to us today:  put customers first. we only succeed when our customers succeed integrity always. be open, honest, and respectful think big. be ambitious and have big goals be excellent. quality and excellence count in everything we do get it done. results matter! own it make each other the best embrace each others differences  we’re looking for a talented senior product analyst to come aboard. in this role, you will work closely with our product and engineering teams to uncover insights about how customers use snowflake, helping to inform product’s decision making and focus engineering efforts. you will also work on long-running analytical initiatives marked by greater complexity and less structure that will yield substantial product enhancements. this is a strategic, high-impact role that will help shape the future of snowflake products and services. as a senior product analyst at snowflake you will: sleuth through large amounts of data to uncover feature-usage patterns, subtle issues with the system, potential performance enhancements, and areas to improve user experience. collaborate closely with engineers and product managers to inform product decision making with data and to identify opportunities to create more value for our customers. build dashboards to help engineering and product managers monitor performance and availability of our system. answer questions from executive team for board reporting, publications, and industry reports. think creatively to find optimal solutions to our complex, often unstructured problems. our ideal candidate will have: expert-level experience working with sql and relational data (3+ years on a regular basis). 3+ years of experience with at least one scripting language commonly used for data analysis, such as python (scikit-learn, numpy, and pandas) or r. 2+ years of experience working with large-scale machine generated data (e.g., log, application, or customer-usage data). hands-on experience with mpp databases, such as snowflake, redshift, bigquery, vertica, etc. ability to clearly present learnings to business leaders and technical stakeholders. the ability to thrive in a dynamic environment. that means being flexible and willing to jump in and do whatever it takes to be successful. there’s no particular degree requirement; however, people with a background in economics, statistics, industrial operations, math, engineering, or cs may be particularly well-suited for the role.   snowflake is an equal opportunity employer. all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, color, gender identity or expression, marital status, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, race, religion, pregnancy, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws, regulations and ordinances.

title: product analyst reporting to: head of data  we are looking for a razor sharp, driven product analyst who can translate business goals into actionable analyses. this role will provide business and analytical insights to help identify conversion opportunities and key customer pain points. data and analysis serve as the backbone of decision making at mammoth. this role will have the opportunity to lead in developing the standard frameworks and bi dashboards for daily analysis behind company-wide decisions related to the consumer experience and funnel optimization.  in this role you will:  work with executives and other stakeholders to understand and clarify business goals and objectives perform and present deep-dive analyses that drive business value by surfacing opportunities to improve growth and engagement define and build visualizations for key performance indicators (kpis) in periscope and/or python analyze new product features and ab tests, as well as content quality contribute to improvements in business processes, strategy and product direction through data-driven analyses contribute to data modeling and definitions as a primary data stakeholder  required qualifications:  ba/bs with at least two years of analytics experience or six years of analytics experience strong proficiency in sql experience with at least one bi tool (periscope, looker, ssrs, tableau, etc.) clear communicator: keeps stakeholders in the loop, creates requests for engineering as data collection improvements are needed for analytics, documents business processes demonstrable analytical instincts and skillset data enthusiast willing learner experience working within an analytics team  preferred qualifications:  experience with predictive modeling and practical statistics experience with building and maintaining a full scale bi environment basic knowledge of key concepts in data modeling and relevance to data warehousing interest and/or experience with python for analytics and modeling experience/interested with modern data tools such as redshift, airflow, hive, s3, spark, kafka, etc. comfortable presenting results and developing presentations experience/interest in analysis and product development around mobile devices and media  benefits and perks:  competitive compensation unlimited pto + 11 company holidays medical, dental and vision coverage employer sponsored 401k monthly company social events free snacks and catered lunches on fridays free parking or metro pass reimbursement  about mammoth: mammoth media is redefining entertainment for the mobile-first generation. mammoth is the first company to produce, distribute, and monetize original entertainment apps for micro-boredom in daily life.  "most app developers targeting teens and their ever-shrinking attention spans fall short of mainstream success — but not mammoth media." - mashable  mammoth is the studio behind consistently top-charting apps, yarn and wishbone mammoth is disrupting the traditional hollywood model by combining established writers, influencer talent, and an innovative format with real-time data analytics to deliver premiere content for the mobile-first generation mammoth’s innovative approach to creating and distributing content has made waves within the industry, grabbing the attention of authoritative outlets  mashable , variety [http://variety.com/2018/digital/news/mammoth-media-13-mllion-series-a-1202680787/], techcrunch [https://techcrunch.com/2018/01/30/mammoth-media-series-a/]and videoink [https://www.thevideoink.com/2018/01/30/inside-mammoth-medias-13m-series-funding/], to name a few  mammoth is creating unique and organic sponsored content with partners and brands such as l’oréal, dunkin’ donuts, m2, crypt tv, vertical networks and skype, allowing for direct engagement with consumer audiences that cuts through the clutter

at pandora, we're a unique collection of engineers, musicians, designers, marketers, and world-class sellers with a common goal: to enrich lives by delivering effortless personalized music enjoyment and discovery. people—the listeners, the artists, and our employees—are at the center of our mission and everything we do. actually, employees at pandora are a lot like the service itself: bright, eclectic, and innovative. collaboration is the foundation of our workforce, and we’re looking for smart individuals who are self-motivated and passionate to join us. be a part of the engine that creates the soundtrack to life. discover your future at pandora!  siriusxm and pandora have joined together to create the world’s largest audio entertainment company. together, we are uniquely positioned to lead a new era of audio entertainment by delivering the most compelling subscription and ad-supported audio experiences to millions of listeners – in the car, at home and on the go. our talent, content, technology and innovation continue to be at the forefront, and we want you to be a part of it! check out our current openings below and at www.siriusxm.com/careers. pandora is seeking a sr. product analyst for our listener analytics team. the person in this role will be the insights owner for 2 to 3 consumer facing product areas and will partner closely with peers in product management, engineering, user research, and design to drive fact based decisions to help innovate our listener facing product offering. responsibilities: insights owner for 2 to 3 consumer facing product areas (e.g., subscription, music collections, listener growth, marketing technology) expert on the key performance indicators for product areas including defining tracking requirements for new features, building and maintaining automated reporting, and speaking to performance provide the fact base to influence what products to build and develop forecasts around listener use and business outcomes design, analyze, and report on ab tests to understand impact of new product features and make launch recommendation visualize and communicate insights clearly across functions and levels of the organization highlighting the “so-whats” of the analyses proactively identify product opportunities through analysis of listener behavior and collaboration with cross-functional groups including user research, marketing, product, and engineering  requirements: 5+ years experience using data to drive product/business decisions, preferably on engagement based consumer product teams sql proficiency; familiarity with r or python is a plus solid understanding of statistics including ab experimentation and regression modeling familiarity with tableau highly motivated, proactive and able to solve diverse problems efficiently proven history of decision making excellence and cross-functional influence through insights excellent written and communication skills education: ba/bs or graduate degree in business, statistics, mathematics, or related field pandora is committed to diversity in its workforce. pandora is an equal employment employer and considers qualified applicants without regard to gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, race, ethnicity, veteran or disability status. women and people of color are encouraged to apply. pandora is also a vevraa federal contractor. pandora requests priority referrals of protected veterans from each esds, as required by regulation. if you believe you need a reasonable accommodation in order to search for a job opening or to apply for a position, please contact us by sending an email to disability@pandora.com. this email box is designed to assist job seekers who require a reasonable accommodation to the application process. a response to your request may take up to two business days. in your email, please include the following: the specific accommodation requested to complete the employment application process. the location or office to which you would like to apply. the subject of the email should read "request for reasonable accommodation".

job category products and technology job details role:  salesforce business technology is looking for a sr. product analyst to work with business partners, geographically dispersed scrum teams, and external customers to transform our customer's support experience and scale our global business. this role is responsible for gathering, organizing, and documenting business requirements in a shareable, actionable, standardized framework. the sr. product analyst is focused in a specific functional scope yet covers its broader system/technical domains.   the sr. product analyst should share a comparable level of subject matter expertise with their business partners and a robust understanding of the technology concepts applicable for the functions. confident engaging with business and technology partners, the sr. product analyst is adept at distinguishing objectives, obstacles, and solutions. the sr. product analyst may contribute to solution designs, testing plans and execution, as well as the training, troubleshooting, and project management aspects of addressing business and operational needs.   responsibilities:  the sr. product analyst collaborates with the product owner on requirements, business value scoring and success metrics. the sr. product analyst drives the requirements gathering process that accurately reflects business needs, including: risk analysis, “as is” and “to be” process documentation, agnostic of a specific technical solution. the sr. product analyst reviews technical solutions for compliance to business process and objectives. the sr. product analyst coordinates end to end uat cycle. the sr. product analyst develops organizational change management framework; communication, training, and post implementation support. the sr. product analyst also writes business level (feature group/functional success metrics) acceptance criteria. a typical day may also include: analyzing the business processes and business systems for inefficiencies facilitating recommendations for solutions or improvements and reviewing solutions that can be accomplished through new technology or alternative uses of existing technology. acting as liaison between business stakeholders, such as management, customers or end users, and the software development or information technology team. analyzing and communicating stakeholder needs by documenting business requirements. documenting and evaluating required data and information. using modeling, testing and data models to improve the flow of information through an organization to enhance project success. plan, prioritize and deliver systems enhancements. support and upgrade implemented systems  able to : work proactively on customer issues and resolve them in a timely manner communicate at both the business and technical level (written and verbal) work very comfortably with stakeholders at the department or division level. juggle multiple issues, set expectations and prioritize accordingly research and respond to customer questions navigate complex situations involving multiple parties  experience with : general post-sales business processes (support, customer success, services, renewals, etc.) salesforce core product and features force.com features and capabilities the process of engineering it solutions (software primarily), and the tools/processes involved in it: requirements management, source management, systems for managing user stories, code deployments, release management, environment management, ci/cd tools posting statement salesforce.com and salesforce.org are equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employers. qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender perception or identity, national origin, age, marital status, protected veteran status, or disability status. headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/cvs through this web site or directly to managers. salesforce.com and salesforce.org do not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. salesforce.com and salesforce.org will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with salesforce.com or salesforce.org. pursuant to the san francisco fair chance ordinance and the los angeles fair chance initiative for hiring, salesforce will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

at ring, we come to work every day with the mission of reducing crime in neighborhoods. over the past few years we have learned that when neighbors, the ring team, and law enforcement all work together, we can create safer communities.  the neighbors app was built for this very reason. available to everyone with an ios or android device, neighbors sends you real-time crime and safety alerts from your neighbors, law enforcement, and the ring team. simply put, neighbors is the new neighborhood watch.  the neighbors team is seeking a driven, entrepreneurial product analyst to own and drive deep analysis on important product features to ultimately drive improved retention and product decisions that dramatically scale user growth. in this role, you will work closely with a cross-functional team of engineers, marketers, designers, and product managers to provide insights and deep analysis on retention and growth solutions in a fast-paced environment. responsibilities enable decision-making by retrieving and aggregating data from multiple sources to present it in a digestible and actionable format analyze large data sets using a variety of database query and visualization tools provide technical expertise in extracting, integrating, and analyzing critical data able to anticipate, identify, structure, and solve critical problems design and develop key performance metrics and indicators using standardized and custom reports perform ad hoc analysis to quickly solve time sensitive operational issues and business cases. clearly communicate any ----------------------  quizlet's mission is to help students (and their teachers) practice and master whatever they are learning. every month more than 50 million active learners from 130 countries practice and master more than 300 million study sets on every conceivable topic and subject. we are developing new learning experiences by modeling how students learn and by drawing upon knowledge acquisition, retention, and pedagogy in cognitive science. we are always seeking to help students master any subject by optimizing study efficiency and engagement.  we're looking for a quantitative senior product analyst to drive inquiry and informed product decisions. someone who is passionate about analytics and wants to help shape the future of the product analytics team at quizlet. our team is scrappy, focused on results and self-starters who drive understanding, growth, and success of the product. we serve in a pivotal role, identifying as well as driving inquiry on behalf of leaders at the company.  quizlet is a leading company in consumer learning technology with proven traction and huge growth ahead. our business model is robust with two strong revenue streams — advertisements and paid subscriptions. our ads business allows us to offer amazing study tools to millions of students around the globe for free. our premium subscriptions give students and teachers the ability to create custom content and access learning analytics tools. come help us scale one of the fastest growing and highest quality consumer learning brands, as we develop innovative simple-to-use study tools that help students everywhere.  the role --------   be embedded in a specific product pod and partner with the product manager and engineering lead to go deep into one part of quizlet's business rather than being stretched thin across multiple teams. lead a/b testing through the entire experimentation life cycle, including inception, creation, measurement, and recommendations. explore, develop, and present insights that to the whole company that inform product roadmap and strategy, using one of the world's largest learning science databases. drive maturity and excellence in the way we measure success of our business.  required qualifications -----------------------   advanced sql skills, including highly developed qa skills and ability to write the most efficient, optimized code some experience coding in python experienced, practical knowledge of running a/b tests strong communicator: effectively synthesize, visualize, and communicate your ideas to others deep understanding of the analytics toolkit, including funnels, cohort analyses, long-term trends, user segmentation, regression models, and more. 5+ years of experience in analytics degree in math, physics, statistics, economics, computer science, or other quantitative fields  preferred qualifications ------------------------   experience using google's bigquery ability to run a/b test results in python experience with forecasting and propensity models 2+ years running analytics at a consumer internet company  quizlet's team culture ----------------------  we are here to make education better and more accessible. we strive to improve the lives of students and teachers at every stage and in every setting. we have a bias for action, take initiative, and hustle to deliver results. we make informed decisions whenever possible but are unafraid to take calculated risks on great ideas to promote learning. we embrace challenges and see effort as the path to mastery. we're constantly seeking opportunities to learn and we embrace curiosity. quality matters at quizlet, and we hold the bar high on everything we do. we sweat the details and take personal accountability and pride in anything that carries the quizlet name. we speak up, jump in and work with each other to fix problems, and never say "that's not my job." we treat each other with honesty and respect, encourage vigorous debate, and seek critical feedback. we value diversity, humility, transparency, and collaboration as the best paths to our success — as individuals, as a team, and as a company.  quizlet's success as an online learning community depends on a strong commitment to diversity, equity and inclusion. we are actively working to build a team that is representative of the diverse communities we serve, and an open, inclusive work environment where all employees can thrive. as an equal opportunity employer and a tech company committed to societal change, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. women, people of color, members of the lgbtq+ community, individuals with disabilities, and veterans are strongly encouraged to apply. come join us!
