reporting into the vp, head of marketing, the senior manager, marketing analytics & insights will drive our marketing data, reports, and analytics to provide insights on how to improve marketing initiatives across the organization. the ideal candidate has deep knowledge of marketing and loves to dig into data, polish processes, and is an analytics expert who is adept at uncovering and communicating key takeaways in an understandable way. this role will champion data driven decision making by providing insights into strategic opportunities for the company. responsibilities: be a company expert on marketing data and lead cross-functional projects using advanced data modeling and analysis techniques to discover insights that will guide strategic decisions and uncover optimization opportunities. oversee the design, delivery of reports and insights that analyze business functions and key operations and performance metrics. collaborate with marketing leadership to develop data analytics and marketing strategy, goals, project plans; build models, reports and kpis that lead to better, more impactful insights and business understanding to create an integrated holistic view of marketing success to maximize effectiveness of marketing programs. drive interpretation, socialization and adoption of all marketing learnings/insights and synthesize data from multiple sources to enhance value of performance reporting capabilities and deliverables to drive deeper understanding of customer journeys. prepare and present monthly/quarterly dashboards that help optimize marketing investments, influence strategic priorities and prove the effectiveness, value and roi of marketing initiatives. analyze data collected and communicate results and business impacts of insight initiatives to management. analyze buying cycles, win-loss and lifetime value data to improve marketing and sales strategies. develop graphs, reports, presentations and quality marketing dashboards to track key success metrics for the team and executive leadership. manage the marketing database to ensure data quality and identify the need for data enrichment/cleansing. provide market and competitive evaluation reports in a timely manner by monitoring trends in competitor activity. provide data insights ranging from click attribution to media mix modeling to optimize marketing campaigns on various channels. use excellent technical skills to access information from various structured and unstructured data source. requirements: bachelor’s degree in marketing, marketing research, statistics, mathematics or a related field; mba is highly desired. 7+ years of experience analyzing large datasets; ideally marketing operations deep understanding of the marketing funnel as a whole. a self-starter and true team player able to work independently and brings a positive attitude highly detail-oriented individual who has the ability to influence cross-functional teams. proven ability to work in a fast-paced environment, and to meet changing deadlines and priorities on multiple simultaneous projects. experience using analytics techniques to contribute to company growth efforts, increasing revenue and other key business outcomes. ability to present clear and concise reports/infographics/charts to various audiences; experience with visual reporting and data visualization tools (tableau, etc.). strong leadership, interpersonal, consulting and business partner management skills with extensive experience creating databases and building dashboards using all relevant data to scale decision-making. strong presentation skills that illuminate data insights in ways that ordinary (non-analytics) people can relate to it and use it to improve performance. strong storytelling, presentation design, and verbal communication that delivers the meaning behind the data and builds a ‘narrative’ from the data to drive meaningful discussions with business leaders. strong knowledge of scientific instrument industry marketing strategies. strong organizational, meeting management, and delegation skills. exceptional technical aptitude, qualitative analytical and advanced problem-solving skills with a deep understanding of using data to not only anticipate but answer the right questions to drive systematic growth.

---------------- role description ----------------  marketing analytics uses data for decision-making, accountability, and alignment. they are responsible for the entire analytics lifecycle from partnering with marketers and designing the right campaigns and experiment every single day to consulting with executives and implementing findings and insights. marketing analytics managers also understand the business at the executive level, connect the high level understanding to granular detail, are bias toward action, and use the most advanced analytical tools to bring data and insights into critical decisions at scale for a large marketing team.  you will take ownership of analytics projects and programs that generate and measure quality leads and pipeline for our enterprise sales team and channel marketers. you will partner with key stakeholders within marketing, sales, finance, and other cross-functional teams to establish priorities and timelines and deliver on critical marketing analytics initiatives. you will work in close partnership with marketing operations, data science, and data engineering to guarantee quality data repositories, scalable data infrastructure, sophisticated data modeling, and trustworthy data governance.  -----------------  responsibilities: -----------------   function as primary analytics partner for global sales and channel marketing own datasets, pipelines, and models to measure marketing performance and report to cross-functional partners, including leadership in marketing, sales, finance, and more ensure your numbers are air-tight by performing individual quality control, checking with meaningful data owners, and cross-referencing findings against secondary sources surface analytical insights: dedicatedly investigate root causes of aberrant data, and identify opportunities for optimization lead design and implementation of experimentation to improve channel efficiency, drive growth, and inform marketing investment decisions  -------------  requirements: -------------   4+ years experience in a quantitative discipline deep understanding and mastery of sql data visualization and dashboarding expertise skillful communication of complex analyses to technical and non-technical partners experience working with large data sets to mine insights using statistical analysis bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, statistics, or similar quantitative field  ------------------ benefits and perks ------------------   100% company paid individual medical, dental, & vision insurance coverage 401k + company match market competitive total compensation package free dropbox space for your friends and family wellness reimbursement generous vacation policy 10 company paid holidays volunteer time off company sponsored tech talks (technology and other relevant professional topics)

Job_Description: the role: at roku, data is at the center of everything we do. our passion for data, has made us a leader in the world of data-driven decision-making. leveraging data, the data science and analytics team delivers insight driven outcomes at scale to help roku improve performance. we hire individuals with a passion for data, discovery and innovation to drive results by providing actionable customer-centric insights. the director of analytics is responsible for the growth and development of analytic based products. the analytics team is focused on understanding and optimizing customer behavior as a key enabler for the company to move fast and iterate quickly on big business problems by designing, implementing, executing, and refining advanced analytical approaches as well as staying ahead of industry trends and new solutions.  responsibilities:  unlock insights and guide the business – everything from tactical site optimizations to broad level strategic direction that is grounded in data evidence and heavy analytical rigor. this requires a multidisciplinary blend of analytical experience, strong technical capability, and business strategy, all applied in tandem to discover key insights that lie hidden in roku's device, web and transactional data. lead a team of data analysts to explore & process data from disparate sources, generate actionable insights, drive the use of advanced analytics methods to test hypotheses and perform analytical deep-dives to identify problems, opportunities and actionable insights manage the design, execution, and analysis of a/b or multivariate testing programs; driving rigor, building a testing culture and enhancing measurement capabilities throughout the organization act as a sounding board on testing, media mix optimization, target audience profiling and consumer insights that analyze the relationship between conversions, engagement, revenue and media drivers. directly responsible for all outputs (reporting, analyses, etc) work with multiple complex datasets to analyze and identify key trends, perform statistically sound analytics to evaluate performance and amalgamate information to derive strategic insights and recommendations. build, motivate & mentor a team of data analysts to grow their skills and careers  qualifications:  analytical: you have a fundamental understanding of statistical analysis / marketing analytics / digital optimization / optimization. you have hands-on experience with measurement and analysis of campaigns by applying advanced techniques including brand lift studies, marketing mix models, multi-touch attribution, and cross-platform analytics to derive actionable insights. you can work with sql, hive, tableau, looker innovation: you continually research and evaluate emerging technologies. you design and run experiments, research new methods, and find new ways of optimizing risk, profitability, and customer experience. fundamentally, you disrupt and deliver a better way, consistently. production: you develop and implement analytical solutions that the business (as your customer) can seamlessly integrate into decision making. you are passionate about problem solving and constantly exploring customer needs and drive towards impactful business outcomes. leadership: you lead by example. you are a role model for your team. your team knows their priorities as does executive leadership. you have experience mentoring junior data scientists and providing technical governance and oversight. you are tenacious and are always moving the ball forward. communication: you communicate complex ideas clearly and simply. you can tell a data story with the aid of data visualization to aid understanding. you must be able to think "beyond the numbers" to deliver business relevant recommendations with audience in mind. experience: you have a bachelor's degree or higher. you have 10+ years of experience in a highly analytical role. you have 8+ years of experience developing data driven strategies and analytics leveraging one or more of the following: operations research, statistical modeling, marketing analytics, digital analytics, pricing optimization. education: you have strong educational credentials in mba, math, statistic, economics, operation research, data science, computer science or related quantitate field  technical experience/qualifications:  7+ years relevant experience corporate metrics and data analytics ability to work in a big data environment (hivesql) some coding ability in r or python is a plus data oriented problem solving and experience building visualizations proven track record of defining and executing key analyses with minimal supervision strong problem structuring skills with a proficiency in hypothesis-based problem solving ability to understand complex business drivers, produce high-quality analytics and communicate results effectively strong analytical and quantitative skills background in tech and media industries preferred highest standards of accuracy and precision; highly organized curious; a constant learner with a relentless drive to acquire knowledge and new skill sets expert level knowledge of microsoft excel and powerpoint expert in turning data into a clear story experience leading a high preforming team of analysts educational background in a technical field  #li-ss1 -------

minimum qualifications: bachelor's degree or equivalent practical experience.  10 years of experience in marketing analytics, consulting, advertising sales, digital media, or financial analysis.  3 years of experience in people management, analytics, and business intelligence development, as a collaborator scoping bi requirements, or as an analyst delivering on those requirements.  experience writing sql queries on datasets, with experience both strategizing at a high-level and digging into data.  preferred qualifications: experience driving growth through push (email and mobile) notification marketing campaigns.  demonstrated analytical background and experience with marketing analytics, return on investment/financial modeling, media-mix models and statistical analysis in r or python.  demonstrated ability to interact with and influence stakeholders at all levels (business-focused and technical) of an organization.  demonstrated storytelling, presentation design, and verbal communication skills. about the job the business strategy & operations organization provides business critical insights using analytics, ensures cross functional alignment of goals and execution, and helps teams drive strategic partnerships and new initiatives forward. we stay focused on aligning the highest-level company priorities with effective day-to-day operations, and help evolve early stage ideas into future-growth initiatives.  google play is at the heart of the android ecosystem, providing the apps, games, and digital content that bring android devices to life. the mission of our growth marketing team is to create marketing programs that cultivate valuable relationships with our diverse user base, increasing engagement and building happier users. you'll bring deep strategic thinking skills and technical depth to the role, and have a talent for framing ambiguous problems into actionable insights. you also have sharp analytical abilities and understand how to use data not only to ask and answer the right questions, but also to craft an experimental program to drive systematic growth. you have experience building dashboards and data architecture to scale decision-making in the teams you support. you’re naturally collaborative, and have a track record of influencing cross-functionally to land major cross-functional projects. know the user. know the magic. connect the two. at its core, marketing at google starts with technology and ends with the user, bringing both together in unconventional ways. our job is to demonstrate how google's products solve the world's problems--from the everyday to the epic, from the mundane to the monumental. and we approach marketing in a way that only google can--changing the game, redefining the medium, making the user the priority, and ultimately, letting the technology speak for itself. responsibilities  use your knowledge of data analytics and marketing strategy to maximize effectiveness of google play growth marketing programs.  coach a small team of analysts to develop business and analytics skills, partner with marketing teams to drive growth, cultivate best practices, enforce standards, improve analytics discoverability and usability.  develop and/or oversee development of growth marketing dashboard suites, business intelligence pipelines, and data management best practices.  advise partner teams on methodologies for marketing analytics, measurement and attribution. seek out key decision makers, challenge the status quo and influence decisions.  collaborate with engineering teams on projects in machine learning and in business intelligence development. be a translator between business, technical, and quantitative worlds. at google, we don’t just accept difference—we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products and our community. google is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. we are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or veteran status. we also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. see also google's eeo policy and eeo is the law. if you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know by completing this form .

beneficial reporting strategy and ensuring best practices are maintained. the ideal candidate will have at least 5 years of relevant experience, plus experience managing multiple platforms and bi solutions manage the implementation of business intelligence road maps demonstrate up-to-date expertise and apply this to the development, execution and improvement of action plans manage and maintain current internal and external business intelligence and reporting needs research newer or better technologies (including but not limited to hadoop or other big data platforms) to make our business while providing strategic solutions to modcloth’s broader company initiatives and areas of focus advise reporting tool power users on best practices for information delivery solutions work with the edw delivery team to ensure that reporting requirements are met in edw delivery work streams work with database administrators to ensure that databases feeding the reports are tuned for optimal performance model compliance with company policies and procedures and support company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity manage a team of business intelligence professionals you have... a bachelor's degree in information technology or related field 5 years’ direct experience managing multiple platforms and bi tools, tableau is preferred excellent knowledge of database design, sql, data warehousing and business intelligence solutions the ability to motivate and inspire team members excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to present complex topics in terms relatable to business partners the ability to facilitate productive meetings demonstrated the ability to solve problems, determine appropriate actions and complete projects with little direction the ability to meet tight deadlines and thrive in a multi-project environment, while ensuring production systems are up and performing well we’re building a new kind of company and culture, and we’re building it from the inside out. we are investing in hiring, developing, and retaining the brightest minds in the world. everything we do is grounded in our core values: integrity, empathy, intellectual honesty and spirit of creativity & innovation.

this is a full-time, direct-hire, permanent position. in this position, the bi manager will be working with direct reports to promote engagement success and employee growth. in addition to management responsibilities, the bi manager will typically be working as part of a larger development team specifically focused on the data/bi aspects of various projects. development responsibilities (50%): full implementation lifecycle from requirements gathering from end users, technology selection, prototyping, development, and release. projects include developing ssis packages for etl and data manipulation processes. oltp database design, performance tuning and security model implementations. successful implementations of data marts and data warehouses with design/maintenance of ssas olap cubes. ssrs report creation. management responsibilities (50%): perform weekly 1 on 1 meetings with direct reports that identify best practices and areas for improvement. identify employee opportunities for improvement; proactively mentor employees to get better. ensure that training is planned and delivered based on need. hold a rich and thoughtful annual career discussion with all direct reports. understand and look for career objective aligned opportunities for all direct reports. understand career motivations of team. regularly visit employees on local accounts, to maintain terminations, in conjunction with hr. participate in on site/in-person termination meetings when appropriate. conduct exit interviews. manage the performance review process for all staff ensuring on-time completion. process paid time off (pto) request per guidelines. work with all direct reports to ensure they understand the “big picture” of their project and help achieve stakeholder success. technical qualifications: 5-10 years overall development experience (microsoft bi stack technologies).  bi product experience working with sql server, ssas, ssis, ssrs, moss, powerbi, tableau, excel and other client side tools.  proficiency writing sql queries, manipulating data and transforms, and interacting with services.  extensive experience with data analysis and design working with data, data marts, and etl, data transformation, normalization or consolidation patterns.  experience implementing and extending microsoft stack technologies using on-premise and hosted solutions for azure, sharepoint, iis, sql, and dynamics crm additional qualifications: experience leading a development group or team. experience working with offshore development groups to drive scaled development. ability to act as a mentor to develop junior developers/mid-level developers. demonstrate strong leadership and communication skills, (ability to provide direct and succinct communications to management, leadership and client). excellent client-facing skills. ability work on several projects simultaneously and know where to add value, and when to delegate, guide or take ownership. demonstrate excellent problem solving, troubleshooting and debugging skills, and attention to details. ability to translate business requirements into design specifications and drive through development rhythms. demonstrated expertise with the software development life cycle bachelor of science or associates degree in computer science, information technology or related subject microsoft certifications (sql) exsilio's success is grounded in the perfect balance of size and ability; we have the capacity to expertly handle many large enterprise accounts while still being able to move on opportunities to stay active in the industry whether it be participating in design competitions and hackathons or showcasing your talents in videos, podcasts or blog form. you’re a rockstar, let us give you a stage.

problem solving, unit testing, and debugging skills comfortable with data modeling and strategizing to bring online new data sources used in downstream processing. knowledge of ux and visualization qualitative and quantitative analysis relating to operational functions, workflow, processes, and other business related issues. obtain quantitative and qualitative data of business processes to and assess business strategies and opportunities; develop appropriate analytical approaches processing, cleansing, validating the integrity of data used for analysis doing ad-hoc analysis and presenting results in a clear manner creating automated anomaly detection systems and constant tracking of its performance selecting features, building and optimizing classifiers using machine learning techniques analytical skills: a major part of the job is to determine what data trends mean. being able to analyze the data is crucial. communication skills: once the data is analyzed, business intelligence analysts must communicate their findings to the company or their managers. problem-solving: business intelligence analysts need to look at the data trends and recommend solutions for creating more revenue and reducing loss time management: business intelligence analysts work on large projects and many data streams and many deadlines. being able to juggle it all is crucial to the job performs other duties as assigned education/experience:  bachelor's degree with four to eight years’ industry experience or equivalent experience 4+ years creating dashboards with data the analytics team develops processes and tools to facilitate the delivery of data, providing data-consumers with the insights and analysis necessary for evaluation of strategic and operational business decisions.  the bi analyst delivers reporting solutions packaged for business use.  responsibilities  communicates with project stakeholders to understand underlying business logic and reporting requirements contributes to design, development, and maintenance of business intelligence tools develops visualizations optimized for use-case—builds necessary ‘views’ to support visualizations from database/datalake layer provides tools/analysis that identifies key performance indicators and correctly diagnose root cause of problems presents tools/analysis to project stakeholders required skills & experience  bs in computer science, statistics, business/economics, or related field (strongly preferred) working experience in business intelligence, analytics, or related role recent experience in statistical languages (r/python, sql) strongly preferred tableau/powerbi/qlik experience is a big plus exceptional analytical business skills: proven working experience producing actionable business insights from data analysis excellent communication and presentation skills: ability to distill and present actionable information from complex workflows, models, and analyses personal qualities  passion for identifying patterns and trends within data tenacity and resourcefulness to find, learn, and utilize the best data/tools for the job to apply for this position, please email your resume to career2@meridianlink.com and include the position title in the subject line.  meridianlink is an equal opportunity employer. we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, sex, age, national origin, disability or any other characteristic protected by applicable law. meridianlink runs a comprehensive background check, credit check and drug test as part of our offer process.

is playing with data and teaching business stakeholders how to use it effectively your idea of a fun career? as our business intelligence analyst at verve, your main focus will be to design, implement, and document a business intelligence system for pollen, our new b2c marketplace. as the sole bi analyst based in our los angeles office, you will join a small, agile, and geographically-dispersed bi team in facilitating a company culture of better decision-making. you will work cross-functionally with managers, team leads, and data-hungry employees to provide digestible, impactful, and actionable business insights. your mission is to cultivate an expert familiarity with our distinct business processes and flows, with the ultimate goal of empowering employees with the insights necessary to excel. combining your business acumen with your unparalleled knowledge of our multiple underlying data models, you will build flexible reports and dashboards. these tools will be optimized to serve most day-to-day business needs and will ensure that our deliverables meet the highest possible caliber of data integrity. intrigued? read on for more details.  what will you achieve in the next 12 months? observe data needs and usage across departments and keep your colleagues informed of the latest improvements in our data reporting systems. by doing so, you will be the eyes, ears, and voice of business intelligence in north america for our pollen group. build, maintain, and improve upon models and dashboards in looker, ensuring that every team feels confident in finding what they need and is informed in their decision-making. consistent and thorough documentation of key fields and tables will be essential for driving engagement within the organization. prepare comprehensive reports and analyses in response to ad hoc data and insight requests and as part of your own explorative curiosity. work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure that data and reporting in our systems is accurate and effective requirements what skills will you need most? this role will require someone to be especially strong in these areas: problem solving and analytical abilities: the ability to understand a problem, break it down and execute to provide the answer. beyond analyzing the problem in its own right, you must be able to triage incoming problems and discern the relative importance and urgency of new and existing problems in order to prioritize your work effectively. working with complex sql statements and lookml files. proactive communication. if you've done apis in python or with other back-end languages such as java or c++, such skills are highly desirable. if you've used looker or similar bi tools, we'd definitely like to talk! benefits verve is building a platform which enables our global network of advocates to sell products and services they love to their friends in exchange for unique experiences and rewards. we‘ve established a beachhead in live entertainment and work with some of the biggest events in the world, and are rapidly expanding our festival and event portfolio across the u.s., uk, europe, and australasia. as we continue to expand rapidly within this market, we’re also developing and launching exciting new technology for events to connect directly with their biggest fans. at verve we believe in a culture of freedom and ownership. we empower you to own the value you create and impact on our future success. and we believe that to act as an owner you should be empowered to work in the way that enables you to deliver the best results – how and when you do is up to you. you choose your hours, where you work, the meetings you attend and the amount of holiday to take in order to create the most value and be at your best.
